Review: your first clue that something is not gonna be quite right the movie you are about see it is heavily christmasthemed and its release date is oh say at the end of february your second clue that something is not gonna be quite right the movie you are about see charlize theron one of the movies dubious stars makes an appearance on the daily show in when asked if her new movies any good she replies the equivalent of verbal sigh assuring us that yeah it sure is movie all right and there is some scenes like those you would expect find in movie and there is some action and there is other stuff too how immediately grab my attention open your movie five dead guys in santa claus suits then show caption reading six days earlier ya know was honestly interested find out what killed all those poor santas how immediately lose my attention follow your opening scene terminally dull niceguyswhodo notdeservetobeinprison scene write line for the one of prisoners like just want go home and eat christmas dinner and watch some ball my dad then have ben affleck actually say that line on and forget leave it on the cutting room floor for good measure throw in poorly motivated prison riot and have afflecks best buddy stabbed aw and just two days before his release too already the cliches are piled on thick and when it rains it pours how take my attention dash it violently against the rocks and make it so that am contemplating my strategy for calling shotgun about an hour before know the credits will roll deny your characters the ability think have ben affleck for some reason will never understand pretend he is his dead prison buddy so that he can get his girlfriend played charlize theron have gary sinise show up and force the two of them participate in poorly planned casino heist the villains big idea kidnap affleck because he used be security guard at the casino force him tell you where all the doors in the place are then dress up in santa suits create some diversions and rob the place on paper it seems like the stuff of potential caper comedy but veteran director john frankenheimer wrongly picks up that piece of paper and thinks he is looking at the makings for some sort of clever actioncrime thriller it is not like the man is not capable far from it he is the man responsible for classic political thrillers like the manchurian candidate and seven days in may he wowed me some the most memorable car chases have ever seen in last years ronin but he is certainly guilty of churning out some certifiable losers put reindeer games on the shelf of shame his version of the island of dr moreau step one in making your movie as easily forgotten as possible cast ben affleck in the role of the worlds most generic hero he gets no good oneliners he does not get shoot or implode anything in new and interesting ways and all we know about him is that he regrets his past as car thief and wants cup of hot chocolate and piece of pecan pie his name is rudy short for rudolph in all likelihood see it is called reindeer games get it get it shut up in the past affleck has been at his best as supporting actor and reindeer games does nothing further his viability as leading man step two in making your movie as easily forgotten as possible gary sinises villain dresses and looks like the most standard movie crook filmmaker could have some up he is dirty and pottymouthed he is got long scruffy hair and goatee and fully expected him walk out of the casino carrying sacks giant dollar signs on them he is also extremely inept at what he does he thinks garish cowboy costumes and santa suits make acceptable disguises and he trusts afflecks character pull through even after time and time and time again he tricks him and lies him and nearly kills him but instead of tapping into the comic possibilities of this role sinise seems think he is playing some sort of tough smart and smooth criminal mastermind rather than the complete moron that was obviously written into the script on side note gary sinise wins this weeks title award as he is the one who gets awkwardly cram the name of the movie into one of his lines early in the proceedings last weeks winner was natasha henstridge for the whole nine yards how take your bad idea and make things worse include two or three plot twists that instead of making the apparently stupidity of the plan seem suddenly intelligent make the plan seem even more ridiculous and unlikely this is bad movie and what is worse is that except for few moments near the notsostunning conclusion as the preposterous is replaced the ludicrously preposterous reindeer games never really gives us the satisfaction of being laughably bad if they would done that much at least would have been entertained

carry on at your convenience is all about the goingson in the factory of toilet manufacturer wc boggs kenneth williams once they have won an order manufacture bidets in two months and charles coote charles hawtrey has designed suitable model the factory employees set work but are interrupted union representative vic spanner kenneth cope and friend bernie hulke bernard bresslaw who call them out on strikes on the slightest pretext meanwhile chief foreman sid plummer sid james is growing tired of his wife beattie hattie jacques and her budgie he would much rather live next door fellow boggs worker chloe moore joan sims but once he discovers that the budgie can predict the winners of horse races he is over the moon and flush money his daughter myrtle plummer jacki piper is going out wcs son lewis boggs richard ocallaghan and this causes conflict on the staff day out the seaside when vic spanner vies for her attentions in the end if the strike does not cease boggs will have close down his factory but the support of group of women led cootes wifetobe and spanners mother agatha spanner renee houston try resolve the situation also sid realises that his budgie has caused him nothing but trouble since it started predicting horse race winners there are some good performances as usual from sid james and kenneth williams in their standard roles charles hawtrey is third billing but only appears in few scenes his part is mildly amusing richard ocallaghan is appealing as boggs stuckup son patsy rowlands is funny as miss withering boggs assistant and renee houston is terrific in her small part as agatha however sole acting honours go hattie jacques as beattie plummer although her character is not directly involved the main storyline she manages input great deal of pathos and feeling into her character marvellous performance from marvellous actress the suffers from annoying performances bernard bresslaw and especially kenneth cope in his carry on debut cope overdoes his role as spanner making him so annoying as be unfunny joan sims returns as the love interest instead of barbara windsor sims usual part as the downtrodden wife was taken hattie jacques additionally bill maynard as fred moore is very poor this carry on movie tries it best entertain the viewer the locations and wealth of characters are appealing however the toilet humour becomes tiresome very quickly and some of the performances leave lot be desired this movie does not know where it is going it was made in and talbot rothwell the scriptwriter seems be in two minds whether go for bluer jokes or maintain the innocent jokes success of most of its predecessors that is why this suffers minor carry on whose major asset is the performance hattie jacques the new minorregulars such as ocallaghan and piper are not able enliven the movie and the toilet humour becomes humourless after while

the tagline for this is some houses are just born bad so did not expect too much from this but had preserved little spark of ope as entered the theatre thought liam neeson cathrine zeta jones and jan de bont thought mabe it will be fun and in fact the beginning was rather intriguing but the end of it thought why liam neeson and cathrine zeta jones jan de bont these great actors are basically helpless this muddled mess that defies any rationality here is the story in the monstrously overdecorated mansion known as hill house visitors are tricked an unknown doctor liam neeson into being guinea pigs in fright experiment under the guise of an insomnia investigation among them is sophisticated bisexual cathrine zeta jones cynical dope owen wilson and gentle and emotional lady lily taylor actually the doctor is researching the primordial fear reaction and intends plant disturbing ideas in his subjects and watch what happens but he gets unexpected help from the house itself it rumbles hums and belches forth remarkable sights portals become veiny stainedglass eyeballs fireplace guarded stone lions gapes like sinister mouth filmy cherubic spirits take shape under sheets and billowy curtains but the computerized spooketeria rarely feels real placing an emotional wall between audience and screen the second half of the is basically about the main heroine running back and forth from the sinister lamps and evil furniture is that exciting or what the worst thing about it is that it did not have be bad it is based on great book the haunting of hill house shirley jackson adaptation of the book was scary and intelligent it played the greatest fears of our sub conscience the blair witch project that cost less than an old car managed shock and terrify the audiences from their senses and mill budget de bont and screenwriter david self make hash out of perfectly lovely piece of terror de bont has style of filmmaking so out of line the material that it is in itself frightening he is the master of the extravagant special effect and the big visual adrenaline rush but why give him more serious material in the end haunting will only haunt its fledgling studio dream works skg and de bonts career as director yet it would not be fair say that everything is bad the effects are truly impressive and the house is wonderfully decorated beautiful mysterious magical and spooky but this is where the good things end the music is blaring the floors moving the ceiling morphing and the pictures on the walls screaming and all of this every second every moment of screen time is absolutely without life it is nothing more than special effectsextravaganza visually impressive but intellectually hollow thriller that simply does not engage at first you do not know what is going on is this part of the experiment are these hallucinations projections of the subconscience paranoia but in the end it shows out that this is actually happening the house is actually possessed it is at that point when all your hopes for good entertainment disappears out of the window for ever sat in anticipation for decent climax and that is what got believe hichock once said that it is better wait for climax than see one this may be true and it might actually work but there is only one problem jan de bont is not hichock and the things that he shows are not scary only stupid they are impossible take seriously any paralells that you might have heard before linking this picture kubricks the shining are absolutely baseless shining had class style story acting but most of all talent and originality haunting has only special effects and art direction boast of and those elements alone are not enough make it good casting good actors for small pale parts only makes things worse but guess that no matter what or other critics say or write most of you will see this anyway even if the tagline would say some films are just born stupid

the title is taken from the writings of ralph waldo emerson describing the life of traveler as anywhere but here there is not one thing about this motherdaughter relationship melodrama that felt honest it relies on contrived minor character tell both mother and daughter what was obvious do in order straighten out their dysfunctional lives as for some reason they could not figure it out for themselves if the looks familiar that is because the slums of beverly hills went over the same ground but was fortunate be more comical and perceptive due alan arkin and natasha lyonne performances in they were fortunate have much sharper script work alvin sargents script was weak and annoyingly claustral wayne wangs the joy luck club inept direction made weak script even weaker his inability tell the story unfolding without the voiceover relating what the action could not convey pushy mother adele august susan sarandon forces her yearold daughter ann natalie portman leave small midwestern burg go crosscountry her beverly hills the daughter resents her twice divorced unstable but exotic schoolteacher mother bullying her be an actress as means of escaping humdrum life the daqughter does not even like the used gold mercedes mother buys drive lala land in and cannot stand the beach boys records mom enjoys hearing on the car radio so it becomes question of who knows best as the ladies fight it out between them until the predictable sweet ending comes in this yawner adeles dream of greener pastures in beverly hills soon does not look that good as she lands job in slum school has her precious car scratched the unruly kids and settles into job she hates in order financially survive daughter pines for small town wisconsin and her friends there during one of many arguments her freespirited mom they go for ice cream and while mother is being ticketed she runs away only be chased down friendly traffic cop michael milhoan who offers her wise counsel the cops zen wisdom passed onto the daughter she will survive living in many different addresses in beverly hills until she reaches and then she plans get way from mom using her good grades go brown university instead of ucla during their stay in beverly hills she grows from feeling awkward in beverly hills high immediately having many high school girlfriends and even high school rich boy admirer t eliot corbin allred reader but the transition of her life into beverly hills had no feel of reality as everything seemed staged and unemotional when she learns her cousin benny shawn hatosy who happens be her best friend dies in traffic accident back in wisconsin she returns for the funeral and in those reunion scenes it was not clearly shown why she wants stay there and for that matter it was never made clear why the mother wants leave so badly the is one big battle of wills between mother and daughter over their dreams guess what the filmmaker is trying say is that mom is bad dreamer and the daughter is the observant one able recognize mothers faults when not in growing pains and in need of parenting herself mother has series of setbacks like being dumped her dreamboat dentist bochner she met on the beach and witnessing her daughter mimic her whiny optimistic sayings when trying out for an acting part but mother learns that her daughter has grownup and is independent and that she has stop living her life through her she learns this when the same wise cop who told ann what do is about ticket her and this time will remind the mother of the right thing do this of course results in the corny ending showing that moms heart was always in the right place only she went about it in the wrong way this was just one of those films where you want be anywhere but in the theater where this is showing

tomb raider fun exciting challenging given the unprecedented popularity especially among teenage boys of the video game that sports an uberbuff pistol packin babe who raids well tombs you have believe it is these three things and more lara croft tomb raider the big screen variant of said video game features pumpedup angelina jolie the oscar winner for girl interrupted no less in the title role is however none of these things it is not fun it is not exciting and the only challenge is seeing how long you can stay in your seat suffered through the bitter bitter end the wife opted for barnes noble at the minute mark directed simon west the same subtlety he brought con air tomb raider is an emptyheaded big budget bore the story borrows unintelligently from that mother of all turkeys hudson hawk the same hokum about planetary alignments and sacred stones that when brought together well who the heck cares and it makes super mario bros bob hoskins illadvised career move look like rocco and his brothers that classic of italian neorealism will go out on limb here and say suspect there is actually more character development in the video game than the movie proper this is where the jolie defendersvideo game nuts jump in and say this movie is not about character development it is about kicking serious butt or bum since ms croft hails from englands green and pleasant lips breasts and biceps all inflated the max lara croft is all about posturing and jolie has hard time simply standing still without trying look tough ok let us forget challenging should not tomb raider be at the very least fun and exciting should not our buttkicking heroine also encompass the sophistication of say james bond the wit of indiana jones there is no humor be found anywhere in tomb raider even though it tries hard from time time even the mummy returns did not take itself too seriously the villain here is noticeably lacking the special effects are ridiculously overblown and unnecessarily complicated and the script is nonexistent liven things up perhaps jolies live father jon voight puts in few minutes as laras dead father lord croft talk about stretch one thing had not expected from the is that jolie affects slightly better english accent than her pa although suspect that thinlooking moustache he is forced wear gets in the way some unsuccessful not entirely if anything lara croft tomb raider makes you want check out the video game itself figure out exactly what all the fuss was about

walt disney studios may have finally met its match the lush animation in twentieth century foxs anastasia but judging the latest efforts from the don bluth studios the visuals are the only thing fox has brag about disneys recent classics have occasionally stretched credibility in such films as pocahontas the hunchback of notre dame and lesser extent hercules anastasia fox has gone so far as throw all facts completely out the window some may say so what it is just kids movie well if you have young kids beware as they may be noticeably frightened the visuals of corpserotting rasputin zombie whose body parts continually fall off in disconcertingly real way consider yourselves warned nevertheless the animation is quite stunning at times don bluth has used computer animation extensively throughout occasionally rivalling photographic quality and yet in other scenes the handdrawn material seems of the saturdaymorning tv crowd leads me wonder was this rushed market combat disney the plot as anyone who had read history before knows concerns the attempt return anastasia her royal family after she was lost in the overthrow of the romanovs in not that anastasia is much concerned what really happened as for the plot go rent disneys candleshoe you will see of anastasia there

heres something chew on what is the favorite food of big cheesylooking special effects monsters like the one lurking in the bowels of luxury liner in deep rising the obvious answer this question is cardboard because that is the depth of the most fully developed character in this painfully generic creature feature deep rising demonstrates all the originality and vitality of something scripted computer in fact considering the rigid adherence the expected formulas perhaps it was the most astonishing thing about deep rising is the exceptionally high level of gore not since starship troopers have this many chunks of flesh both human and nonhuman been scattered in all directions we learn some bloody trivia as well such as how sea monster spraypaints in red it drinks human being then spits out the liquefied remains and what it does halfdigested leftovers suppose deep risings gallery of grotesque images represents fun stuff for those who love the macabre but it does not do much for me on the surface and that is about the only level at this can be analyzed deep rising feels like tremors grafted onto titanic everyone else is citing the equally valid alienstitanic connection since james cameron directed both in going for the big disaster angle of titanic and the tongueincheek mayhem of tremors deep rising somehow misses both marks wide margin the is not humorous tense or exciting in fact it is downright boring and despite being half the length of camerons current boxoffice champ deep rising feels like the longer movie is it really necessary say anything about the plot probably not since it is easy guess but will go ahead and oblige anyone who wants synopsis the opens introducing us gang of bad guys on board mercenary ship in addition the usual cast of psychopaths and lunatics there is finnegan treat williams the boats pilot who is supposed be an indiana jones knockoff joey kevin oconnor the inept sidekick who is supposed be lovable and funny but is really just irritating and hanover wes studi the mastermind and use that term lightly of the operation their goal attack cruise ship clean out the safe then sink it using some illegallyacquired torpedoes the problem is the time they reach the argonautica the titaniclike luxury liner has turned into the marie celeste aside from beautiful jewel thief famke janssen and couple of crew members there is no one on board the reason soon becomes obvious the ship has been taken over bad special effect that is supposed resemble an octopus teeth and more than eight tentacles the cast is led treat williams is primarily comprised of hasbeens and probablyneverwillbes two exceptions wes studi best known as the villain in the last of the mohicans and djimon hounsou amistads cinque williams once cannot miss prospect in has fallen so far out of favor that the best he can do these days for lead role is like deep rising and his inability create charismatic or interesting figure here may sink whatever is left of his sputtering career famke janssen who will forever be known as xenia onatopp from goldeneye is the perfect bland match for williams given her limited acting abilities it is likely that she was chosen for this part primarily on the basis of her physical attributes unfortunately bra defeats the purpose of having her in wet teeshirt for half of the picture meanwhile kevin oconnor who has entirely too much screen time exhibits all the appeal of fingernails scratching blackboard these days audiences are becoming more difficult impress computergenerated special effects this is lesson that writerdirector stephen sommers who previously helmed the liveaction jungle book needs learn the days of jurassic park when viewers were astounded the mere spectacle of seeing something big and imposing on screen are past now moviegoers are looking for the sophistication of titanic visuals that are so wellincorporated that it is impossible tell where they end and where reality begins in deep rising the monster like everything is artificial and unconvincing unfortunately the fundamental problem audiences are faced here is not so much the idiotic monotony of this individual picture but the poor quality of the entire bankrupt genre although be fair deep rising is particularly bad entry even once this has sunk out of sight the knowledgeable viewer knows it will not be the last of its kind like the slimy slithering things that inhabit the air vents and pipes of these movies more are waiting just around the corner in ambush and that consideration unlike anything on screen is truly horrifying

this is an adaptation of g wells acclaimed novel the invisible man the actors are kevin beacon and elizabeth shue the director is paul verhoven that plus quick demonstration of the amazing special effects in the trailer should be enough lure us into the theatre the problem is keep us there cannot imagine anyone who would like see this movie second time working on top secret military project sebastian caine kevin beacon an eccentric genius that calls himself god has discovered the secret invisibility the first two faces are completed now it is time for the next logical step human caine volunteers for this risky experiment but when he is made invisible something goes wrong while his exgirlfriend linda elisabeth shue desperately tries find something return him normal he learns that invisibility is more of prison than superpower but that is not the bad thing an unexpected sideeffect of the drug sends him careening into paranoid megalomania he is naturally given couple of modest superpowers just enough for him survive immolation from flame thrower and an explosion of about quart of nitroglycerine soon every sense of decency is forgotten the little intelligence that was left disappears as verhoven looses control and the turns into an alienripoff where caine is walking like half finished terminator spooking scaring and killing everybody though it is based on novel called the invisible man the title has been ironically changed hollow man that sums up the very nicely this is very silly production laughable actually apparently verhovens imagination does not stretch too far for him the only worthwhile reason become invisible is so you can case the girls locker room undetected it is this primitive schoolboy mentality that eventually kills the movie being invisible gives you the opportunity be who you are do what you want without being influenced society in many ways it gives you an illusion of having life without consequences the nature of man and his place in society is what the novel is truly about all that the depth and true horror of the book is gone and only special effects make you remain in your seat caine does use his power voyeuristically in hollow man but since this is modernization in other words dehumanization he does not stop there he becomes rapist and then of course murderer you will start wondering why such actors as beacon and shue found themselves in such in the first place shues talent is barely seen josh brolin is underused and the rest of the cast suffer mostly for the lack of talent kevin beacon is the only one that performs gracefully his face is not seen for the most part of the and the only way he exists is as disembodied voice there are times when his presence actually saves the from being completely embarrassing in the end the effects are the only reason see this in the first place being probably the best technical achievement since jurassic park they are absolutely amazing we observe the layers of skin muscle tissue and bone being peeled away as body is slowly rendered invisible we see beating heart inflating lungs and veins pulsing newlypumped blood there are couple of inventive shots smoke fire air and water but are few scenes like that worth attending movie for what is truly disturbing is that great book talented actors and grand budget this could have been so much more pretty much like jan de bont twister haunting paul verhoven has never made anything extraordinary he was responsible for several good films basic instinct and starship troopers and some incredibly bad films showgirls total recall but he has never made anything that was great in way hollow man fits perfectly in this collection it is not better or worse than verhovens average he proves once again that he is incapable of handling more complex issues and so instead of depth and chills verhoven inserts some of his trademarks stupid dialogue and lots of dull action blood and naked bodies he even throws in some of the worst of clich the slowly advancing fireball the villain who comes back from the dead etc etc and tops the whole thing off one of the most ridiculous endings of the year you will be screaming nooooo and attempt run towards the exit in slow motion and all we can ask is why the answer is simple though is movie producing machine the business of moviemaking has be about something more than money it has be about telling stories not marketing them it has be about transporting us different place dazzle us magic and cleverness make us care make us think and feel verhoven has obviously missed that point and this is proof of that it is all flesh and bones but no soul void where its imagination should be

eddie murphy has lot riding on harlem nights as the movies writer director executive producer and star murphy will shoulder all of the blame if harlem nights fails but at the same time he will receive all of the credit if it succeeds should you sacrifice your hardearned cash support murphys risky gamble well that depends on whom you trust more me or eddie murphy heres what murphy thinks think the audience is expecting good time they gonna get sexy they gonna get funny they gonna get drama they gonna get all of that think it is the best movie have done paramount radio network heres what think harlem nights is charmless unoriginal disappointing and almost without question the worst of the actors career have not seen best defense and guess who is blame the movies problem is not murphys direction harlem nights is fairly good looking no the project was probably doomed even before the cameras rolled murphys awful script is the culprit let us count the mistakes he makes in his first attempt at screenwriting murphy shatters the record for the most profanity in motion picture yes he even outdoes his own work in raw practically every line of dialogue in harlem nights contains at least one four letter word and after minutes it gets irritating murphy wastes the talents of his fine cast richard pryor redd foxx michael lerner and della reese face the impossible task of carving out credible characters from script riddled stereotypes each of them shines occasionally but basically what we have are good performers stuck in bad vehicle the movie demeans women depicting them solely as sexual objects and as pawns in power struggles between men murphy has admitted in interviews that he is weary of women in his private life is really neither here nor there but when murphy puts his bitter feelings on movie screens across the country it is another matter altogether you are forced swallow some pretty gruesome stuff for instance murphy punches della reese in the stomach and he shoots jasmine guy in the head this is meanspirited movie folks lovely newcomer lela rochon gets off easy in her role as common whore but only because she does not have any scenes murphy thank god he might have run her over bulldozer murphy has written for himself perhaps his blandest role date the loveable eddie murphy charisma emerges only once or twice during the murphy would rather give his character spiffy wardrobe than spiffy personality sometimes it seems as if murphy made harlem nights just so he could wear fancy suits and look debonair the plot is shameless ripoff of the sting if you are going make another sting movie you have got do something original murphys tale of warring nightclub owners in harlem circa fails add anything new the formula get laughs murphy makes fun of stuttering you know comedy is digging deep when it resorts ridiculing the handicapped murphys idea of drama is scene in his character apologizes for the first time in his life for what for shooting reeses little toe off needless say murphy shows little if any promise or imagination as screenwriter in all fairness however few rays of sunshine do manage break through the gloomy cloud surrounding the movie danny aiello is fun watch as dirty cop on the take aiello stands out in the large ensemble cast he obviously relishes the opportunity play such nasty character racist detective mob ties aiellos zesty performance gives harlem nights some much needed spice another bright spot is arsenio hall who has hilarious showstopping cameo as crybaby gangster hall virtually steals the spotlight from murphy in fact halls ten minutes on screen are the funniest ten minutes in the movie unfortunately his character is completely irrelevant the plot murphy should have given hall much bigger role of course have already mentioned that did not care for murphys character but have admit that did love his neckties they are simply spectacularalmost worth the price of admission

because no one demanded it david duchovny in romantic comedy at last both his romantic magnetism and his comedic brilliance are mined for all their resources the choice of duchovny may have something do the plot could be fodder for valentines day episode of the xfiles bob rueland david duchovny loses his wife elizabeth joely richardson in car accident at the same time grace briggs minnie driver is in the hospital waiting for heart transplant grace gets elizabeths heart and it leads her bob it is the romantic equivalent of all those horror films where someone gets transplant from serial killer and then is driven slaughter people four writers are credited contributing the story that does not seem possible despite being solid two hours long return me adds little the boy meets girl boy loses girl formula and as result is terribly tedious and slowmoving duchovny and driver seem unable generate any sparks and kept wishing for fastforward button move their scenes along since driver has managed work well in romantic roles before blame duchovny he is out of his element without the manufactured and static sexual tension of his tv series and have always thought that the relationship between mulder and scully on the xfiles comes off more siblinglike than hotandbothered there is something about duchovny that makes me uneasy regardless of the role he is playing he comes off as weirdo the only redeeming quality of return me is its hilarious supporting cast the circle of friends and relatives around bob and grace is constantly playing matchmaker and they generate the only laughs in the movie carroll oconnor is graces grandfather marty oreilly when bob comes into martys restaurant after hours marty immediately begins quizzing bob about his marital status when marty discovers that bob is widower he invites bob join his poker game and introduces him the declaration this is bob his wife is dead the poker buddies are just as desperate find mate for grace and greet bob enthusiastically when they hear the news also funny bonnie hunt as graces best friend megan and james belushi as megans husband joe married children megan and joe provide useful counterpoint showing the mundane results of romance although it is rare see him in movie that premieres in theater belushi delivers his lines great comic skill rounding out the impressive supporting cast are david alan grier as bobs best friend and robert loggia as martys brotherinlaw angelo in only the lead actors lived up the standards set the rest of the cast bottom line if you are compelled see this movie watch it on video so you can fastforward scenes carroll oconnor and james belushi

i am not sure if silvio horta wrote urban legend before or after the success of scream but am guessing after just because it seems he may not have had time write second draft seriously this ideaa psycho bumping off people in the style of urban legendsis great one and wish it could have been pulled off the first sign of trouble comes the painfully insipid dialogue an example that car crash must have been awful for everyone involved you can tell that the writer intended that something little more airy was supposed have been said just no one figured out what know in slasher movies there is not supposed be lot of great characterization and myself do not mind cardboard cutouts but please do not let the cutouts be so damn bland one reason movies like scream star wars and diva have become so treasured is because they feature charismatic actors playing interesting characters aside from jared leto and joshua jackson who are not on the screen long enough no one in urban legend makes the grade alicia witt shows none of the acerbity or wit she displayed on cybill rebecca gayheart actually looks unattractive not mention as dumb as post through of the and robert englund just cruises on auto pilot good thing brad dourif is here but wait he is only in the movie for five minutes _and_ he is just redoing his goodnatured stuttering character from one flew over the cuckoos nest brings me another aspect of urban legend it is unoriginality the most blatantly ripped off is scream another reason that makes me think silvio horta wrote this after cravens and williamsons great success urban legend tries deconstruct modernday folklore much the same way scream deconstructed slasher films but it does not quite succeed it is best stab at selfreflexivity is poking fun at that girl in the noxzeema ad ie rebecca gayheart we also have another killertauntinghisvictimonthephone routine in urban legend and quick what movie is this exchange of dialogue from female protagonist why villain why why congratulations those of you who answered scream andor urban legend like said this movie could have been great if only silvio had worked or been allowed work little longer on the script still at least urban legend had some pretty cool death scenes and somewhat realized whodunit angle makes this slasher is waaaayyyyyy better than know what you did last summer

drew barrymore is beginning corner the market on playing the girl outside the one who is the awkward klutz or the spunky doityourselfer the one who just does not fit in the others she has perfected these characters in movies such as the wedding singer and most notably ever after now she is back starring in what could be called modernday cinderella fable never been kissed you know it is fable because she plays copy editor at newspaper who has her own office as well as secretary trust me on this one no copy editor has seen the inside of private office since gutenberg and do not mean steve invented the printing press the premise is simple barrymores josie geller at the youngest copy editor ever be hired the chicago suntimes is assigned go undercover and return high school do an expose on what todays teens are feeling and doing josie she says she was named after the cartoon character was geek in high school so she jumps at the opportunity for second chance this time she thinks she will get it right and be accepted the incrowd now what kind of adult good job and successful career would actually look forward reliving the hell that was and is high school and adolescence these are among the many problems that plague never been kissed screenwriters abby kohn and marc silverstein cannot get handle of josie their script has her capriciously switching from confident adult ditzy blubbering womanchild at the least provocation and the fact that an adult would put so much stock into trying become tight the vapid airheads who are supposedly south glen high schools most popular girls leads you question her maturity and mental stability ok so never been kissed is not sociological expose of todays high school scene however certain rules should apply and one of those is consistency of character among the movies problems is the illconceived conceit that josie would seriously strive climb the high school food chain and in the process lose focus on her assignment any competent editor would have tossed her ass out the door quicker than you could say get me rewrite be fair barrymore is very appealing but she is given very little work she tries valiantly get firm grip on her character but the script continually undermines her barrymore comes off best in the physical comedy aspects of the script in she tries walk talk and act like cool hip high schooler otherwise she is left foundering on cliched sea of teenage stereotypes and situations never been kissed is entertaining and funny in fits and starts it lacks consistency and firm grasp on what it wants accomplish the movies main bright spot is provided leelee sobieski as aldys the outsider who befriends new student josie josie sees lot of her former self in aldys yet still abandons her hang out the popular girls real mature and that is the main deficiency never been kissed it is illogical unrealistic uneven and undemanding it has some warm and humorous spots but not enough overcome its many obstacles

come on silent bob we are going starring jason mewes kevin smith will ferrell shannon elizabeth seann william scott chris rock jason lee ben affleck directed kevin smith rated jay and silent bob strike back is dumb movie disguised in smarmy interior kevin smith coming off the wonderful challenging dogma fills it subroad trip grossout jokes and expects us buy it because he is just ohsoironic but when movie is so selfaware it becomes about nothing but itself we can hardly be expected pay for admission jay and silent bob two new jersey stoners who hang out at the doorstep of convenience store selling pot have appeared in almost all of smiths movies but if am not mistaken have not starred in one until now they find out that there is movie based on the comic book that is based on them being made in this presents two problems they have not received penny in royalties and nerds on the internet what is the internet are talking trash about them what is there do except go and stop this movie from being made on the way they are hitchhiking because who knew you needed tickets take bus they run into group of hotties who pretend be an animalrights group but are really jewel thiefs who parade around in charlies angelsstyle outfits of course they set jay and silent bob up look like the thieves so that there is massive manhunt going on during the second half of the will ferrell who again proves himself incapable of doing anything but sketch comedy shows up as the wildlife marshal inspector who thinks the two have stolen monkey the movie will probably please only smiths diehard undiscerning fans everyone else will be critical of this mindbogglingly stupid effort following some the sophisticated cinema that he churned out in years past any appeal the movie has will come from the in jokes most of think understood but the movie is in the point of absurdity there needs be something holding it together other than its own smugness once jay and silent bob get the movie abruptly switches gears from grossout comedy ridiculously broad satire countless hot movie stars and personalities make an appearance from smith veterans matt damon and ben affleck wes craven but jay and silent bob strike back resorts such lowbrow gags as another scream sequel monkey as the killer get it they are so desperate for another movie they ran out of ideas and used monkey monkey as often happens writers who are working below what they are actually capable of most of the really good lines are throwaways while the big painstaking gags mostly fall flat one of the funniest lines in the movie flies when asked comment on the clitoris do not ask jay responds the female clitoris kevin smith is talented writer though agree that his films would be better off if he would let real director take the helm and jay and silent bob strike back holds true his promise make more facetious unfortunately it is also shapeless pointless and largely unfunny smiths verbal trampoline as ben affleck once called his distinctive dialogue takes back seat his dubious instincts as populist filmmaker this was supposed be the movie that did not offend anyone but it is offensive because it is terrible

let me begin saying that this is easily the worst movie in the entire official and even unofficial james bond series it is so full of selfparody and silly characters that you would almost believe you were watching spoof an omen of what is come is provided the precredits sequence dull affair featuring confrontation between man it is difficult give better description since no mention of him is made elsewhere in the movie and the assassin of the title song woefully terrible lyrics follows and the rest of the movie is even worse the plot might have been pleasant change from the usual ruletheworld so often found in the james bond movies of the but here we get confused mismash about fabled assassin francisco scaramanga christopher lee putting in performance is one of the rare saving graces of this movie who someone has apparently payed one million dollars in order remove roger moores there is also flimsy connection the energy crisis and missing solar cell efficiency it is as much of mess as it sounds bond is helped in his task mary goodnight ekland whose character could not possibly be any closer the stereotypical bimbo during the course of the movie she gets locked in both closet and car trunk blunders around control room accidentally setting off laser and serves no purpose in enhancing the plot whatsoever maud adams later star in octopussy is much more stronger and useful character but she hardly features in the movie scaramangas lackey is dwarf called niknak who rather fittingly is also possibly the silliest henchman in the series serving up annoyance and weak dialogue in equal measures worse still is an almost total lack of action throughout the whole movie there is but one fight sequence about fifteen minutes in not counting ludicrous scene where two teenage girls beat up several dozen trained martial artists another misguided attempt at humour the solitary car chase might have been highlight but the action is interrupted on frequent basis redneck sheriff w pepper played clifton james of live and let die fame yelling stupid comments out of the passenger window he is easily the most irritating character in james bond movie even his presence could have been made bearable one of the most impressive car stunts in cinematic history degree twisting loop jump over broken bridge could have been except somebody got the idea dub mocking whistle tone over the final print on top of that debacle the whole end of the is an anticlimatic sequence in scaramangas funhouse the only good thing that came out of this movie was that the producers had make the next in the series the infinitely superior the spy who loved me great in order for the bond franchise survive

since director steven zaillian previously wrote the powerful screenplay for steven spielberg drama schindlers list and directed intelligent searching for bobby fischer his new civil action should most likely be looked upon as an unfortunate misstep in an otherwise prosperous career what does not make sense is how such highprofile and superb actors as john travolta robert duvall william macy and kathleen quinlan got involved in this project is both dull and completely ineffective the involves small community of children who mysteriously died of leukemia certainly contains the type of story be emotionallycharged but somehow all signs of feeling have been completely removed from the proceedings leaving us nothing more than poorlydone courtroom drama based on book jonathan hart was consequently based on true account civil action is set in in the town of woburn mass where personal injury lawyer jan schlictmann john travolta decides take on the case of eight families who simply want an apology for their childrens death from leukemia due unknown causes jan originally decides drop the case but when he stumbles across corporate giants grace and beatrice foods who have plants located near the families homes he sees all of the pieces suddenly fall into place the two companies have been leaking harmful chemicals into the nearby lake thus goes into the citys drinking water suddenly after hearing about the families heartbreak and personal stories he begins care for them and becomes determined get the bottom of the mystery even though he is warned his staff accountant william macy that no money is coming in them only going out also figuring into the story is jerome facher robert duvall beatrice foods corporate counsel who finds himself in heated waters when jan will not accept his million offer settle the case coming from such talented writer director and cast not mention one of the most interesting composers danny elfman civil action is an astoundingly emptyheaded drama one that includes an intriguing story and somehow transforms it into an admittedly tiresome and occasionally even boring experience perhaps one of its major problems was that in its attempts be relatively uncommercial motion picture zaillian has misplaced its refreshing unconventional attitude an absence of magnetism and even meaning watching the could not help but notice its similarities far far superior the sweet hereafter dealt lawyer played brilliantly ian holm investigating school bus accident that killed number of children in his attempts find someone who may have been responsible for the accident holm interviews the grieving parents as well as the sole surviving passenger teenage girl starts remind him of his own teenage daughter young drugaddict who has run away from home not only was the plotting similar civil action but it also had the same exact running time of minutes considering this it is amazing how fulfilling and truthful sweet hereafter was not only concentrating on the school bus accident but delving deeply into ian holms character and his own personal demons as well as the teenage girl in civil action however have no idea where the running time went since the is virtually two hours of nothingness we do not get know the parents very well nor any of the main characters through its whole duration did not learn one thing__not one thing__about travoltas lawyer character jan schlictmann who does not appear have any sort of life or purpose outside of his job every scene is tediously related directly the premise and therefore there was no one for me care about or root for you have got work pretty hard actually not get an audience become involved in the parents plight since their children are dead but that is exactly what civil action does be honest would be fairly hardpressed state an aspect of the that actually liked aside from one flashback when mans young son died on the way the doctor remained unmoved and passive about what was going on in the scenes and more than once found my mind wandering could say the performances were good but who is fooling who since every character is onedimensionally written no ones acting abilities are challenged in any way travolta plays lawyer well enough but that is about all he does duvall virtually sleepwalks through his role apparently only appearing give oneliners at every chance he gets and what in the world is kathy bates doing in the pictures final scene as judge she appears unbilled since it is just cameo but why did she even agree do it in the first place finally when the conclusion arrived and the end credits began role the left me another question what was the point abruptly ending without any susceptible momentum where none came before that begin civil action seemed me at least be an example of how not make courtroom drama and it certainly did not do justice the very serious subject matter the deals

synopsis al simmons topnotch assasin guilty conscience dies in fiery explosion and goes hell making pact malebolgia chief demon there simmons returns earth years later reborn as spawn general in hells army donning necroplasmic costume replete knives chains and morphing cape sullen wise cogliostro and flatulating wisecracking violator vy for spawns attention comments when todd mcfarlane left marvel comics where he had made name for himself as firstrate comic book penciller on the spiderman titles join the newlyformed creatorowned image comics new comic book legend was born spawn mcfarlanes spawn immediately became commercial and critical success and defining comic book series of the mcfarlane created hero who was not only original but visually intricate allowing mcfarlane utilize his knack for artistic detail the max the early spawn issues brilliantly capture mcfarlanes genius at illustration and show his early attempts at writing the popularity of spawn and the success of the current warner bros batman franchise movie version of some sort seemed inevitable for spawn in the summer of hence new line cinema released spawn liveaction based on the groundbreaking series this topheavy exercise in violence and special effects unfortunately topples quickly and leaves fans of the comic book like me numbed how much spawn misses the mark what happened why is spawn so bad todd mcfarlane himself executive produced this disappointing misfire and even appears in cameo do not think however that his presence necessarily hurt or helped the place the blame in part on the recent trend fueled public demand apparently for special effects blowout movies utilizing the latest computer technology these films focus upon the effects at the expense of everything else character plot dialogue etc spawn reflecting this trend shows the audience one gratuitous scene after another populated morphing characters and filled unnecessary pyrotechnics hardly minute goes in this without fires explosions knives and chains appearing out of nowhere glowing eyes or constantly transforming demons lot of it is visually interesting and technically solid do not get me wrong but because the script and cast are not engaging spawn ultimately comes across like overwrought wallpaper the surface may capture the eye but nothing exists underneath spawns translation of the comic book suffers the most at the storyline level mcfarlanes spawn was tortured hero mercenary trade al simmons was nonetheless warm man in love the beautiful wanda having died and journeyed hell he made pact return earth be wanda simmons however discovers that his memories are fragmented his body creepy mess and his wife married despite his sometimes violent nature readers could not help but feel sympathetic toward his plight as the spawn of the underworld spawn attempts show all of this but does not spend nearly the time it should do so when the characters are developed they seem absurd rather than touching the cartoonish dialogue and implausible subplot general possesses the antidote supervirus called heat he wishes unleash enslave the world do not help matters spawn in an apparent attempt duplicate the success of batman also unwisely spends too much time on villain the violator batman favored the joker over batman john leguizamo like jack nicholson in batman receives top billing in the cast as the violator michael jai white al simmons spawn is second ordinarily find leguizamo an intensely annoying presence in films seems make him perfect candidate for the violator the however spends so much time on the violators offensive antics that they grate on the nerves apparently meant be the comic relief in the as nicholson was in batman especially when contrasted the sullen spawn the violators lines are oftentimes grotesque and unfunny leaving the audience wishing he would leave leguizamo does satisfactory job in the role but he is seen far too often in the michael jai white relative newcomer theatrical releases seems be an appealing actor and he handles his role adequately but we see little of him without various masks on more time needed be spent on whites character before he became spawn for the movie pull at the heartstrings special note should be made about martin sheen as the overthetop obnoxious evil general wynn easily the hammiest performance in the movie it is hard imagine how sheen mucked up his role so much after all he played vietnam assasin brilliantly in the great apocalypse now sheens excessive demeanor do not help the audience accept him as mastermind villain and comes as surprise considering his extensive career in many other elements conspire the disappointing script and abundant special effects drag spawn down mtvstyle jerky inyourface editing is one of them flames for example roll across the screen sometimes announce shift in setting cogliostro unlikely wannabe guide for spawn serves as poor narrator for the he goofily tells the audience at one point that how much of spawns humanity is left remains be seen as if the audience really cares as one violent sequence leads another the music finally assaults the audience as much as the manic violence and offensive dialogue loud and obnoxious hard rock fused drum loops dominate some scenes be fair however marilyn mansons long hard road out of hell effectively compliments spawns return earth while filter and the crystal methods cannot you trip like do proves surprisingly fitting theme song for as good comic book as it is spawn did not spawn good movie spawn instead suffers from too much pomp and circumstance and too little plot and character development it receives two stars for its technically welldone special effects many other films though have equal if not superior special effects and are much better rated pg spawn seems more violent than many rrated movies and probably would not be appropriate for the very young

i cannot recall previous experience where the fairly good time was having turned as sour as quickly as it did during feeling minnesota for forty minutes or so was lured into loopy if occasionally overwrought romantic comedy and was even giving keanu reeves the benefit of the doubt then rather suddenly was clubbed over the head nasty bit of violence shortly thereafter was whacked in the gut another feeling minnesota is that made me feel violated as though had trusted writerdirector steven baigelman bring me cool glass of water and instead he threw acid in my face feeling minnesota tells the story of topless dancer named freddie cameron diaz who finds herself in deep trouble when her boss red delroy lindo suspects her of stealing from him reds punishment is force freddie marry his bookkeeper sam clayton vincent donofrio who is far from the man of freddies dreams enter jjaks keanu reeves sams estranged younger brother who arrives at the wedding just in time catch freddies eye and have sex her in the bathroom united in their mutual attraction and their mutual loathing of sam jjaks and freddie take off together but sam is not ready let them go without fight freddie meanwhile is not ready let sams money go without fight and thus begins series of violent confrontations there is both style and substance the beginning of feeling minnesota as baigelman opens an effective montage showing jjaks and sams intense sibling rivalry as boys and their mother tuesday weld sending jjaks away live his father it does great job of setting up jjaks unstable life life has landed him in trouble for petty crimes and always trying please his family reeves wounded look is just right for jjaks the wedding sequence includes number of nice moments most notably the aforementioned bathroom scene in simple question is given very funny spin most important baigelman begins establish the connection between freddie and jjaks humor and economy as in scene where they both spontaneously begin singing along the replacements will dare on the car radio you would have every reason expect that relationships both familial and romantic would be the focal point of feeling minnesota unfortunately you would be dead wrong suppose should have expected daisies and valentines after an early scene in red threatens freddie as she tries avoid the wedding but certainly did not expect what got what got was yet another in long line of recent films trying ride the tarantino wave mixing gags and brutality or rather creating gags about brutality suddenly the story of romantic entanglements and family conflict becomes story about corpse and everything had come before degenerates so completely that virtually nothing is recognizable the sibling rivalry not only becomes little more than an excuse for one round of beatings after another but there is no consistency the characterizations vincent donofrio turns in manic performance as sam whose jealousy competitiveness and apparent sense of inferiority seem far more in keeping what we know about jjaks while reeves turns into framed hero too reminiscent of chain reaction and both of them spend most of the second half of the screaming and covered in blood there are films have managed employ radical shift in tone successfully jonathan demmes something wild and neil jordans the crying game come mind but they did not try draw an audience the promise of relatively innocuous entertainment do not want dismiss baigelmans successes out of hand he gets fun performance out of dan aykroyd as crooked cop and some wellcrafted comic moments and it is not his fault that fine line has chosen promote feeling minnesota as lighthearted caper it _is_ his fault that he violates his own characters for the sake of shock value and that he cannot make his two halves into whole feeling minnesota left me feeling used and there is not much funny about that

wolfgang petersens latest the perfect storm is like pineapple it only tastes good after arduous peeling and digging if you try eat the fruit spikes and all it is going hurt quite bit ok maybe that was confusing analogy so heres my main complaint about the latest man battles nature flick there is not really much of story tell basically massachusetts fishing crew goes out sea on small boat called the andrea gail and gets stuck in the middle of the storm of the century how much time does it take for petersen tell this story not nearly enough so he spends the majority of the developing pointless side stories all eventually become superfluous audiences want see the storm they want see fight for survival but what they get is lot of cliched maudlin drivel the last quarter of the perfect storm is utterly perfect in every aspect but just try lasting the first threequarters have yet read sebastian jungers the perfect storm but from what have heard it is an unforgettable tale based on true story the book must have found some other way introduce the characters because in the movie version the approach is weak using wonderfully patriotic score james horner petersen almost hides the inyourface banality right away the central characters are introduced the gritty determined captain george clooney the ingenue mark wahlberg torn between his job and his girlfriend diane lane the loving father john reilly the comic relief who is always trying get laid john hawkes the new guy william fichtner who immediately antagonizes crewmate and the quiet french guy allen payne so many problems strike the opening segment of the that the remaining portions directly suffer it is not the allstar casts fault just the characters designed for their portrayal allen paynes character never speaks in the entire movie not because he is mute but because he is never given any lines are we supposed root for guy whose face and voice we are never given chance interact fichtners character is terribly underdeveloped we do not know what he is doing there where he is from or who he is supposed be the remaining four fishermen are all cardboard stereotypes hawkes says female stranger in one scene you know what would look good on you me ooooh real creative as the script advances and the andrea gail floats farther out into the waters the crew continues not feel human only when the storm takes center stage does the movie jump out of its sleepwalk the computergenerated images of gigantic waves crashing against helpless boat are thunderously real can only imagine if this was an imax this city kid would surely never go in the water again this is loud jolting entertainment adjectives that completely negate the rest of the the perfect storm was unfortunately disappointment the maelstrom lived up its potential but everything else failed do so guess will stick that other survival spectacle you know the one on cbs

synopsis valerie high school junior who does not look day under writes bad poetry complains about how much she hates school fantasizes about young guy on trial for raping and murdering six women chooses him as pen pal and plays hooky see him in court after jailbreak the killer puts on big sunglasses wears halfbuttoned jacket and uses his fatal charm go after valerie comments alan smithee directed fatal charm should have been more appropriately titled fatal bore or fatal crap if you find out that you are about see is directed alan smithee then you should seriously seriously seriously consider watching something anything else alan smithee is pseudonym number of directors have used when they produce something really bad frankly would be embarrassed if had directed this turkey so think understand why the director might have picked the alan smithee moniker for this where begin this painfully poor thriller let us start the acting it is pretty bad amanda peterson plays valerie and shows at least some talent the rest of the cast do not even though her performance is not exactly stellar material she is also miscast she seems way too old still have year of high school complete her scenes valeries mother played mary frann are joke the two look as though they are couple of coworkers going out lunch together rather than daughter her mother who just does not understand christopher atkins handsome enough actor who plays the killer adam looks like clown in the second half of fatal charm trying appear malicious and dangerous he wears large sunglasses and halfbuttoned jacket if disney decided do zany comedy caper about the unabomber atkins would probably be perfect candidate for the lead but he does not cut it here early on in the movie number of scenes occurs in courtroom outside of the laughably poor performances given the actors portraying lawyers the people sitting in the benches provide the silliest effort at drama in the they constantly shift and turn and arc their heads in mock interest in what has got be one of the worst perfomances that large group of people have given at one time ever fatal charms storyline such as it is inspires more yawns than thrills the script belabors red herring early on about second suspect who may have committed the murders for adam atkins is charged this suspect however turns up strangled and drowned halfway through the an obvious plot fault even for the idiots who did not consider the movies title as valerie and blond newsreporter commented how innocent and charming the defendant seemed it becomes quite obvious that adam is dangerous when the other suspect washes up so the audience must wait if they have not already stopped watching as the necessary details fall into place and the killer goes after the heroine in the drawnout finale the video box for this dud describes fatal charm as an erotic thriller thriller it is not and neither is it particularly erotic cannot imagine if someone were in the mood for something erotic that he would be happy after watching this fluff few erotic moments occur in the they take place in van little lighting and are filmed out of focus see they are supposed be valeries fantasies how creative on personal note was disturbed the ludicrous english literature class shown in this valerie had suffer through it is no wonder why she hated high school so much as an instructor of english myself have hard time accepting the fact that in course emphasizing great literature teacher would stoop reading students bad poetry of course it is valeries about boyfriends out loud and then embarassing its author in front of class questions about the poems inspiration guess the public school system is still setting dubious standards for its students fatal charm will not charm anyone unless there is someone that is charmed boring lifeless insipid suspenseless thrillers if you happen upon this turkey just keep moving on

a highly intelligent life form that is completely electronic in nature beams itself onto russian science vessel well this is the point where the movie strays from becoming decent and original movie and simply becomes predictable scifi thriller anyhow this life form takes control of the computers on the russian vessel then starts creating highly advanced robots help it in its gruesome task of exterminating the virus known as man the original crew of the russian vessel is all but exterminated and then hapless crew on tug discovers the derelict ship and tries salvage it no more needs be said as what happens and where the conflict lies the movie is that predictable the story is full of very shallow characters that do not do much other than subsist the captain of the tug played donald sutherland makes irrational choice after irrational choice leaving the audience wondering as how he has survived long enough reach his age looks be in his add this we are shown this motley crew that at times seems be highly skilled in specific fields and at others seems barely capable of basic tasks some of the supposed capabilities of the characters leads one wonder what they are doing on tug transporting cargo in the middle of the pacific in typhoon no less none of the characters seem work together at all they are always bickering and vying for some form of control this makes no sense what so ever and only takes away from the story story that is full of holes and is extremely predictable all the flaws of the actual story are only helped along the special effects the waves that are generated be part of the typhoon make it look like boat was is small model sitting in tub and someone is simply creating waves it looks genuinely fake granted trying recreate typhoon or hurricane cannot be easy any stretch of the imagination but having the storm approach in style similar the huge wave of deep impact only ends up looking corny and amateurish also on the topic of flaws the robotics that the advanced life form creates seem move extremely slowly why if this life form that is so advanced as be able create these robotics should it not be able create them move faster regardless the special effects in this movie in many cases take away from the rather than add it as the actual casting for the movie finally there is nothing complain about the actors were superb but then again it is highly doubtful that chimpanzees would have had difficulty acting the roles having the cast that was present probably saved this movie from being an absolute catastrophe watching these actors act this story out made it bearable if barely the one saving grace of this movie is that it was highly action packed and there always seemed be something happening so if you are going into this movie not expecting see anything grand and are only going kill some time and watch mediocre scifi thriller then you will not be too disappointed as the movie is but the latest in genre that was originally created aliens it does little more than try cash in on that aspect this movie would be best left for video and even then you might be advised simply wait for one of the major networks air it on tv

this movie is based off the wildly popular videogame series of the same name before this the game had few spinoff cartoons were ok but the idea of doing movie is insane it should have been animated if it should have been done at all instead the people do the best they can talented cast yet it still fails the plot is completely different from the games plot am not complaining about that the story involves the mario bros having plumbing business in brooklyn and having compete rival company eventually they find construction site their nemesis happens be enviromentally unsafe so due luigis john leguizamo girlfriend princess daisy they go and investigate they get transported blade runneresque world lead king koopa dennis hopper somehow plot dealing all the dinosaurs being mutated and transported an alternate futuristic megacity jumbles in the plot is fine better than the movie deserves the acting is ok this seems be more of visual the special effects are good especially on the robotic yoshi however the drags and is no fun and it leaves itself open sequel probably will not ever be made this movie begins sort of promising but ends up leaving weird taste in your mouth so if you want watch sort of odd movie starring the excellent dennis hopper then watch super mario bros the movie you could do worse but you could definitely do better street fighter the movie starring raul julia and jean claude vandamme this movie was based off of series of never ending sequels game called street fighter it has all the characters from the game in reasonable plot it is more like movie than it should be yes it is watchable raul julia does good job considering this was his final while the game had nonstop fighting sequences this movie is hodgepodge of action scenes and flashy sets and costumes while trying show off plot at the same time does it work sort of the plot involves the evil shadowloo organization run bison raul julia guile jean claude vandamme takes his troops attack bisons main base in an attempt liberate the innocent villages he has taken over in short amount of time the movie introduces several characters well it catches your attention but it ultimately seems like showcase for fans of the game so you can point out things like there is chun li or look at that fireball ryu did at vega it hits the bases presenting the characters in plot good sets but goes no further this movie needed more action in the first place the action scenes that are here are short and not very exciting if you like lighthearted action flicks or if you liked the game watch this one it is even worth watching if you want see raul julias last performance or if you cannot get enough of van damme other than that you could find better action flicks

studio attracted so many weird and bizarre people its gates that it is wonder why the about the life and death of the studio centers itself on one very boring cliched individual not mention an ensemble of people who would not be at all fascinating unless they worked at the studio they did according this are we supposed believe that out of all the strange folk who populated the studio nightly that character who is bland ripoff of tony manero would really make good protagonist for the about it belongs in the elite group of films known as the big disappointments the films that attain so much hype andor so much potential in its creation that they come off worse than they are when they are finally finished was heavily awaiting not the least because have become fascinated the infamous club has been the subject of an engrossing documentary that is been running all summer on vh is weirdly enough much more intriguing and engrossing than this edgy perhaps more importantly is part of the blossoming subgenre the nostalgia has been picking up mighty steam what boogie nights and the last days of disco coming out within the year and both being such damn good movies that not only captured the feel of certain time period the late party and the early wakeup period but brought us interesting and real characters like scotty the tragically gay boom mike operator from boogie nights and charlotte the ironically clueless and bitchy coprotagonist from the last days of disco not mention several others deals not so much the timeline of the studio how it began how it was run the tragic people who went there party and had wakeup in the when things like diseases economy problems and perhaps worst of all reagan all hit and forced everyone into rude awakening the story of the studio is tragedy in itself let us look at how it all affected the people but this does not let that happen it gives us halfassed protagonist named shane oshea ryan phillippe from know what you did last summer who is chief character trait is the fact that he is from new jersey also happens be his chief character flaw guess he is dimwitted into being part of the scene and soon finds he is become bit of rave amongst the studio regulars bit like saturday night fever cept no travolta and no real interest put into him poor poor phillippe struggles make him interesting but all he is halfassed character and not at all our ticket the glimpse of the decadence going on inside the club that he could have been shane begins hang out some other denizens of the club like anita salma hayek wannabe donna sommers and her young hubby greg randanzo breckin meyer from clueless who helps shane become bartender and rise bit of fame although he begins get somewhere when he sleeps the foxy billie auster sela ward an exec of sorts he falls in lust soap star named julie black neve campbell and thus the boring romance subplot that is all too not necessarily important anything else in the and never really becomes interesting at any point in the the films sole point of interest and one major strongpoint is the alltoo necesary personage of steve rubell played mike myers you heard me rubell the famous head of the studio acted as if he never stopped partying ever and is an easy metaphor for the life and times of his creation but the thanks surprisingly strong performance myers makes him out be more than that notice the scenes sole shocking scene where he tries get felatio from one of his male employees in turn for promotion myers brings the humanity rubell in this scene and couple others that some of us who have only seen him on tv never saw and proves be perhaps the one aspect of studio that this actually nails first time feature director mark christopher proves that he is better director than writer though not too terribly much his story is trite and shallow as are his characters and his direction is shockingly flat especially for about this subject it is as if he had great story tell but instead opted for the easier route the studios recreation is amazingly accurate though and very impressive but his direction is never captivating enough some people say that does its job if it makes you want visit the locale it takes place in despite the films tone still want go rome and its many nightclubs after saw fellinis la dolce vita and when watched did not particularly want stay

in the past tim burton has taken cinema storm the action packed batman and the hilarious ed wood but lately his films just do not cut it sleepy hollow has some unique features but the script is terrible mess for those who remember disneys fantastic adventures of ichabod crane it is actually superior this disneys version was at least interesting while burtons drags on far too long without any suspense or frights while the stories are similar the new version adds too much the once likable story and throws in some weak dialogue top it off ichabod crane johnny depp is now apparently constable who was sent new york investigate suspicious murders the victims are headless and no traces of evidence were found until the murderer reveals himself hence the headless horseman now the help of christina ricci and an orphaned boy they must stop the headless horseman from killing spree that could destroy the whole town of sleepy hollow sure the headless horseman is an intriguing character but the story has so many holes that even he nor depp can save this disaster in the original the headless horseman was meant be unstoppable no one could stop him not even ichabod the end of the it had audiences in deep thought burton however concentrates far too much on the atmosphere and how make the main characters heroes he takes no risk what so ever and this is where he fails another pathetic element of the was the script like said earlier he just stuffed too much in at one time and made it look real sloppy kind of like the mess the headless horseman made his victims he completely butchered the story pieces thankfully there are few factors that particularly liked the acting depp was quite notable he took the nerdy character of the cartoon and simply acted it out in better manner if it was not for his quirky oneliners doubt could have remained awake because quite frankly was getting sleepy just when thought christina ricci was getting be good actress she winds up doing
