what is this homicide or bad bmovie that is the prophetic question asked one of the leads in one of the early scenes of this movie let me clear things up for you cupcake this is not bad bmovie it is really bad bmovie so bad it is almost good almost but not quite the movie starts off in the space aliens sending botched experiment down earth it is bunch of sluglike creatures that kill people and take over their bodies the slugs first and only victim in the fifties is cryogenically frozen where he is of no danger anybody that is until two loser university students unfreeze him in he and the slugs inside him promptly begin wreaking havoc and turning more coeds into slug zombies slightly crazed cop tom atkins and the requisite girl the face of an angel jill whitlow join these two geeky university students jason lively and steve marshall do battle the slugs it more or less falls on the four of them make the world safe again from the evil slugs the acting is bad capital the story is worse and the special effects are somewhere between an old rerun of star trek and what you see in home movie the only saving grace was the requisite titshot courtesy of jill whitlow it had absolutely nothing do the story but liked it actually it was the high point of the movie for me of course that is not really saying much the story moves around in hap hazard fashion gives it leg up on some other horror films unlike most movies of this genre there actually is story not great one but it is there this is one in long line of movies from the that were thrown together capitalize off the success of the friday the th halloween and nightmare on elm street movies you could randomly select movie out of the horror section of you local video store and probably luck into something just as good if not better but night of the creeps might make nice addition bmovie horror marathon just do not be too upset if you cannot find it you really will not be missing that much

there is scene early on in jawbreaker where character utters the unintentionally prophetic line that is so not funny how right she was this pathetic tale of three highschoolers who accidentally kill their best friend in birthday kidnapping prank gone horribly awry is never even remotely funny or fun or original not content the tooobvious heathers heisting the filmmakers proceed lift freely from staggering variety of sources including carrie bride of frankenstein blue velvet and even shaws pygmalion itself recently remade as she is all that jawbreaker is pastiche and not even an enjoyable one find it extremely telling that the most engaging part of the is the credit sequence jawbreaker factory montage inexplicably backed veruca salts volcano girls serving as blueprint for the rest of the the song has absolutely nothing do the footage we are watching just close your eyes and pretend you are listening an altrock station you will not be missing anything the blame for mess this big has be spread around among the principals rebecca gayheart following roles in scream and urban legend should have known better than take yet another role in yet another teen body count movie pam grier has totally wasted any credibility she might have gotten from her role in quentin tarantinos jackie brown and rose mcgowan should just quit acting she has no charisma no presence and no acting skills other than rolling her eyes and looking disaffected mcgowan manages be upstaged her reallife boyfriend rocker marilyn manson whose fifteen second role here is far more interesting than anything any of the real actors are doing manson sans trademark makeup contact lenses and an obviously fake moustache looks eerily like nicholas cage who woulda thunk it that crack about direction committee was not merely pithy soundbite stylistically thematically narratively jawbreaker is all over the map varying wildly in tone content from scene scene though credited solely writerdirector darren stein one gets the feeling that no two scenes here were actually guided the same hands if stein was indeed responsible for the whole of this atrocity someone needs get the man some drugs pronto prozac lithium kava ritalin something anything he is quite obviously in desperate need of chemical help jawbreaker is monumental waste of effort and resources and quite likely one of the single worst films have ever seen call jawbreaker garbage would be insult garbage bad flicks for the rest of the year are safe have already got my pick for worst of jawbreaker runs approximately minutes though it feels longer than titanic and is rated for language sexual situations and graphic violence not recommended for kids teens or anyone else

can you say dated you can if you have seen rosemarys baby like the exorcist was thrilling horror in its time but seems boring and laughable in the decades that have passed since its original release mystery science theater has skewered the bad films of the past but let me tell you it could do number on the good ones too rosemarys baby stars mia farrow from the time she was actually goodlooking as an innocent housewife and her notsoinnocent husband john cassavettes an actor who takes an easy albeit evil road success it all seems so harmless in the beginning mia and john move into an apartment where several past murders have been committed there is also skull in the living room but it is only for decoration their elderly neighbors pop in for housewarming alls well for about the first hour of this slowmoving until mia eats some of the neighbors chocolate mousse and passes out when she comes she finds herself in darkened room bunch of people yelling and dancing like savages and big evil man raping her foreshadowing of her future life woody allen it seems like dream and when she finds herself pregnant she almost forgets about it and everyones helping the pregnancy the neighbors have some wonderful vitamin potions for her drink goodluck charm for her wear around her neck and the name of an obstetrician who is been in the business years meanwhile mia begins having chronic stomach pains and losing lot of weight before too long she looks just like the lead singer of the cranberries that is when you know your healths failing the only person in the movie who is the least bit suspicious of all this is an old friend maurice evans who calls mia up give her the bad news and immediately falls into coma about the twohour mark felt the same way rosemarys baby is way too long and leads up payoff that is about as boring and laughable as the rest of the movie guess someone put spell on this movie

the caliber killer has struck again starring john leguizamo mira sorvino adrian brody jennifer esposito michael rispoli bebe neuwirth rated summer of sam will be remembered as waste of spike lees abilities lee is great filmmaker often exhibiting kinetic visual flair on par brian depalma and martin scorsese and storytelling ability comparable steven spielberg but here he gets himself into bind his latest effort is case of director pretending he has something say when in reality there is little of substance absorb from his work the summer of was an unusual summer in new york city it was the hottest summer on record boot new yorks first serial killer was on the loose calling himself the son of sam david berkowitz killed people in the new york area and frightened the whole city population so it was understandable that when nyc was hit citywide blackout people went berserk causing billions of dollars in damage the city the movies focus is on group of twentysomethings during that fateful summer vinny john leguizamo clubhopping adultrous hairdresser his benevolent wife dionna mira sorvino looking young ritchie adrian brody punk who becomes an outcast as well as son of sam suspect gang of small time mobsters and few more minor characters we follow them through their roller coaster lives thrown out of whack even more the recent killings vinny and dionna have marital problems because vinny cheats and dionna tries please him make him stay faithful her ritchie gets shunned his group of friends because he has started become more and more eccentric and has degenerated the point of dancing in gay night clubs and making porno films his girlfriend tensions build and conflicts arise as the anniversary night of son of sams first murder looms the night he promises he will strike again local gang too much time on its hands makes list detailing all of the people that its members think might be suspects at the top of the list is ritchie vinny an unwilling part of the said group is called upon set trap for his friend as we watch these proceedings some of are painfully graphic the dreaded so what question springs mind from the way this movie is made would have guessed that spike lee was trying tell us something but as searched deeper it became clear that there is very little there find lee touches on so much the media the punk scene the details of the actual killings as well as the characters very personal dilemmas but he does not bring all of his topics together form coherent theme or make discernible statement all is not lost if movie turns out be hollow it can be saving grace for the be enjoyable too bad summer of sam does not get any help here frankly it is bore redundant and repetitive two hour and twenty minute that does not entertain beyond its first half hour there is no suspense because the refuses be fully about the murders and little involving drama because the is too muddled and its focus too vague leguizamos turn as vinnie is annoying and whiny the script makes it clear that we are supposed believe that his character is flawed but still good guy you would never guess from his performance adrian brody and especially mira sorvino fare better sorvino gives riveting touching performance in banal movie am tempted think that liked her because nearly everything else around her was inane her character is affecting and her emotions truetoheart brody too paints an effective portrait of young guy desperate for attention who gets little more than he bargained for summer of sam has some superficial elements of good it looks great it has few notable performances and suppose it is pretty well directed in purely technical way but it is also empty pretentious and boring like last years the thin red line it is movie director who does not know what he wants say but goes ahead and says it anyway eugene novikov

bob the happy bastards quickie review the odd couple ii grumpy old men it as not hell my fellow americans it as not walter matthau and jack lemmon team up again for an even more worn out vehicle than any of their films over the past few years odd couple ii feels terribly generic where in the first movie made thirty one years ago feels like wonderful tale that is like repackaging campbells soup in generic food can really how writer neil simon could have made such horrible mistake in screen writing is beyond me throughout the movie really did not laugh once honestly mean there were dumb situations yeah like the cropduster who let these old geezers have it without any notice but they just really did not seem funny me and that car rolling off the cliff the only way would have seen humor in that is if they were still in it and the ending gets all supermushy too in the final twenty minutes or so lemmon meets girl he thinks is the one then loses her matthau talks his son wasted jonathan silverman about his amrriage lemmons daughter and of course lemmon and matthau have another roomie situation on their hands ooh really gave lot away there am sure consider it hospitable gester you will not waste your time renting this muck

the summer of was not very good one for devout cinephiles it offered no blair witches or sixth senses the best big budget could do was an efficient xmen adaptation and flawed but entertaining shaft update nurse betty signals the unofficial end of that dreadful summer movie season and the commencement of potentially brighter fall movie season that batterycharging at least for critics who have sit through every piece shit that moseys into multiplexes time of year when all those oscar contenders read quality films compete for audiences alas betty has the dubious distinction of being the first overpraised junk heap of the new season it is also indie director neil labutes first attempt at something resembling mainstream picture and am sad report it is resounding failure at least on this web site mess that is as hopelessly saccharine as people have accused labutes previous films of being unrelentingly masochistic went in expecting something decent for betty was gleefully praised it is screenplay even winning an award at cannes but exited shaking my noggin in bewilderment are critics so desperate for something unique that they are blind how derivative the particular brand of uniqueness betty dolls out is for the first time labute is working from script he has not written and he seems unsure of how handle the material betty tries be hip like pulp fiction this is another flick featuring pair of strangely bright and articulate hit men enchanting like the wizard of oz of this makes several allusions and heartwarming like stick in your favorite loveable misfit movie but the end it left me cold its calculated desperation it is labutes half hearted attempt make crowd pleaser and he does not even seem have half that heart in it nurse betty concerns soap opera addict betty brilliantly played renee zellweger who witnesses the killing of her husband del aaron eckhart playing the most casually loutish husband since richard benjamin in diary of mad housewife two hit men morgan freeman and chris rock she happens have her most beloved soap on in the background and somehow merges the two realities she is blocked out her husbands death and thinks she is character in her favorite soap reason love betty sets out on the road la some drugs unknowingly stashed in her car trunk searching for her soap boyfriend dr david ravell greg kinnear while the two bickering hit men follow in not so close pursuit the labute who birthed the extraordinary in the company of men slipped bit but not much his sophomore effort your friends and neighbors then fell straight on his ass bash play he penned that was recently aired on showtime the play demonstrated no forward movement as an artist only labutes persistence in wallowing in the horrid things average people do each other usually out realizing how horrid they themselves are in the play paul rudd as an obnoxious jock delivers monologue detailing how he once followed gay man into bathroom and beat him maybe death while his clueless girlfriend essentially regards his sadistic behaviors as something along the old maxim boys will be boys another character schlubby businessman reacts the loss of his job actually killing his own baby what was once so powerful about labutes work the casual nonchalant cruelty and selfishness often elements we all have in us amplified disgusting degree had become so over the top it was borderline comic obviously at this point labute could use dose of some different kind of material before he pigeon holes himself further but nurse betty is not it he clearly has little passion for what he is doing here instead replacing his mojo strained quirks one of the hit men is huge soap fan and the character of betty would be little more than one joke gimmick if zelllweger had not managed transcend that tailor made appeal the widest possible audience nearly every scene between chris rock and morgan freeman fatally slows the picture down as the two are made enact softboiled tarantinoesque dialogue they evince little chemistry rock constantly in over the top rant mode acting more like an angry comic than any thing resembling hit man an occupation that is represented far too frequently in movies nowadays think rock is great comic yet he has not been able bring his feral intelligence movies whenever he acts and no matter the part it is like he is doing the damn chris rock show surprisingly at least considering her work in me myself and irene renee zellweger gives revelatory performance building on her baby faced apple pie looks that wideopen face and helium voiced earnestness suggests little girl not fully grown into her thirtyyearold body it is the best work she is ever done freeman is effective as always though his performance nonetheless suffers because it seems at odds where the movie wants take it the actor plays the role in his usual calm collected manner though the flick tries insinuate symbolic kinship between his character and bettys suggesting that both are controlled their fantasies rather than reality that is interesting but the movie does not do anything it other than crash land the subtheme into labored speech in the midst of badly staged gun battle the has good moments many of the scenes involving very good greg kinnear especially his confrontation zellweger an almost soothing lyrical score and you know movies in trouble when the score sticks out as one of the best things about it but nothing jells it is parts good or bad are so disparate as be opposing the might have worked had it settled on being one type of mainstream female forrest gump or an oddball art but as both if it falls as flat as diet coke bettys screenplay makes the mistake of relying too much on concurrence without betty would not make any progress in the nurse betty is driven coincidence rather than charter like how betty becomes nurse in the job that she takes in order get closer her imaginary lover she happens be at the hospital at the exact moment that drive shooting takes place and miraculously knows how take care of the victims wound because she happened see how on tv leads her being offered room the victims girlfriend who eventually gets betty into party where she meets kinnear little too tidy do notcha think betty has an interesting theme though it does not even seem aware of this the current state of tv has been leaning towards reality television what the enormous success of survivor and moderate success of big brother more on the way this is about women so deluded as think that her favorite soap opera is reality ironically reallife survivor sean kennif has taken part as doctor on the soap opera guiding light instead of exploring this timely matter in way relating the current tv craze since the does largely appear be satire of television albeit one that would feel more appropriate in the than the the simply uses bettys delusions as plot device get her from point no progress is made and little is unearthed except that maybe labute could use bit of rest and lot of contemplation

what do you get when you ripoff good movies like woody allens bananas and martin scorseses after hours you would think you would get the best of both films instead you get woo falling in somewhere between def jams how be player was awful and booty call was ok woo is yet another in the embarassing genre of showing africanamericans be nothing more than sexual buffoons the whole plays out as black version of after hours as wild woman woo jada pinkett smith goes out on blind date straightlaced tim tommy davidson mayhem follows them for some unknown reason read contrived screenplay davidson puts up all of woos antics for the entire night include her destroying his bathroom mirror stealing things from his house violently questioning him accusing and belittling him actually about previous girlfriends causing riot in an elegant restaurant and other various infuriating things that any normal person would not tolerate but for the sake of this bad movie sure why not there are few chuckles in the the best being the scene swiped directly from bananas in this case davidson is running from thugs gets into subway car as the doors are closing starts taunt the thugs then the doors open back up again good joke but stolen one another chuckle is provided billy dee williams cameo as himself movies like woo are seemingly released every three months or so and not one of them has ever been hit woo will not be one either so why was it made and more importantly is not there anyone else besides me who thinks these films are offensive everyone involved should really reconsider their careers at this point r

wild things is way steam up an otherwise dreary early spring day provided of course that you are the victim of frontal lobotomy there is in fact no doubt about who this motion picture is aimed at moviegoers in their late teens and early twenties the most lucrative target group this is noir for the mtv generation fastpaced slick flashy gleefully mindless and hollow the core wild things is easily one of the five dumbest movies arrive in theaters during the first eleven weeks of have seen more convincing drama nearly as much bare flesh on that pinnacle of narrative quality baywatch wild things wants dupe viewers into thinking it is thriller real story what it is however is series of increasingly improbable and shockingly predictable plot twists everything in between those serpentine moments is filler flash of breast spatter of blood and some of the most idiotic dialogue this side of steven seagal movie the tries so hard surprise its audience that the twists end up being easy guess just take stab at the most unlikely thing happen and that will probably be it using this approach was right three times and wrong only once that is not good average for production that wants keep viewers in the dark about what is around the next corner the ad campaign uses two things sell this movie the hot young cast and the old standby sex both have an abundance of screen time although will admit that the films erotic content is somewhat less impressive than expected nothing about wild things is exceptionally risqu the softcore sex sequences are generic and do not generate much heat the lesbian kisses cannot hold candle those in bound theresa russell and denise richards have only token topless appearances neve campbell possessing an ironclad no nudity clause in her contract keeps her clothes more or less on the films greatest curiosity is full frontal shot of kevin bacon climbing out of the shower maybe few girls will skip seeing fullyclothed leonardo dicaprio for the thirteenth time in titanic catch glimpse of what kyra sedgwick mrs kevin bacon is familiar the director of wild things is john mcnaughton whose last effort was the finelytuned psychological thriller normal life that movie featured copious sex pair of real characters and powerful script it is difficult believe that something this shallow could come from the same maker but suppose we all need put food on the table mcnaughton appears have completely lost his way here in what is obviously stab at mainstream success his previous widerelease picture mad dog and glory was boxoffice disappointment quick cuts and pretty sunrises cannot even begin cover up this movies flaws the main character and use that term lightly since no one in wild things shows more than an occasional flash of personality is sam lombardo matt dillon guidance counselor at floridas blue bay high school student the deliciously curvaceous kelly van ryan denise richards has crush on him one afternoon she comes his house wash his car and when she leaves her clothing is torn after confessing her mother theresa russell that she was raped she goes the police station where she tells her story detectives ray duquette kevin bacon and gloria perez daphne rubinvega they are skeptical about here claims until another girl suzie toller neve campbell comes forward similar tale meanwhile sam convinced that he is being set up goes shyster lawyer bill murray for help the acting in wild things is not very good but none of the principals have much work this is definitely not character based motion picture not only does the ludicrous screenplay ignore the possibility that someone in the audience may have tripledigit q but it does not bother give any of the onscreen individuals even hint of depth the men and women populating the picture are there look nice but nothing more matt dillon is given plenty of opportunities flex his biceps neve campbell gets model the slutty look denise richards strikes fetching pose in seethrough onepiece bathing suit and nothing in the gets rise out of kevin bacon the only one who is even remotely interesting is bill murray and he seems think he is in comedy not thriller maybe he is got the right idea columbia pictures has specifically requested that critics not reveal the films ending prompts the question ending do they want kept secret wild things has no less than three one occurs during the end credits so stay seated all of are jawdroppingly absurd feat that joe eszterhas the writer of basic instinct and showgirls would be impressed thanks jeffrey kimballs polished kinetic cinematography wild things always looks great and george clintons score keeps it pulsing and throbbing but no matter how shiny the superficial sheen is this is still trash and like all garbage it stinks

like good action should metro has action that keeps you involved some action films have action sequences that are so conventional our attention is detracted and diverted other thoughts the ghost in the darkness opened few months ago is that action was so bland and uninvolving it not only invited my thoughts divert me it nearly put me asleep but metro is one of the best action films in while it is hip sharp nifty and has nice little pieces of suspense and comedy eddie murphy was in bad shape for while and this invites me mention last year the nutty professor was his blessed revival back the position at he used be metro happens be lot better than any in the beverly hills cop series that is because metro takes itself seriously but doesn prevent itself from having little fun eddie murphy is at his best in the roles of responsible and controlled people the beverly hills cop movies all featured eddie as reckless wild cop always crossing the line just an inch in metro he plays hostage negotiator so negotiation is his job not his hobby or his preferred way out of trouble his character in metro takes himself seriously eddie murphy mischievous trademark grin is hardly anywhere be found in metro and perhaps it is quite better off that way murphy plays scott roper and as previously mentioned he is san francisco hostage negotiator in the first tense situation in the we are introduced roper kind of work as he tries calm down confused unkempt young criminal who has taken captive the entire capacity of the san francisco bank he is holding up murphy handles the scene seriously without his usual happygolucky misfit humor the develops when its villain is established and the villain here is the beguiling michael korda jewel thief and murderer who likes let cops know of his hostage fatalities giving them the ear of the victim metro takes different twists and slight turns and there is one great virtuoso chase scene involving the cable car cars flip cars crash cars turn over and it is done so good in this was reminded of speed and the speeding bus that couldn go under fifty mile per hour for very significant reasons there are also some other good scenes in metro that lot of films would rather choose not have scenes like the one roper and his new partner are at the horse track roper is gambler who knows all the tricks and roper teaches his partner few little methods of betting and winning of course the writers tried disguise the scene as being insignificant having roper draw parallels between hostage negotiation and gambling the scenes between roper and his girlfriend are nice too those are the scenes that make up metro is mainly about eddie murphy maturing as personality the actor that most enjoyed seeing in metro was michael rapaport who plays roper new partner lipreading bookskimming genius and master of observation it was not the actor presence that pleased me as much as the role he was cast in the role of proclaimed genius rapaport is an actor who usually see in the role of the dimwit the really really dopey dimwit hardly recognized him in metro and it was quite joy be able see him in role like this feel that respect him more there are two main types of villains in movies like this the ones that are part of the story and the ones that are devices the villain in metro is no more than device but he is darn good villain nonetheless he is played michael wincott whose voice is pushed out in abraded rasp as if he smokes cigarette between every take wincott makes his villain korda as mean as could be the classic type of villain who would push an old lady down flight of stairs just for kicks like richard widmark in kiss of death and in addition wincott physical appearance and mannerisms in the actually reminded my of an arrogant friend use have who is no longer on my good list liked metro and do not think would have worked any other actor but eddie murphy his past roles were the great ones but they were also precursor the maturing that would later take place possibly from murphy growing as person now having family metro is nononsense movie it works as buddy movie it does not overplay it works as dry comedy it does not overplay it works as suspense it does not overplay and it works as an action where it does have tendency occasionally go allout but who cares it still remains serious and it does not overdo itself oh and there were plenty of explosions in metro as well how nice it was of the filmmakers give us those if there is one major objection had metro it was the length an area where lot of action films seem wear out their welcomes metro is that lasted little too long but it was still entertaining and it gave me something do while waited for it end paul haynes

capsule dumb dud of an entry in the body heat sweepstakes and now something of landmark for having spawned jillion clones basic instincts worst crime is that it is not just bad movie but in many ways an incompetent one as well it is stupid in itself and stupid think its audience is as stupid as it is it is supposed be thriller but the plot is dead on its feet and ultimately arbitrary it is only put into the movie jerk us around it is also supposed be sexy but it is instead got the unpleasant rawness of teenager showing younger kids his collections of dirty pictures it is ripoff the story opens rock star being murdered while in the throes of orgasm the biggest suspect is an authoress catherine tramell sharon stone who wrote novel in the murder was eerily presaged or maybe it is the work of copycat these and other plot threads get fed the detective who is on the case michael douglas who has few problems himself like we wonder if his elevator goes the top floor we can measure stopwatch the time from them setting eyes on each other the moment they are doing the mattress dance joe eszterhas has written the screenplay and he uses device that he used before in the much better jagged edge the killers identity is kept secret until the movies final shot this is not in itself problem the problem is that up until that point we have been given nothing work every clue in the movie every clue is ambiguous the whole thriller aspect of the movie is shill red herrings dead plot threads violence and kinky sexuality litter the movie like potholes in manhattan streets they add up zip because they are not happening people we care about douglass character is foulmouthed and bitter and that is it stones character has an ironon smile that never changes the rest are forgettable when we do not even have the luxury of giving damn about anyone in the movie who cares what happens in it especially an ending that is not only unsatisfying but in many ways inexplicable friend of mine once came up rule of thumb about movie characters if no one in the movie behaves like anyone you know or would care know just leave one of the nastier things about the movie is the way it treats lesbianism not as an integral part of someones life but as kind of kink something thrill men despair whenever encounter this kind of stupidity in mainstream entertainment are we still so culturally neanderthal that the only way include something like that in bigbudget is as hefnerism

capsule gal is sish london cockney gangster who has retired spain his old associates want him for one last job and send the vicious don give him an offer he cannot refuse standout performance ben kingsley as don cannot save what is essentially set of cliches recycled from old westerns roger ebert asks in his review of sexy beast who would have guessed that the most savage maddog frothing gangster in recent movies would be played ben kingsley my response would be that anyone who has seen alan arkin in wait until dark henry fonda in once upon time in the west or anthony hopkins in the silence of the lambs should have guessed it they should know that the way for create really creepy sociopath is cast someone who generally plays mild sympathetic or even ineffectual character roles the same characteristics that make an actor seem gentle in most of his roles can work in his favor when role calls for him be fierce and vicious that is the principle that works for kingsley in sexy beast gary gal dove played ray winstone has retired from london career of crime and is living on luxurious villa in spain life has become routine of sunning himself and relaxing but his paradise is about be shattered onetwopunch the first punch is boulder that comes rolling down the hill next the villa the second punch comes from gals past back in london gang boss teddy bass ian mcshane tvs lovejoy is planning break into safety deposit room in bank and he wants gal he sends his most rabid henchman don logan ben kingsley fetch gal don will accept any decision gal makes from yes certainly however if gal says no don will do whatever it takes turn it into yes including threatening guys exporn star wife deedee amanda redman in the meantime don knows just how get under everybodys skin kingsley makes don compact package of fury and nastiness there are some serious problems in louis melliss and david scintos script that should have been caught before filming when we see the actual crime we have no idea why gal was so important its success beyond an ability use skindiving gear no special talents are required of him any local hood could have done what gal is needed for additionally the crime involves digging from swimming pool the bank vault flooding the vault no only could they have let the water out of the pool and avoided the complication altogether but there is far too much water be accounted for what was in the pool in spite of the provocative title the story is cliched and overly familiar know have seen all the plot elements of sexy beast in old westerns like the law and jake wade the story is usually of the reformed outlaw robert taylor type who has hung up his guns and is trying for life of peaceful respectability the old gang however wants do one more job their old buddy and sends rabid richard widmark type go and git im it is not great plot in sexy beast even the plot twists have gray beards perhaps the has little more respectability because it was made not as western but as stylish british gangster it is an old plot dressed up look new if the plot is old at least the style is creative this is director jonathan glazers first but he has reputedly done some notable tv ads for guinness stout his style does have some unexpected touches including some very odd dream sequences cinematographer ivan bird uses lot of half lit scenes we see one side of persons faces but the other side fades into the darkness sort of metaphor for the halfworld these characters inhabit half of everything that is happening is also kept hidden we yanks will have hard time some of the dialog at least in my theater it was difficult make out the words the quiet speaking the heavy accents and the cockney language sexy beast is very and familiar minor plot lent respectability in the us being done in what is here still somewhat novel genre the london crime the plot may be new british crime films but it would be overly familiar as western further respectability comes from ben kingsleys highpowered performance give it on the scale and on the scale

synopsis backup quarterback moxxon becomes starting quarterback midway through his senior year of high school even though he would rather read slaughterhouse five than the playbook evil football coach kilmer throws away moxxons book though while the evil team physician injects painkillers into the players in the meantime moxxons kid brother forms cult and bubblegumblond cheerleader smears whip cream on herself seduce the new star quarterback comments since usually review horror and science fiction films feel little out of my league discussing this teen football movie pun intended thank you varsity blues was produced mtv and it really shows several extended scenes allow for continual soundtrack of mediocre pop songs meant appeal the adolescent male audience this crap was intended for the teenagers all have reasons for their melodramatic angst the adults all have problems of course and as onedimensional characters they are all fanatically obssessed how their local high school football team performs yes this movie represents high school life in mtvland this is land where your health teacher is also parttime stripper your ice cream store attendant girlfriend wears an egyptian ankh around her neck your kid brother forms cute cult your football coach is an uncaring obssessive madman and your friends lives consist of nothing but getting laid and driving around in cop cars naked all you as the main character want do however is read slaughterhouse five and attend brown university in the fall well at least this is little more realistic than mtvs the real world varsity blues stars james van der beek this weeks teen tv star making the leap the big screen he plays the hick moxxon adequately though some of his emotional dialogue will make people chuckle you dawnt own mah life who would want jon voight the stock evil guy in countless other movies is surprise the stock evil guy here but is he really evil or is he product of society after all everybody young and old in this movie has no life whatsoever and do nothing but obssess over high school football maybe the pressures of the screaming fans at the football field drove evil coach kilmer evil the films screenplay never answers this burning question at times iliffs story does show glimmers of touching or humorous scenes but before the audience gets their hopes up that there might be something redeeming in this movie they get trashed another lengthy party sequence or overwrought football game the movies pacing is slow and the plot turns are mindnumbingly obvious from start finish suppose am being little hard on varsity blues maybe am just little miffed that had pay bucks see it even though it was dollar night at the cinema something about request from the studio made the theater charge more money found the oftentimes ludicrous and boring three guys in front of us smuggled beer into the the theater wished had thought of that alcohol lots of it may have helped the viewing experience

susan grangers review of american outlaws warner bros thomas edisons the great train robbery was the first western ever made and jesse james under the black flag first introduced the outlaw folk hero now more than similarlythemed pictures later jesse james and his notorious gang of outlaws ride again in banal mtv spin on an american legend the story begins as jesse charasmatic colin farrell and his brother frank gabriel macht cole and scott younger scott caan will mccormack and trusty comanche tom nathaniel arcand after four years of fighting for the rebs in the civil war return liberty missouri only discover union troops are occupying their hometown and an avaricious east coast railroad baron thaddeus rains harris yulin is forcing farmers sell their land at less than true value aided allan pinkerton timothy dalton and his infamous detectives who back then were just thugs who provided security but when ma james kathy bates becomes one of their victims jesse and the rest of the guys gregory smith ty oneal joe stevens form the jamesyounger gang wreak revenge attacking the railroads supply lines sabotaging track and robbing the banks where the payroll is kept plus there is romance between jesse and spunky hometown gal lee mimms ali larter working from politicallycorrect clich drenched sanitized and revisionist screenplay roderick taylor and john rodgers director les mayfield keeps the action fastpaced and goes for lightweight laughs when he can the choppy editing hurts but russell boyds cinematography luke reichles designer duds and trevor rabins music lend authenticity on the granger movie gauge of american outlaws is galloping formulaic it is the wild west revisited as date movie

dear god this is fantastically bad regardless of what say about knock off you cannot grasp its awfulness from my words you have see it and experience it for yourself heres the kicker though suggest that you do so yes this is bad easily one of the most incompetent films of the year but it has certain misguided charm that makes it unique kind of disaster endure in fact enjoyed myself for most of its brief running time despite the dreadful acting and completely incomprehensible story do not get me wrong am not excusing knock off it reaches an unacceptable level of badness it is so incoherent that wonder if it was hacked up worse than the avengers was it also features some truly terrible performances from lela rochon michael wong paul sorvino and of course jeanclaude van damme it does however have the entertaining presence of rob schneider and the excessively inventive and pretentious direction of tsui hark as watched it occasionally wondered if it was aware of its own awfulness now in retrospect it seems clear that it was not but it is still fascinating kind of mess do not like writing plot descriptions it is far the most boring part of writing review but in this case am off the hook there is no way could write an accurate synopsis for knock off for the sake of comparison had no trouble understanding the usual suspects during my first viewing paid closer attention knock off and the only thing am able say about it is that van damme plays dude named ray and is accused the cia think of selling knock off products knock off products are of course products that look like namebrand materials but are generic and cheap do not know what any of this has do martial arts but there are lots of martial arts in the ray is good at martial arts so when he has beat up bad guys there is no problem rob schneider plays his sidekick although had no idea who he really was the end of the lela rochon is just some woman who accuses them of stuff while paul sorvino is both the good guy and the bad guy at once in fact every character goes through so many shifts from good bad that the end provides absolutely no insight into what any of them really do in that order knock off is completely incoherent and makes absolutely no sense but what strange mess it is it was written stephen de souza who also wrote die hard and hours can this be the same man do not see how unless of course huge chunks of the have been removed for the sake of running time knock off seems have an interesting premise as far as action films go but there is no semblance here for instance van damme is introduced and then seconds later he is running chariot race through the streets of hong kong why who knows what are the implications of this have no idea most action films abandon depth in favor of action and this is normally problem knock off however is the first that would have preferred see all of the talky sequences cut the acting is embarrassingly bad rochon in particular delivers each of her lines stiff and talentless insincerity sorvino in addition deserves better than this van damme is bad but he is charming in that bad way and so cannot say that he is hard watch although rarely understood what he was saying the only exception is rob schneider who is actually quite funny lot of the time tsui utilizes so many tricks that he makes john woo look tame comparison they are all pointless gimmicks though such as shots of the innerworkings of knock off running shoe but his action scenes are never boring one particular piece inside of fruit factory fruit factory is wellchoreographed lots of the scenes are pitched well comedy such as our heroes first encounter the rochon character but did tsui know that his is beyond ludicrous hope he did for the alternative is frightening thought knock off has the feel of truly terrible exercise in camp mania if it were boring would give it zero stars but it is not boring it is loud and excessive and completely incoherent it is also funny even when it is not meaning be funny bad that succeeds as entertainment does not deserve be fully lambasted recognize knock off for its irrefutable badness but cannot deny it is zany useless charm oh know they are just action scenes looking desperately for real story but they are fun action scenes amongst crowd of laughably inane concepts it is fun admire the awfulness of like this but that does not excuse the fact that it is indeed awful

welcome your ohso typical sequel it tries be twice as big as it is predecessor yet ends up twice as shallow shallow hmm now there is an idea maybe if the illfated cruise liner in this movie had struck shallow reef early on things may have turned out better the first thing that struck me and surprised me was that the camera work for the opening sequence anyway was terrible looked like the cameramen were drunk and kept tripping on their own feet very different the original movie the characters well not many of the characters actually had characters but heres rundown annie who was the highlight of the the original must have seriously banged her head in the train crash at the end of the first movie why because somethings got account for her losing that many iq points even though annie was not exactly rocket scientist in speed here some of her actions just make you want beat your head against wall for instance after successfully using chainsaw cut hole in door so that group of people can escape noxious gases she stands in the middle of the opening for about five minutes till someone reminds her that the people cannot get ut till she gets the chainsaw out of their faces bang bang bang in point of fact sandras character is turned into little more than one of those scantly dressed extras from hercules who constantly has be rescued jason patric all can say is bring back keanu keanu reeves might have the emotional range of tree stump but that is one more tree stump than jason has do not think he changed facial expressions all movie jason smile for the cameras now frown said frown oh you are bang bang bang wooden just does not describe this guys performance but it will have do the bad guy ahh william dafoe there is bright move how can you go wrong the star from that acknowledged classic body of evidence yes that is sarcasm his wide eyed maniac of character does not start out too bad but goes steadily downhill as the movie progresses in the end he degenerates chasing annie around for hostage even though he already has the money and can escape bang bang though would like give this movie double thumbs down there were some nice sequences considering the movie cost over million dollars you would hope there would be at least couple the real eyepopper for me even though it was given away in the trailer bang bang was the sequence where the cruise liner sideswipes the oil tanker this looks terrific and was very surprised hear that the cruise liner in it was completely computer generated wow do not think have ever seen cg model look so real before the sequence where jason patric in trying disable the propellers from under the ship is also terrific and the only time during the entire movie where you get that feeling of speed this lackofspeed problem affects many sequences such as the oil tanker part it was oh no we are going hit the oil tanker minutes later oh no we are going hit the oil tanker min you get the point this movie failed simply because it did not live up it is name there was very little feeling of speed in the original movie the lead characters had make split second decisions survive in this movie it felt more like well people we are gonna run into that there island in few hours think might stroll over engineering and see if cannot turn off the engines am passing the cafeteria on the way can get anybody anything the ending of this movie really is terrible even though it features what have since found out is one of the most expensive sequences ever in movie it just does not work at all the part where the liner crashes through the town looks very realistic but surprise surprise it just takes waaaaay too long it seemed go for minutes before the ship finally stopped one thing that struck me as extremely poor scriptiing was that as the ship crashes through the harbour and town around people are killed the ship and there is only or so people left on the ship so when it stops safe and sound and the characters are all cheering the audience is sitting back and thinking wait sec this is happy moment because bang bang then there was the dog almost fell out of my seat when saw the bit the dog dodging the falling debris putting dog in peril has become the ultimate cliche every movie seems have dogindanger sequence volcano dantes peak independence day daylight twister lost world etc etc this movie is perfect example of how not make sequel director jan de bont should try watching the orignal movie and this one backtoback and see if he realises where he went wrong

synopsis the president of company wants test his selfappointed successor who is psychotic and thinks it is great idea spend week him and their wives in an isolated cabin hundred miles from civilization no dependable transportation or means of communication after heavy snowfall comments tracks of killer had couple of strikes against it before even began watching it strike one was the fact that someone had scrawled the word garbage on the videotapes sticker in black marker not typically good sign when you rent strike two came while the previews played did you ever get sinking premonition about movies quality or lack thereof while watching the trailers that come before it well the cheesy films being advertised before tracks of killer were films that no one has ever heard of starring people no one knows and they all looked bad definately not good sign tracks of killer itself completed the strikeout about the only positive thing this had going for it was the fact that it sports some nice scenery be fair the first halfhour or so promises at least watchable thriller wolf larson who bears more than passing resemblance hugh grant adequately plays the underling obviously set up as the killer of the films title james brolin and kelly lebrock seem equally adequate as the loving couple larson will later threaten brolins character for some inexplicable reason thinks its great idea spend some time in cabin practically isolated lebrock and larson whom he is decided test for the week before giving him full control of his company the time the characters arrive at the cabin this begins become tedious apparently brolins successors test involves chopping wood for the fireplace and skiing do not seem like attributes necessary run business in the city but then again what do know about business do think though that they should have invested in some better furniture for the cabin its beds and closets have habit of just breaking at the slightest touch larsons character accidently kills his own wife rather than the couple he wants kill this leaves the movie an hour go and only three characters really is not enough sustain it the films writer must have taken cue from stephen king as scenes from tracks of killer seem lifted out of misery and geralds game larson and lebrock fight and torture each other the tables get turned couple of times while brolin tramps around in the snow looking for help some old guys around too just so the killer can add his body count without killing the couple who everyone knows will be alive at the end of the the old guy however miraculously survives his first death and appears later be killed again the killer in scene so ludicrous it is worthy of chuckle or two outside of that chuckle unfortunately tracks of killer will just bore you as the obvious plot is drawn out ad infinitum and the actors for some reason become increasing obnoxious if you are in video store and thinking about renting this turkey do not make tracks far superior suspense like misery

there should be requirement that potential viewer be under certain iq in order see mission mars there are probably quite few people who are going enjoy it and most of them will probably be those who have seen very few films of its kind but there are those who will not and those will most likely be people who have already seen one or more of the following movies space odyssey armageddon apollo the abyss close encounters of the third kind t the extraterrestrial alien and aliens why because there is not one original idea in mission mars all of it is cribbed from other films and in most cases better films if this is the sort of thing you do not mind you might like the of course there are other reasons not like mission mars the main one being script written people who seem assume their audience is filled people who have not used their brains in some time and who do not intend start during the films running time mission mars manages be both stupid and boring at the same time the plot cribbed greatly from concerns team sent mars the first manned trip ever made the red planet luke graham don cheadle leads the team jointly formed of americans and russians the team encounters mysterious monolith that emits strange pulse this being nothing like the pulseemitting monolith in that one was on the moon but when they try study it giant sand tornado comes out of the top and swallows them all except luke who survives long enough send garbled message back the rotating space station looks strangely like the rotating space station in rescue mission is planned husband wife team woody blake tim robbins and terri fisher connie nielsen obligatory pilot troubled past jim mcconnell gary sinise and extra crew member phil ohlmyer jerry oconnell along for the ride after some zerogravity dancing they run into problems when one of their engines is blown forcing them attempt desperate landing aboard supply vessel now stranded on mars minimal supplies the team must decide whether or not it can risk entering the monolith or if they should return home after all that monolith just might contain information about how life originated on earth mission mars is one of those films that makes critic wonder where start when talking about all the things that are wrong it so let us start one of the things that does work director brian de palma manages create some eerie tension in few scenes during the middle of the that is it everything else fails the failure is not de palmas fault he is working from an atrocious script only during the sequence aboard the ship looking an awful lot like the jupiter vessel in where the rescue teams air begins running out and they must frantically search for the hole and patch it up does mission mars come life scene where they attempt save comrade floating away into space also provides some tension until you realize that the entire dangermore dangerattempted rescue sequence has absolutely nothing do the rest of the it is just contrived way generate thrilling scenes take it out and the plot is not affected in any way the sequence also suffers from few plot holes as does the rest of the why is the ships computer sounds strangely like hal from uh able detect hole in the main chamber but not one in the engine why did tim robbins character have go outside the ship when the solution easily presented itself from inside should not the astronauts be better trained deal hull breach why are the characters such idiots because the script makes little attempt properly develop them all the conflict is clumsily delivered in excruciatingly obvious exposition in the opening scene rips off orson welles and robert altman utilizing long opening tracking shot during the characters repeatedly tell each other about things all of them should already know jim it is too bad you cannot go on this mission because you were determined psychologically inadequate because your wife died right before you were go on the mission together does anyone really talk like this cannot we find out these things in less grating matter like maybe in flashback the whole is like that the filmmakers are not content merely show us something and assume we know what is going on they must tell us exactly what we are looking at every time sample dialogue from the shot of mars astronaut look there is mars astronaut you sure that is mars astronaut yeah that is mars all right astronaut hey are you guys looking at mars that exchange is not actually in mission mars but would not be surprised if it were for all their cribbing from kubrick spielberg james cameron and even ron howard the makers of this have not learned do something all those directors did very well show and do not tell de palma used know how but seems have forgotten this is mentallychallenged filmmaking they assume the audience will not get what is going on so they explain everything five times over fourthgraders may appreciate this but more learned viewers will have their intelligence insulted the principal actors sleepwalk their way through mission mars never managing do away an apparent am just here get paycheck attitude cheadle stumbles over his awkward lines armin muellerstahl manages thoroughly embarrass himself in an unbilled cameo robbins puts his game face on and phones in his standard decent guy performance and sinise hams it up wistful facial expressions while watching tapes of his dead wife played kim delaney who only has one scene during she still manages deliver some ridiculous dialogue in heavyhanded monologue about the meaning of life and especially during the stolenfromnolessthanthreemovies lollipop whoever names them conclusion combines endless obvious explanation and subpar cgi effects gagging sentimentality and is sure alienate any viewers who had been enjoying the show up until then and of course these aliens from mars who facilitated the evolution of life on earth are entirely different from the aliens in who facilitated the evolution of life on earth those aliens were from an unknown world it could be said that fans of brainless action films might enjoy mission mars but such comment ignores the fact that the is also incredibly slowgoing leisurely pacing might have helped little more substance it but all of the substance of mission mars has been stolen from other films and those other films dealt their ideas in much more thoughtful fashion and generally contained more engaging characters supposedly we are intended choke up when one character decides not return home at the end of this one totally different from the onecharacterdecidesnottoreturn ending of armageddon but suspect most people will either be laughing or groaning me alternated between the two there is only one good thing about the way mission mars finally ends the fact that the movie is over

underwater science fiction stays submerged sphere review michael redman copyright michael redman one of the most unpleasant experiences that can occur in movie theater is when cast of fine actors end up in that wastes their talents you keep thinking what they might have accomplished the time they squandered psychologist norman goodman dustin hoffman is called the middle of the pacific ocean work the survivors of plane crash when he arrives at the site he discovers that there is no plane but rather an enormous spacecraft that has been sitting feet below the surface for almost years having written paper for the bush administration on how handle first contact he is chosen head up the team of scientists investigating the ship his group as outlined in his report consists of beth halperin sharon stone biochemist harry adams samuel jackson mathematician and ted fielding liev schreiber an astrophysicist unfortunately it turns out that the writing was blowoff project for goodman who did it for the money and named his thencolleagues the team after all he explains who reads government documents lead harold barnes peter coyote top secret federal operative the group descends mobile undersea headquarters set up next the alien vessel once there they stroll over knock on the door and explore the stilloperational ufo discovering the surprising origin of the ship and the crew finds an astonishing gigantic golden liquid metal sphere when adams enters the sphere the weirdness unfolds storm rolls in on the surface and the team is forced remain below just as an unseen presence begins communicate through their computer my name is jerry am happy flashes across the screen this is unsettling for the psychologist what happens if jerry gets mad he asks barnes is more pragmatic he needs last name because he cannot put in his report that they made contact an alien named jerry then the situation turns bad deadly beasts appear from nowhere gang of jellyfish kills one of the navy personnel lethal sea snakes attack goodman giant squid batters the habitat just as adams is reading leagues under the sea the suspicious scientists turn against each other this has all the makings of firstrate thinking mans science fiction however even the finest ingredients do not go very far in the hands of chief who does not seem care about his product director barry levinson has churned out mishmosh that does not engage the audience beyond few skillful suspense scenes the first of the zooms as the situation and players are introduced without any characterization or justification it is much like speedreading novel and realizing that you missed the nuances it does not get any better when the action scenes begin while the actors do an adequate job their limited roles the people are still flat oddly they hardly have reactions when deaths occur around them after adams experiences the interior of the sphere no one bothers ask him what happened their history together is an intriguing plot device but is barely exploited even goodman and halperins illconceived affair when she was his student is just mentioned in passing her psychotic tendencies are talked about but never convincing there is truism that items shown early in movie must be used before the ending but here they are far too obvious when an emergency minisub is explained you know what is going happen the movie affectations are nothing more than distracting chapter headings that divide the movie have no function the shaky camera work muddies already perplexing chaos much of what goes on is confusing and difficult follow although some of the disorientation eventually is understandable great deal of it is not even science fiction must be internally consistent there is too much here that does not make sense are the manifestations real the jellyfish kill queen latifa in throwaway role and the squid nearly destroys the outpost but the bites of the fatal snakes have no effect scene in the sub suggests that it is illusion but earlier episodes indicate that it is not not everything has be explained death but there are major questions that the never answers where the ship came from is clarified but how it ended up on the ocean floor in is merely alluded even the enigmatic sphere is still mysterious when the credits roll the climax is followed minutes of epilogue that does little but weaken the already labored tale after prerelease audience testing the actors were called back reshoot the ending it is difficult imagine how the original could have been worse following the recent tradition of lengthy films this weighs in at over two very long hours the weak scenes could have been cut but then there would not have been much left the movie was supposedly held up effects work but there is nothing special on the screen we never even see the monstrous squid or the menacing storm stealing from alien the abyss and the disastrous event horizon this has learned nothing from them remarkably levinson and hoffmans other currently showing is wag the dog smart and entertaining piece of work this one could have been titled the same sans one word

renowned hong kong action director tsui hark first teamed jeanclaude van damme on the action stars pairing dennis rodman _double_team_ and managed make what initially appeared be disaster into slick stylish and somewhat diverting action timekiller tsui continues energetically pile on the visual razzle dazzle in his latest collaboration the muscles from brussels _knock_off_ but this time around style neither save script that is at best ridiculous and at worst incomprehensible nor hide host of truly lousy performances writer steven desouzas fairly straightforward plotline is not as outre as _double_team_s strange yarn involving secret think tankprison but it makes about as much sense is little van damme plays marcus ray hong kongbased sales rep for jeans company who stumbles upon russian terrorist scheme implant powerful microchipsized bombs in hk product exports the s dolls electronic equipment and yes jeans it is all part of some type of ransom scheme but all remember isand kid you notgraphics on cia computer screen showing map of the world bombs detonating and an hatwearing figure on the other side of the world bursting out into laughter is what the crowd at the showing attended spontaneously did throughout _knock_off_ while all of van dammes films have its share of unintentional laughs mostly due the stiff acting skills of the physically agile van damme _knock_off_ delivers more than usual though not as many as van dammes embarrassing directorial effort _the_quest_ lot of the laughs are earned some particularly painful lines desouza smoked that badass like roman candle and entrepreneurship babycakes standing out among my favorites but it is indeed the pathetic performances that provide the bulk of _knock_off_s laughs van damme is true laughable form perhaps even worse than usual early scenes actually _require_ him make funny costar rob schneider improbably cast as deep cover cia agent posing as marcuss business partner and the sight and sound of the stillheavilyaccented van damme haplessly trying drop punchlines is hilarious in the wrong way even typically good actors are not immune the bad acting bug paul sorvino is unconvincing and terribly overwrought as schneiders cia superior and lela rochon playing an investigator for the jeans company spends the entire movie in perpetual snarl mode in rochons defense though her role requires her do little more than display her toned legs exquisite bone structure and perky bosoms the latter coming in handy for one key scene where she must fish for microbombs stuck in her ample cleavage tsui picks up where he left off visually in _double_team_ juicing up the proceedings inventive camera work here though tsuis visual razzle dazzle borders on over kill coming off as desperate attempts shield the inanity of the entire enterprise for each nifty trick tsui pulls off such as recurring visual theme that has the camera literally going through the circuitry of electronic devices there are others that are completely superfluous this is especially disconcerting when the trick in question could be clever when used in the right context for instance one scene early on has marcus putting his hand in box as he puts his hand in the same action is shown from an overhead camera angle in rectangle at the corner of the screen it is undoubtedly an interesting visual but it would have been nice if its use actually amounted something the test of van damme movie boils down the action sequences but surprisingly those in _knock_off_ leave much be desired tsui does what he can make something of them employing freeze frames blurred motion and unconventional camera angles but there is nothing fundamentally special about the fairly generic chase and fight sequences written desouza there is not anything as preposterously amusing as the climactic tigerland mine fight in _double_team_ let alone anything remotely close tsuis legendary hong kong works but that is given going in if tsui has any hope of approaching his countryman john woos stateside success he would do best break free from van damme before it is too late if he continues his involvement bgrade movies such as _knock_off_ the respect he has from hk action fans will continue diminish that is if it has not already disappeared entirely after this fiasco

upon first viewing of this movie the phrases been there and done that come quickly mind spy hard manages steal almost every joke from the zucker brothers films the most popular of are airplane and the naked gun series stealing stuff can be profitable in this industry but only when you steal the right stuff what little plot there is involves dick steele aka agent wd leslie nielsen trying save the world from an almost deranged madman played andy griffith along the way it goal goal the manages spoof mainly the james bond type films but also manages hit on films such as home alone and sister act the trick about spoofing is that you have actually be funny or at the least satirical spy hard achieves neither as it borrows all of the wrong elements from the superior zucker brothers films the dick the world is in danger what is it well it is big roundish ball floating in space around the sun am paraphrasing type of exchange is used at least four times in the opening ten minutes of the each time getting progressively less funny what they should have stolen were the background sight gags were so effective in the zucker brothers films while writing their own dialogue director rick friedberg focuses more on the mug shots of his actors especially nielsen who can do this quite well than on the delivery and context of their lines much of the time cutting the punchline short the whole seems be in race itself be over as is evident in the final sequence where there is no comedic denouement after the climax as was usual in the zucker brothers films and in spy hard the end credits tend replace this being out of context one of the more amusing was captain of the enterprise james kirk overall thought this was very weak effort while all of the right films spoof were chosen they used none of the right spoofing methods next time they should spy little bit harder excellent one of kind must see entertaining worth the price of admission fair nothing much special what were they thinking

fast one of the only minute films that have gotten bored through men in black has defied the odds when first saw that the flick was minutes long thought maybe that this was poor attempt at an that becomes old about minutes into the movie tommy lee jones and will smith play two government agents who are responsible for keeping order in alien society the ridiculous plot begins when an alien bug played weirdly vincent donofrio who was so great in full metal jacket lands on earth retrieve galaxy that is somewhere on orions belt anyway the basic plot revolves around jones and smith stop this bug from getting the galaxy or higher power will blow up the earth the premise is ridulous but that is not why did not like this love original plots this one had an original one but director barry sonnenfeld did something this that ruined its plot he made the drag and also put in unncessary elements in it that are found in romance films whenever saw donofrios bug stomp and eat people in
