there are movies that pose question in its first five minutes and spend the rest of the time trying answer it then there are movies that spend the whole time posing questions and try answer it all in the last five minutes writerdirector john herzfelds two days in the valley falls into the latter category weaving together grabbag of seemingly unrelated characters herzfelds tries very hard keep the audience guessing altmanesque series of parallel stories hitmen lee james spader and his partner dosmo danny aiello pop guy in bed while leaving his drugged wife becky fox teri hatcher lying next him showing the audience where on her behind she got nicely pricked an understandeably shocked becky runs out of the house the next morning before hailing down couple of vice cops jeff daniels and wes eric stoltz murder is not vice territory flirting asian prostitues is but wes would rather play inquisitive detective meanwhile washedup director teddy paul mazursky is about end his life but before he can do that he must find good home for his dog enter nurse audrey marsha mason who takes the dog and teddy for ride stuffy art dealer allan hopper greg cruttwell has kidney stones while struggling about his fancy house he switches between moaning in selfpity and dropping condescending hints about his loyal secretarys glenne headly plain appearance do not be surprised if you find yourself asking more than once just what the hell is going on you might like that feeling of cluelessness herzfeld does answer all the questions in the course of time and pieces it all rather neatly in the last five minutes the jigsaw puzzle assembled is not stunning any means though the characters lack the stature or moral complexity of altmans reallife heroes in short cuts even though they are interesting and funny funny that is if you are not comparing them the likes of tarantinos pulp chcaracters the tieup is tidy but nowhere near the squeaky clean resolution of directors name guy who also did last seduction red rock west two days is not bad movie but there is not much else it than the screenplay novelty of the linkage of seemingly unrelated characters it will keep you guessing alright but you will not remember the answers five minutes after the credits the flying inkpot rating system wait for the tv broadcast little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

warning may contain slight mild spoilers rated for intense violencegore some strong sexuality and language starring arnold schwarzeneggar robin tunney rod stieger gabriel byrne running time minutes we go into movie theater boom the lights go down our hearts race we go through ten minutes of preview and finally the movie we have been waiting see for long time comes on we sit there watch in disbelief that this movie is as bad as it is why should not have know what was getting myself into again like this past summers hit stigmata end of days may be worse it is not like this is any kind of original idea it just throws in some rosemarys baby along the devils advocate little exorcist and some stigmata here and there whala you have end of days movie that is extremely disappointing and the previews made it look terrific sadly but truly again like most recent films all the good parts are in the trailers the plot is very confusing at times is also very ludicrous and the movie is destined be hit in the first weekend and flop in the next jericho cane arnold schwarzneggar in hit typical macho role is cop who finds out that he is chosen track down satan living in gabriel byrnes body and stop him from impregnating christine york robin tunney because if he does and she gives birth all existence as we know it will cease exist he has do this before it turns into the year and strangely he is trying fight him minutes before comes he seeks help from the catholic church and help from rod stieger in terrific role and tries save this girl leading an ending that is satisfying but turns into typical action movie that is pretty much it on plot it does have the razzle and dazzle of great action movie and the dollar budget parts seem show it parts you have wonder where all the money went as for arnie good role ok performance think since he is getting little older he is held back lot of his stunts the thing that disappointed me was the fact that there was nothing the in the trailers it looks like good scary action and ends up being boring long and preposterous drama that leads into something else that leaves us questions gabriel byrnes who ironically played priest in stigmata here plays satan and gives good performance but again seems held back and not into his character two years back al pacino gave terrific performance in the fun the devils advocate and here it seems like the idea of him is in the character also robin tunney great performance as always plays satans main person whom he wants impregnate carry his child of course rod stieger gives another great performance really is not nothing new the direction peter hyams is at times bit overblown though not nearly as the visual style was in stigmata here we are given great camera work and some great scenes that are terrifically directed but sadly just do not work in this movie the script written andrew marlowe has few witty lines but again the movie is all style and no substance and the ending finale climax was ready go home only few things work here and those are few of the performances the writing and visual style but the storyline and the finished product do not work as well the sad thing is that end of days had so many things going for it the plot could have been more organized the action scenes could have been more brainy and less mindnumbing at times it seems like armageddon and started get old and tiresome is running out of ideas bad and like have always said before needs new ones even its budget end of days is less than pleasing in fact the dollar budget is at least over and easily could have had m budget maybe sound crazy but am really looking forward the new exorcist and hope that they make it as good as the original we need get new ideas and stop recycling old ones just make money at the boxoffice we need get more films like the blair witch project that could scare people death while people thinking well what exactly is scaring them and how do know that it is in fact the blair witch overblown effects stupid and thin plotline good performances disappointing umm yup those pretty much describe end of days

my name is jack carter and you do not want know me says our brooding antihero sylvester stallone take his advice know this guy is as rewarding as being thrown over terrace and watch this is almost as painful get carter is gloomy looking unimaginative that offers no joy jack carter is as tough as tough guys come he works out of vegas as selfdescribed financial adjuster explaining his duties he says people make promises and break them help them remember he has chiseled body full of tattoos he has the weathered look indicative of man who has seen his share of hard times he speaks in hushed but menacing tone of voice in other words this is sylvester stallone acting like sylvester stallone and like most of his previous roles his character is shallow onedimensional thug whose modus operandi is talk tough hassle few hapless people find out what he needs know and then dispense his own kind of justice the charisma of pit bull being tough is all that jack carter knows yet even tough guys know when put family first as the story begins we learn that jacks little brother has died in car accident the police attribute it heavy drinking however jack is suspicious believing that he was taken out he takes break from his vegas duties and tries see if he can find the truth as he pokes around he runs into several lowlife characters they include shady business partner prostitute dweebish millionaire molded after bill gates and an oily owner of porn website any one of them may know something about his brothers death all of them have the means of carrying out the deed but do not expect an exercise in sleuthing where wellplaced clues lead carter the truth he is all brawn and no brains so there are no epiphanies during his investigation instead he uses intimidation muscle his way forward cycling through this circle of suspects flustered his lack of progress he cycles through them again and again this all gets tiring fairly quickly the time the launches into its final act we are numb from its pedestrian pace oddly as toughguy thriller it starves us for action admittedly there is one nifty chase sequence but this is related tangential and needless plot carters vegas ties send thugs retrieve him the story also fails generate any kind of emotion stallone has the personality of slab of stone and the look and feel of the is perpetually downcast the weather is constantly overcast or rainy meanwhile most shots take place at night in dimly lit rooms or in dark alleys it is just impossible get stirred about that kind of atmosphere as result get carter amounts nothing more than flat thriller bereft of clever moments and devoid of any excitement you are better off leaving this guy alone

you would think that this films dismal failure would be due american filmmakers getting hold of brilliant british comedy and americanizing it you would be wrong since full blame can be placed on the very folks who wrote and created the series rowan atkinson robin driscoll and richard curtis should you ever happen meet those chaps do me favor grab them the hair and yell really loudly in their ear what were you thinking have you ever heard the phrase if it as not broke do not fix it then walk away the concerns mr bean atkinson and his visit america while escorting the painting of whistlers mother an american buyer played burt reynolds in the type of bit part that his success in boogie nights should hopefully do away now how or why mr bean is sent on this trip makes no sense and cannot even describe how the explains it the point is that mr bean comes america and causes wacky trouble problems problems problems where begin first the score music from the tv show has been completely replaced score that is either at times one note away from the score from beetlejuice or one note away from the score from rob roy then the song choices are totally uninspired good vibrations love a wow do not put any thought into that guys also bean makes way too much noise in the the character does not speak much but in the series you really only heard the laughter of the audience and maybe the occasional murmur from mr bean each episode was like chaplin silent movie in the bean is constantly moaning grunting whining etc it is annoying and just plain wrong for the character the main problem though is that it is just not funny each episode of the series there would be dozens of really great laughs crammed into less than minutes multiply that running time three however and the laughs steadily decrease they even have the gaul repeat jokes from the series sad and creatively lazy as series mr bean only ran for about episodes or so why on earth did atkinson and the gang decide it was time completely rework everything halfhour episodes certainly had not exhausted all possible situations all can say positively for the at this point is that it is almost appropriate for all ages if it was not for couple of scenes where it appears as though mr bean is having sex things and even that is not very positive statement please guys go back england and go back television so you will make me laugh again pg

robin williams has the rarest of gifts the ability rise above the most inept material and suffuse it his irreverent style overwhelmingly his worst films are pleasantly diverting at worst and enjoyable at best the notable exception of flubber so when the one person who has refused abandon him despite patch adams tell you that not even williams can save his latest project you know it is in trouble jakob the liar is confused muddled little movie generically uplifting fundamental contradiction the message it delivers is depressing as opposed inspiring and the movie does not realize it williams plays jakob haim jew imprisoned in polish ghetto during world war ii one night he wanders outside after curfew and is promptly sent the office of highranking german officer for his punishment jakob gets off easy and he gets hear approximately seconds of radio broadcast the announcement in english but punctuated triumphant heil hitler is that russian troops are only miles away from jakobs ghetto liberation he thinks the next day jakob tells the news his closest friend volatile prize fighter named misha liev schreiber who despite being sworn secrecy passes the message along soon it is common assumption in the ghetto that jakob has radio hidden in his home crime punishable death this is absurdly false but the more jakob tells the people of the ghetto this the more convinced they become that he is abreast of the latest developments in the war that is decide their fate the danger of course is that the germans allegedly have informants throughout the ghetto and rumors about the radio can get out and put jakob in great danger in curiously irrelevant subplot jakob finds year old girl who has separated from her parents and decides hide her in his small home apparently he is afraid that she will be discovered and goes great length make sure of that just why the idea frightens him is never made clear he and the girl build an uninvolving generic relationship that never goes anywhere and is as irrelevant at the end as it was in the beginning the moral of the story is that hope is the best medicine but jakob the liar forgets that the hope that jakob brings his ghetto is false such hope inevitably leads expectations of its realization and when those expectations are not met the results are far worse than if there was no hope that is the films biggest detriment it is based on false assumption and thus comes off as painfully false it is never moving because it does not give us anything be moved jakob the liar fails tug any heartstrings destroys its purpose for existing robin williams does not inject the life as matter of fact he seems little out of it as if crippled his fake accent he is stragely unenthusiastic his character is one who spreads hope but his performance is lifeless hopeless not since good will hunting has he abandoned his signature style this extent this is not the robin williams we know and love in good will hunting he became serious actor and won an oscar for it here he is more of wannabe serious actor an impostor jakob the liar will be compared last years life is beautiful because it is being marketed as holocaust comedy it is not comedy it tries sometimes but it rarely works is it melodrama war movie character study no no and no jakob the liar is the kind of movie that cannot be placed into category not because it covers so many different genres but because it fails at just about every one it attempts

say tell me if you have seen this before crisis onboard commercial airliner causes stewardess have fly and land the plane herself airport anyone ray liotta is psychotic serial killer being transported from new york california on christmas eve amazingly on what would seemingly be busy day of travel on one of the most flown routes only about six other passengers are on the flight anyway they take off liotta escapes and kills all the police and the pilots and stewardess lauren holly locks herself in the cockpit fly the plane the story is beyond routine the script is embarrassing at one point this jumbo jet is flying completely upside down the characters are worthless and the performances are annoying surprisingly cowriter steven de souza actually wrote the first two die hard movies turbulence takes place at christmas time yet the was released few days after the holidays brilliant marketing as no one cares about anything having do christmas after december th the studio knew they had bomb and purposely dumped it out when the fewest number of people would see it r

it should have been classic great cast of respected supporting actors an interesting premise of loser comic book characters however mystery men proved be one of the great disappointments of the jokes were bland and hackneyed from talents who have previously made audiences laugh their unique rituals the number of cliches and shallow characters made the difficult sit through seriously hurting its attempt of having fast paced premise the script tried deliver series of small jokes throughout the but without big laughoutloud joke and mediocre small jokes it failed miserably at being entertaining at all the jokes were not funny for number of reasons they had been used number of times before in previous films the best ones were mediocre begin were ruined in the trailer and the expectation of laughing at clever unique gags from clever unique comedians when there were none laugh at greatly damaged the mystery men might have worked if it was an ensemble cast of newcomers trying break into the business but veterans doing this kind of junk it really questioned whether their other work was as funny as originally thought thankfully most actors in this movie will appear in five other movies before the new year arrives help viewers forget this little movie the follows band of wannabe superheroes living in wannabe gotham city who are ridiculed their fellow citizens and villains because of their clumsiness and failure save they day and capture the bad guy the fact is these pathetic losers are not needed because their city already has successful superhero captain amazing who has recently captured every evildoer in the city captain amazing played terribly an uninspired greg kinnear because of his success in the past is worried that he will lose popularity after freeing one of the most notorious bad guys in the city geoffrey rush overacting just bit too much keep himself busy things get out of hand when captain amazing is captured it is up the wannabe superheroes save the day the time this section of the plot is finished the interest for what happens if you have not already figured it out is very low there are very few scenes catch the viewers complete attention the first scene in the shows the wannabes trying save the day feels like it was seriously edited down right when it was beginning become slightly funny seeing these actors get humiliated at an old folks home some masked goons captain amazing comes in and saves the day or ruins the movie instead of editing this scene more editing should have been done in areas such as the unnecessary romance between mr furious ben stiller and monica waitress claire forlani or the vast majority of the is the heroes talking at coffee table about how their day was simple rule more silly action is needed in order make silly action movie work another major problem mystery men is that every actor in it seemed very uncomfortable and consequently gave terrible performances the depended on its cast work fluently together like bunch of old friends working together in an amiable reunion however most characters seemed like they did not even want be in this or at least the script made it seem this way pull one of the actors in this randomly out of hat paul reubens who disappeared from acting everyones joy returns here leaving very little be impressed about as wannabe who uses flatulence for weapon all of his jokes must therefore be fart jokes fart jokes that have all been heard before and will inevitably be heard again in future films thanks the success of american pie and there is something about mary mystery men drags on towards the end point where anything else in the world is more entertaining anyone brain knows each one of the heroes is going be successful at their talent in the end and each one is going contribute in helpful way so why continue watch this is far from worthy guilty pleasure mystery men indeed does this and every time character succeeds another one congratulates him and says knew you could do it mystery men fails in every category it attempts pass what makes this so bad is that it had the potential be wonderful and unforgettable terrible acting terrible script and terrible waste of time changes opinions about all of these actors am unpredictable an overexcited ben stiller shouts out no ben you are the complete opposite

in my review of the spy who shagged me postulated an unbreakable law of physics every time sequel is as good as or better than the previous in the series it is followed third movie that is bore the cause is probably complacency studio sighs relief when part lives up expectations and figures part is sure thing scream provides the latest proof of this rule in los angeles production has begun on stab return woodsboro the most recent installment in the series of movies inspired the murders surrounding sidney prescott neve campbell however life soon starts imitating art and stab cast members turn up stabbed smelling yet another book deal gale weathers courteney cox arquette comes the set investigate and finds her exboyfriend dewey riley david arquette acting as technical consultant and getting chummy jennifer parker posey the actress playing gale in stab elsewhere our heroine sidney is living in hiding under an assumed name until she gets phone call from familiar evil voice the late randy meeks jamie kennedy makes surprise guest appearance via video explain the rules of trilogy he notes the third chapter in trilogy has an overabundance of exposition and huge backstory contend indeed scream tries link its murders back the one that started it all the murder of sidneys mother maureen before the beginning of the original scream at the scene of each murder in scream the killer leaves photo of sidneys mother maureen as teenager in and even includes note claiming be her real killer find out who the killer is our intrepid investigators have uncover what happened during maureens missing years when she was starlet appearing in lowbudget horror films even that little information you can probably already guess what the killers relationship sidney is unlike its predecessors scream does not have the guts even suggest that the central characters might be the killer the characters we do suspect are all undeveloped so that the end we do not even care who the killer is the jaded detective patrick dempsey the kinky producer lance henriksen the driven young director scott foley the ingenue emily mortimer the character who turns out be the killer seems be selected at random wes craven supposedly filmed three different endings keep the real one secret so it is quite possible the one in the final cut was randomly chosen the series trademark references other horror films have become trite and obvious possibly it is the absence of screenwriter kevin williamson who penned the first two or maybe it is that the hip ironic stance eventually consumes itself and series that parodies cliches eventually becomes cliche groaned as an attack on sidney from the first scream was repeated momentformoment in the set of her home at some point referencing becomes just means cover up poverty of new ideas scream also continues the tradition of having an eclectic set of cameos and familiar faces in small roles look for jenny mccarthy carrie fisher patrick warburton puddy from seinfeld roger corman and jason mewes and kevin smith as jay and silent bob walk through at some point all these bit players put forth more effort than the series returning stars who are probably saving their energy for the long post scream job search another prediction made in previous review has come pass more movies are copying the blair witch project web strategy scream has three official websites that wink wink pretend that the events of the movie are real and provide additional backstory information not covered in the movie the sunrise studios site scream com has trailers for other sunrise releases as well as the latest stab news there is also gail weathers official site galeweathers com and sunrise sucks site that has more stab scandals the studio wants cover up sunrisesucks com craven and company promise that this is the last installment in the scream series while hope that is true do not hold out much hopehorror movie series are even harder kill than their monsters there is halloween hk in the works even though michael myers was beheaded in and freddy vs jason has been talked about for awhile despite the fact that both characters were killed off there is bound be scream someday even if it starts over new set of moviestar wannabes bottom line they should have called this one yawn

for movie such deep religious and spiritual undertones it is surprising find the messenger the story of joan of arc such an ungodly mess in the early mid there was little in the way of spiritual light be found shining from the heart of man or woman the church was dismally dark and oppressive place france was involved in the hundred years war against england there was no strong political leadership in the country morale was low there being little hope for the future it was within this setting that young french girl began hearing voices and seeing visions convinced that these were messages from god she brazenly demanded see the dauphin in order deliver the message directly him the message if he would give her an army command she would deliver him the crown he does and she does then once seated on the throne he abandons her her english captors director luc besson the fifth element may have cowrote the script but he never appeared have proper handle on the material the inconsistencies of the cast the confusing blur of the violent battle scenes the inappropriate musical score and the lack of vibrant life force at the center of the adds up largely disappointing end product is oftentimes unintentionally laughable his biggest miscue was cast his wife milla jovovich the fifth element in the title role ms jovovich looks spectacular as joan clad in battle armor astride similarly protected horse if looks were enough fully convey character she would have been brilliant since it is not she tried and failed act the part her joan is unbalanced inspiring the troops merely screaming stridently and waving her banner or sword over her head like woman possessed john malkovich being john malkovich fares bit better as the dauphin who joan would see on the throne as charles vii an easily manipulated man his weakness of character foreshadows the betrayal of joan would lead her death faye dunaway the thomas crown affair gives strong performance in minimal screen time as the dauphins motherinlaw and chief advisor the army under joans command are comprised of comical figures more stooges than soldiers the one exception would be tcheky karyo la femme nikita as dunois the man who was leading the attack prior joans arrival trying plan systematic campaign he sees his leadership authority negated joans insistence on following her visions dustin hoffman sphere has small inhuman role as joans conscience begins speaking her while awaiting trial dressed like cloaked monk he leads her doubt herself and her revelations as well she should scriptures do speak of revelation god via his gift of holy spirit is able communicate men three of the nine manifestations of holy spirit listed in corinthians deal receiving revelation they are word of knowledge word of wisdom and discerning of spirits even the scriptures themselves are result of god giving revelation his holy men who spake as they were moved holy spirit e revelation but the scriptures also caution us beloved believe not every spirit but try the spirits whether they are of god because many false prophets are gone out into the world john kjv joans end being burned at the stake at the age of the frenzy mob rule and blood lust her inspiration wrought and the death pain or suffering followed her campaign all point devilish influence rather than godly one while her conviction and intense believing remains an admirable quality she was as others have been before and since misled the spiritual master of deception as messenger she was quite effective she was just confused as whose message she was carrying

possibly the years the most anticipated and finally it arrives here in the uk it smashed s box office office records in it is opening weekend and will no doubt do the same here but is it any good in word no will elaborate further the story is as follows apparently there were two islands dinosaurs on one where the dinos lived untouched mankind and the other tourist attraction failed before it even opened see jurrasic park imgen the company that funded jurrasic park want reccover their losses taking more dinos off the other island and move them new attraction in san diago realizing what bad idea this is proffessor john hammond richard attenborough decides send team document the dinosaurs so as rally public support preserve the island enter familiar mumbling man jeff goldblum who only agrees go when told his girlfriend is already there so basically what you have is this two teams one sent catch and move some dinosaurs the mainland and the other trying document them being forced work together fighting for survival against the dinosaurs firm intentions on eating them fairly good idea however it is let down one slight problem it is crap over two hours of chase scenes gets way too boring way too quiclky add this terrible script and some feeble attempts at some occasional characterisation and you end up very disinterested it becomes background noise while your mind starts concentrating on things like what is for tea and should you cut the lawn later yes you should it is shame then really that spielberg has lowered himself into making what essentially is blatant cash in adds practically nothing the far superior jurrasic park only few creative and genuinely tense scenes and fabulous g dinosaurs the rexs have be seen be believed there is nothing else recommend the lost world very dissapointing sequel indeed

holy man boasts sweet gentle comic performance from an unusually subdued eddie murphy and few moderately funny skits unfortunately get the good stuff you have sit through painfully long setup loads of tedious filler interminable shots of jeff goldblum stammering and twitching superfluous romantic subplot and quite possibly the most annoying performance of robert loggias career if ever movie screamed wait for video so you can fastforward through all the dull and annoying parts this is it eddie murphy plays a robed nomadic pilgrim wandering the land enjoying the moment and spreading his spiritual message chance meeting ricky hayman goldblum stressedout executive of homeshopping channel and kate newell kelly preston nononsense media analyst results in physical injury quicker than you can say the odd couple ends up rooming an extremely leery ricky after some script gymnastics appears live on the air at the good buy shopping network wreaking havoc on the cheesy product demonstrations enraging network owner mr mcbainbridge loggia and becoming national media sensation holy man attempts be several things at once it tries satirize home shopping networks but it is difficult effectively make fun of something that is already selfparody the attempts teach us that collecting material possessions is merely futile attempt fill the spiritual holes in our hearts but that is common knowledge already holy man also tries present story of redemption as ricky hayman tries decide whether exploit gs good will achieve financial security or do the right thing at the expense of his career anyone want place wager on his final decision the one genuine asset in holy man is eddie murphy who gives charming performance sharing love good will and relevant advice all those around him while beaming his million dollar smile at just the right moments murphy is delightful and the takes off whenever he is onscreen unfortunately he is not onscreen enough jeff goldblum gets the lions share of screen time and his tired storyline weighs the proceedings down as his potential love interest kelly preston tries brighten things up but she transforms from an allbusiness media shark an empathic softy far too quickly and the abrupt change reeks of contrivance the other principal actor robert loggia wastes his talents in onenote turn as ruthless screaming monster structurally unsound and way too long holy man is appealing when murphy is onscreen and dull when he is not instead of dropping your money at the theater for this trifle wait until it hits video and fastforward past everything except the murphy scenes suggests that we focus on enjoying the moment and that is the best way do so

it is actually not so bad that dreamworks decided release the love letter at about the same time as star wars episode the phantom menace because this way less people will have sit through this dreadful little comedy and no really do not feel guilty about wishing this movie death at the boxoffice really do not not at all the plot has been done before mysterious unaddressed love letter shows up in small town causing confusion for everyone who reads it the center of the ensuing disaster is bookstore owner helen kate capshaw and the way what is it bookstore owner main characters in the past year and half we have seen them in life is beautiful you have got mail this movie and the upcoming notting hill who finds the letter in between couch cushions in the bookstore she immediately starts testing other people see who it might be from and comes the incorrect conclusion that the author of the note is young employee played tom everett scott he reading the letter himself assumes that she wrote it for him after while they fall in love well duh kate feels guilty about getting in relationship someone more than twenty years younger than her and she also feels guilty because at the same time she is also involved the town fireman tom selleck add her turmoil her mother shows up blythe danner who apparently must have had her daughter when she was about and her trusted bookstore manager deadpan ellen degeneres quits supporting characters are not called supporting for nothing their purpose is not just move the plot along they are also supposed give the storyline backbone do this they must exhibit at least marginal depth and must also be interesting rarely can movie work if it puts an interesting protagonist in the middle and surrounds her hackneyed dull cardboard secondary characters especially when at the core of the movie is the protagonists various interactions them this is the love letters damning error capshaws character is as good as have seen present in recent romantic comedies but the people that surround her are all either underwritten or purely onedimensional because of that the love letter is awkward and insincere even worse it is bore liked capshaw and her helen but everyone else is painfully fake undermining the little drama or sexual tension that has the potential exist there is nothing particularly hilarious about all this either and besides degeneres wisecracks there is little that is even little amusing this is not completely thoughtless and director peter hosun chan does good job of portraying helens yearnings and various subtle complexities but it is far from profound there is not common theme running through the proceedings thus the movie seems thoughtfully pointless really this is harmless little movie it is far from an abomination and it is not torturous sit through but bad it is awful it also is the love letter is failure and an inane failure at that eugene novikov

surrounded hype high hopes and the promise of an overthetop performance cluelesss brittany murphy do not say word looked full of promise hell when hear that will never tell whisper on the tv commercial goose bumps run up my spine alas word is filled little but disappointment kooky mix of girl interrupted and ransom michael douglas and company collecting paycheck plod through vapid and dull kidnapping thriller douglas stars as nathan conrad renowned new york psychologist devoted father of jessie conrad skye mccole bartusiak and loving husband aggie conrad famke janssen after gang of jewel thieves headed sean beans koster kidnaps his daughter nathan is forced extract from his new patient the catatonic and violent elisabeth burrows murphy the location of some hidden bank job booty that her father hid from the koster gang decade ago but hardnosed detective sandra cassidy jennifer esposito doing her best lo impression tracking down koster and his gang of hoodlums the stakes are raised as nathan races against the clock crack the mystery of elisabeths head in order get the goods inside the catch nathan only has until five of the clock solve the puzzle whoa the suspense is almost too much do not say word loses the audience inside of minutes murphy looks and acts like linda blair from the exorcist during the first part of the movie then turns around and reprises like her role from girl interrupted and the only real crazy be found in the is director gary fleders things do in denver when you are dead staggering use of flashback sequences oliver platt famke janssen and even sean bean are decent actors but the stuff they are given here such as bedridden wife fighting off the token black guy her crutch is insulting and demeaning additionally the use of the surveillance cameras and laptops track nathans every move is downright unbelievable how do excons fresh out of the big house afford all this equipment despite its flaws do not say word is surprisingly some of the best mainstream you will find this month and audiences will lap it up americans love lukewarm halfbaked thrillers starring big names and accompanied cheap thrills someone get me my lithium

some concepts seem patently hopeless from the beginning liveaction version of mr magoo being prime example the cartoon figure mr magoo the bumbling blind man can be quite funny but only in small doses and only within the confines of animated images if you think naked gun star leslie nielsen is dubious choice play the role of the short guy who runs into walls you are right but there is an even more astonishing selection for director they tapped hong kongs stanley tong whose resume consists mainly of handful of movies featuring martial arts expert jackie chan the story such that there is one is about large stolen ruby looks woolworth reject mr magoo gets it and of course does not realize he has it mayhem then ensues as the bad and the good guys chase each other mr magoo frequently oblivious the fact that anyone is being chased like home alone but without any class mr magoo can only be described as painfully bad fifteen minutes of it feels like an eternity the movies humor is pathetically lame and the pacing is way off when one is stuck in theater for an hour and half watching what claims be motion picture one looks for some solace mr magoo provides only three such moments the movie begins and ends the classic cartoon version of the character who exudes his usual charm the only other saving grave in the movie itself is angus the sweet little bulldog angus demonstrates more genuine emotions and wider acting range than any of the humans in the picture finally the ending credits contain outtakes of the movie have some of the genuineness and spontaneity that the movie badly lacked rather than attempt adapt mr magoo noncartoon movie nielsen makes the strategic mistake of trying literally be human version of the cartoon he has trouble sustaining the squinting eyes and the affected voice and even when he does it comes off as awkwardly unfunny my wife managed get some sleep during the movie but was not so lucky hopefully this picture will force producers think harder about subjects have promise and do not mr magoo runs it is rated pg for comic violence and would be acceptable for all ages my son jeffrey age said he thought the movie was good and really funny but recommends you not choose it if you want an action movie he said he liked home alone much more his friend maxim age said that he thought it was good but very silly and parts did not make sense his other friend nickolas age said he would give the movie but that it was really silly

breakdown is an moderately entertaining if underwhelming thriller kurt russell and kathleen quinlan play couple jeff and amy taylor taking the scenic route california through redneck country however while in the middle of nowhere their jeep decides break down leaving them stranded friendly truck driver warren walsh offers give them lift town although jeff rejects the offer he wants stay his car amy agrees hops into warrens lorry and promptly disappears jeff wonders where the hell she is and when he later catches up warren and warren says he has never seen amy in his life the plot thickens and jeff goes on chase find his wife although comparisons can be made this deliverance and the vanishing plot wise the latter two are far superior character and script wise kurt russell is k as jeff although he can seemingly only pull of one expression is angry throughout the whole he looks angry or just pissed off quinlan is k again but again she can only pull off one expression is looking dorky throughout the whole she looks dorky t walsh who sadly recently passed away is fine as warren who we soon find out is kidnapper although his actual character is pretty weak and not really menacing enough the supporting cast do their best aswell rex linn as doubting sheriff and the other kidnappers the story written firsttimer jonathan mostow who also directs is k if surprisingly familiar and sometimes extraordinarily stupid some of the things the characters do in this movie is beyond the bounds of idiocy there are some flaws the plot also as the characters do the complete opposite logical presumably keep the story exciting and also the fact that the story just is not strong enough sustain the audiences attention the picture moves along very slowly also it almost threatens drop dead the picture does pick up towards the end but then it is too late mostow directs the action sequences well enough however the does not really come satisfying conclusion either the ending tries be bleak but just comes off annoying breakdown could of been far more enjoyable picture had it had stronger cast and director instead it just turns out be merely average missed opportunity overall rating review david wilcock

ugh that about sums this movie up just ugh the original godzilla movies are somewhat of cult classic and when reviewing the previous films each had certain degree of intelligence and that was the reason they found such an enviable cult following in spite of bad special effects horrible dubbing and man in lizard suit they maintained certain degree of how put this dignity not quite the word am looking for you understand right and in years godzilla has maintained that degree of whatever leave it america screw the whole thing up from the geniuses that brought us independece day arguably the worst scifi movie of all time ruin whatever reputation godzilla had while they do bring us eyepopping special effects that will amaze you they lost what was at the center of all the original godzilla movies storyline summing up the movie is simple heck can do it in one sentence giant lizard attacks giant city and bunch of nobodies stop it simple as that matthew broderick stumbles over his lines and it is hard picture hank azaria in any role besides his classic dogwalking character on the television show mad about you the dialogue seems be improvized almost as if there was no rehearsel done at all can see the scene on the set right now all right we spent all of this money making big special effects and we have gotta get this movie out summer or it is going bomb in our faces so you actors just say what ever comes the top of your head all right make up something mkay good roll the special effects are enough keep you interested through one viewing and some of the cinemtography is welldone the scene the black umbrellas comes mind still an hour into it you will become antsy wondering how long they can drag it out and drag it out they do have laugh the slogan for the is size does matter think they cut this too short it should read size does matter acting does not

ripe explosions mass death and really weird hairdos tsui harks double team must be the result of tipsy power lunch that decided jeanclaude van damme needs another notch on his bad moviebedpost and nba superstar dennis rodman should have an acting career actually in double team neithers performance is all that bad have always been the one critic defend van damme he possesses high charisma level that some genre stars namely steven seagal never aim for it is just that he is never made movie so exuberantly witty since timecop and rodman well he is pretty much rodman he is extremely colorful and therefore he pretty much fits his role t even if the role is that of an excia weapons expert it is the story that needs some major work van damme plays counterterrorist operative jack quinn who teams up arms dealer yaz rodman rub out deadly gangster stavros mickey rourke all beefy and weirdlooking in an antwerp amusement park the job is botched when stavros son gets killed in the gunfire and quinn is taken off an island known as the colony think tank for soldiers too valuable kill but too dangerous set free quinn escapes and tries make it back home his pregnant wife natacha lindinger but stavros is out for revenge and kidnaps her so what is kickboxing mercenary do quinn looks up yaz and the two travel rome so they can rescue the woman kill stavros save the world and do whatever else the screenplay requires them do crazy often eyepopping camera work peter pau and rodmans lite brite locks double team should be mildly enjoyable guilty pleasure but too much tries happen in each frame and the result is movie that leaves you exhausted rather than exhilarated the numerous action scenes are loud and headacheinducing and the frenetic pacing never slows down enough for us care about what is going on in the movie and much of what is going on is just wacky there is whole segment devoted netsurfing monks that have yet figure out and the climax finds quinn going headtohead tiger in the roman coliseum while yaz circles them on motorcycle trying avoid running over land mines and hold on quinns baby boy who is in bomb equipped basket all this while stavros watches shirtless from the bleachers did mention double team is strange when it all comes down this is just another rarely entertaining formula killathon albeit one that feels no need indulge in gratuitous profanity rodman juices things up his blatantly vibrant screen persona though leading up stunt where he kicks an opponent between the legs but we did not need double team tell us he could do that did we

synopsis man whose lover paris was murdered agrees test out an experimental virtual reality home unit system the subject escapes from the real world and his current girlfriend laura and becomes addicted virtual reality due design flaw in his unit recreates the dead paris comments virtual seduction executive produced roger corman and lance robbins serves as cheaplymade precursor strange days far superior both movies deal desperate men who have trouble relating their current lovers because they are ab using technology be former lovers in strange days the technology utilized recorded dreams rather than virtual reality interestingly both films also take place couple of years from now during the turn of the new millenium though strange days uses the setting far more effectively this exemplifies the problem virtual seduction it is not bad for what it is lowbudget science fiction concerning the psychological dangers of virtual reality unfortunately it is been done before and since in much better films fact ultimately leaves the scifi fan bored this movie virtual seduction has many faults one of them is the fact that the video inexplicably has its own trailer before it begins the films script explores the possibilities of virtual reality interestingly at first but its treatment of the subject matter gets heavyhanded and wooden as the movie progresses many important scenes seem too dark the lighting could have been improved significantly the cast collection of veteran bmovie actors and sitcom regulars do only mediocre job in their roles jeff fahey of the original lawnmower man convincingly though unenergetically plays the lead character carrie genzel plays paris the vr lover but ami dolenz as the current love interest seems like much more interesting and attractive character caring personality does not lend credence the films premise meschach taylor of the once popular designing women sitcom adequately plays scientist working on the project but his performance is not something write home about either virtual seduction is one of those harmless movies you could do some light manual labor and not mind having it on in the background in other words one could fold laundry while glancing up at it every now and then but it is rather boring just sit and watch the movie is surprisingly not as violent as one expects from bmovies in this genre but it is still an adult rrated due sexual situations and suicide attempt this turkey ultimately is not awful but it is not particularly interesting or unique either do not be seduced into watching this movie unless you have got several loads of laundry and nothing else watch

yeah yeah the advertisements did not even try conceal the fact that this movie had only one hook sex neve campbell and starship troopers denise richards getting it on ok yeah it is decent two minutes of erotica but even if that is your main interest in this there is plenty of cheeziness sit thru in exchange for those two minutes wild things does have lot more think about than you might expect however nearly every single scene is huge plot twist guaranteed leave you guessing or at least curious see the next turn throughout the entire movie but this fastpaced razorsharp turning of events does not leave much time enjoy the surprises we start off in highclass california high school where every student resembles supermodel in the making guidance counselor sam lombardo matt dillon seems catch the eye of every student particularly kelly van ryan richards daughter of the locally prestigious family whose social status is about as high as their bank accounts right off the bat kelly is using every asset she has in an effort seduce mr lombardo the fundraiser car wash seems the opportune time particularly when you wash your guidance counselors jeep in all white clothes and take plenty of precautions insure you will be soaked from head toe when you are done on the weekend of the car wash kellys attempts at seduction fall flat and when they do she concocts the tale that sam in fact raped her that day naturally sam is thrown into state of panicked shock at these accusations but the otherwise unsubstantial fabrications soon lead criminal trial when lowclass marijuana smoking student the name of suzie toller campbell comes forth near identical story also involving her trusted guidance counselor pitting himself against the communities most respected names and authoritarians sam must prove his innocence thru the aid of his makeshift defense attorney ken bowden played bill murray yes that bill murray sound like good complete movie yes that alone could have been but this is just the beginning in fact the trial is over about fifteen or twenty minutes into the it is merely used launch the most twisted story of recent time the time the movie finishes you will have gone thru every plot twist imaginable unfortunately so much going on you are not given enough time in one predicament be as effectively shocked when new twist comes about this is just one way director john mcnaughton fails make this movie as fun as it could have been the minutes fly and although it never feels underdeveloped this pretzel of storytelling could have been much more richly realized had slower pace been taken the acting is incredibly reminiscent of fox primetime soap operas no is not good thing and it is not just campbell who happens hail from the primetime fox soap party of five but everyone suffers from heavily melodramatic overtones dillon who was so charming in his understated role in last years in out gives the best performance and murrays surprising appearance adds some comedic flare the in fact if the whole movie had been promoted as subtle comedy even if it was the exact same would actually give it better grade that is how cheezy it comes off but aside from these two the rest offer nothing more than some good eyefulls in the right hands wild things could have been wickedly delightful scrumptiously twisted thriller but instead we get juvenile overuses of profanity and some very laughable displays of acting and what is up these people passing as high school students realize often casts older actors play teenage roles but when realized it was not supposed be college they were at had snicker will not lie this is definitely guilty pleasure as corny as it is it is got some interesting aspects and could deserve at least b for effort but if you just want admire denise richards go for last years starship troopers was every bit as campy but million times better of course if seeing her breasts is your most important goal you will be right at home wild things perhaps the wildest thing of all is that somebody actually looked at this and thought it deserved be in theaters

i was recently told that in china their had been strong protests against the release of red corner and this is apparently because of the way it shows the injustice of many chinese laws but if you ask me the real truth of the matter is that the chinese critics association were determined not punish the population into viewing richard gere running across rooftops in search for fellow american or more the point anyone that allows him bask in his own lessthansubtle presence this is not an insult gere as consider him be rather talented actor but more the choice of character and responsibility of his role if is solely about one person the main actor must give faultless performance in order for it really work although geres performance is in no way poorly acted it is far from perfect and look forward seeing him star other talented actors that can reduce the need for him carry himself this is where he truly belongs and if you are reluctant believe me than look no further that primal fear the sensational edward norton the jackal bruce willis and pretty woman the delightful julia roberts in red corner gere plays classy lawyer jack moore who is guilty of the same personality traits as his character martin vail in primal fear bold and up front who thinks he is three steps ahead of everybody else but is actually two steps behind it is invulnerability of both mental and physical kind that the character of moore is portrayed left me barracking for the chinese haul his sorry ass into jail it doesnt take long from the films beginning for jack moores charm work on pretty chinese lady and in no time they are in bed together in hotel room drunk and cheerful yet instead of hangover poor jack finds himself covered in blood and the chinese chick dead on couch he is arrested and hauled into chinese prison his cell food and rights all terrible now trapped in foreign land without adequate aid from the american embassy lawyer shen yuelin bai ling defends his case initially pleading guilty the charge of murder jack and shen argue about their countries different laws shen stating that they will shoot you in the back and charge the cost of the bullet your family as the plot thickens scenes get progressively more ridiculous ranging from richard gere running over rooftops in search of the us embassy scooby doo ending where the least expected butyouknewalong criminal is discovered red corner is one of those films where you sneer laugh or vomit youre way through all of its minutes what should have been politically taunt thriller is little more than pointless expedition see how stressed out richard gere can act this is not say that the does not have its moments there are some tense court room scenes that are shrewdly created telling the tale of foreign injustice and government corruption but what they amount spoils the effect of having them in the first place perhaps this is why red corner is so frustrating watch if you look at the films overall concept fairly broadly the basic idea is quite tangible it is upon the films execution where the diminutive plot twists and developments fail impress or innovate the evidence that goes missing the high powered officials shielding the truth and intolerable love angles have all been done so many times before if that wasnt bad enough red corners dialogue is purely laughable on many occasions shen yuelin attempts gain sympathy reciting renaissance of destitute relationship her deceased father whilst jack moore is eager talk about chinese musical instruments when he could have been working on plan free himself taking itself far too seriously red corner is not half the it intends be although it would have benefited from the help of more valuable supporting cast the films main fault is in the bizarre and often out of place way of unfolding story isnt that meritorious anyway whilst richard gere still proves that has what it takes be known as decent actor would think twice before going see him attempt manage such serious yet hollow drama again martin vailwhere are you

not so long ago men the names of peckinpah ford leone and eastwood made westerns real westerns these were some of the best films of the twentieth century those days are gone now we have crap like wild wild west pass for the western and that record is not improved the unbearable tale of american outlaws outlaws is yet another retelling of the jesse james legend courtesy of bmovie king james robinson producer of such classics as wrongfully accused and chill factor delayed since the spring this version stars the irish hunka hunka burning love colin farrell the best part of schumachers tigerland as the badass jesse james alas any sense of his character has been left on the ranch leaving us only cute chicks like ali larter minus the whipped cream watch the spin this time around fresh from serving as southern militiamen in the civil war jesse james farrell his brother frank gabriel macht and his pal cole younger scott caan lay down their arms and head home missouri tend the family farms after the war has ended but trouble is brewing in their small town of liberty when evil railroad baron thaddeus rains harris yulin and his cronies rollin parker terry oquinn and allan pinkerton timothy dalton demand the boys turn over their lands the railroads the jameses and the youngers then join forces fight the railroad robbing banks up and down missouri thus cutting off the railroads financial surplus and playing robin hood the local people along the way the boys squabble over who is the cutest of the gang who is the most popular cowboy in the gang and who ought go on mtvs total request live they rob numerous banks identical interiors always the kindest of hearts strutting in their grungy dusters as moby songs play in the background the witty banter they share could be plastered within hallmark card the biggest disappointment here lies in the acting of colin farrell after great job in tigerland farrell walks through this role easier then nicolas cage in gone in seconds and his american accent rivals richard geres irish accent in the jackal combined feeling like bonanza the teen years this homogenized production toned down get the everpopular pg rating gives us an invincible jesse james that quickly grows tiresome and boring the unbearable villains courtesy of timothy dalton and thaddeus rains spend the entire proclaiming that everyone should be hanged sucking out any energy left in the not mention the real story of jesse james and his gang bears no resemblance the plot of american outlaws instead the movie is full of old outrageous tales about the wild west tales went out of style in cent magazines about century ago

actually am fairly sure the experience of having my flesh torn and mutilated barbed wire would have been more positive than watching this movie baywatch babe pamela anderson lee proves once and for all that she should keep her doubleds on the small screen at least there you do not have pay see her cleavage and for those viewers out there who would only lay down money for this movie in hopes of and reverse my mistake but can warn other horny teenage boys out there they do tease us few times scenes where you almost see her topless but if she is nude it is so quick you cannot even tell for book character in real life even wearing lowcut leather do office work businesswoman bondage wear and having unreal body proportions yes like the mona lisa pamela anderson is manmade beauty probably in more senses than one she is definite beauty though and looking at her is never an unpleasant experience you would just think the woman who began her career as playboy playmate would not have any reservations about appearing nude in the movie because it is obvious she was not pulling sharon stone and trying make people pay attention her acting skills mean she shows off more cleavage here than jewelers convention the movie is set in the year the worst year of my life pam says the worst movie of the year say america is going through second civil war and pamela is nightclub owner in the only free city in the nation silicone valley think she also hires herself out as bounty hunter when the price is right posing as first stripper and later as prostitute but do not call her babe she hates that and reminds us of that fact way too many times imagine woman who does trapeze strip tease in bar while having hose sprayed on her being referred in such sexist demeaning term liberated woman like pamela anderson should not have hear words like babe during strip tease especially since that movie about the talking pig was such success the plot haha revolves around pair of contact lenses that allow their wearer pass through the congressional directorates retina scanners in the words of one of the characters they are more than meets the eye reminds me of the transformers cartoon and sure wished the movie could somehow be transformed into something decent but that never happened no the movie just continued on its path of lame action scenes starring pamela vandamme bigbusted kickboxer and her resistance accomplices exboyfriend axel tamuera morrison and cora victoria rowell thank god they did not name her cora reef one bad character name is more than enough pamela originally does not take sides giving some speech about she is only loyal the money they pay her but she changes her mind once the congressional bastards kill her blind brother jack noseworthy of bon jovi always video fame still do not know if barb wire is step up or step down for noseworthy but he definitely is nose worthy even if he is not sponge worthy pam gets ready avenge his death grabbing up an armful of semiautomatic weapons and strapping an ammunitions belt her chest it is not rambo it is bimbo mark my words barb wire will be all over the cinemax network in year it is got all the elements of the directtovideo releases featured on hbos bastard cousin the cable channel would never watch if it did not somehow come free it is got the nontitillating scenes of voyeurism laughable flashbacks bad dialogue and action cliches out the wazzoo there is even narrator at the beginning setting up the movies premise while the words scroll up the screen someone needs tell pamela the wookie this as not star wars if you have seen any action flick of the past fifteen years you will recognize plenty of lifted elements barb wire has the obligatory trucks flipping over car crashes explosions broken glass and slowmotion shots of bodies falling hundreds of feet their death this is one of those automaticpilot movies anyone could write or direct barb wire has only two things going for it and think you know what those two things are

part buddy comedy part fishoutofwater story part nature tale meet the deedles is not nearly as interesting as any of those archetypes in fact it is an invitation you ought disregard phil and stew deedle paul walker and steve van wormer are the twin sons of the famous millionaire elton deedle eric braeden founder of deedle enterprises elton wants his sons be the perfect heirs his fortune instead the two are careless hawaiian surf bums set them straight he enrolls them into strict wyoming boot camp the pair inevitably go after several misadventures in wyoming where the duo is stunned discover there is no surf the brothers deedle stumble upon routine mistaken identity plot they arrive at yellowstone national park where they are believed be two new park ranger recruits rather than slinking back home and disappointing their dad the deedles play along phil actually has other motives the beautiful park ranger jesse j langer who unfortunately happens be the beloved stepdaughter of the overprotective park ranger captain douglas pine john ashton yellowstone has problem it is only week before the famous geyser old faithful celebrates its one billionth birthday and the park is being overrun prairie dogs not just one or two thousands of them the deedles are assigned eliminate the dog menace not knowing that it all is part of fiendish plan disgraced former head ranger frank slater dennis hopper the brothers deedle are not supposed be outandout stupid like the team from dumb and dumber or bill and ted instead their brains just operate in different simpler realm more accurate comparison would be carrot top in chairman of the board unfortunately this one resembles in several hideous ways the central problem meet the deedles is that it simply just is not funny there is moment when phil utters the line insert laugh here nearly sums up the entire meet the deedles experience the result is not bad in runshriekingfromthetheater type of way instead it is merely bad in an excruciatingly boring sort of way the cast seems decent but they are never asked do anything remotely interesting instead the inundates the audience countless shots of people andor cars rolling downhill in the forest and constant annoying references other disney films you will have much better luck finding good spot surf in wyoming than finding entertainment in meet the deedles

adam sandler is not known for appearing in deep thoughtprovoking films but he is still really funny guy most of his movies are successful not because of the making behind them but because they let sandler do what he does best without stupid plot drown him out big daddy is the first in the story seems more important than sandlers comic performance and it is miserable failure sandler plays thirtysomething loser who gets attached an orphaned young boy played cole and dylan sprouse as one might expect from the synopsis director dennis dugan resorts the usual bag of manipulative and sentimental sequences including repulsive courtroom battle and lot of teary scenes in characters say goodbye one another in addition there is ridiculous amount of disgusting toilet humor urine and vomit both get more screen time than sandler himself there is hilarious running joke featuring female doctor who previously worked at hooters and the features passable performances from sandler joey lauren adams as the love interest and the two young boys but the on the whole is trite and disappointingly unfunny

scene because it was the only moment in the whole damned production that made me smile based on an incredibly popular video game lara croft tomb raider is lousy movie the structure goes like this poorlystaged action sequence boring exposition poorlystaged action sequence boring exposition etc etc the end basically the exists showcase angelina jolies puffy lips and enhanced tits closeups are framed ohsocarefully include her million dollar bazooms running scenes highlight her bouncing breasts in vintage baywatch fashion there is even include shower scene that offers brief side view of them but the filmmakers are so inept they cannot even flash the audience correctly the one extended display of nudity is of get ready for this guy for no particular reason muscular supporting character strolls around naked for about seconds each shot composed barely cover his package la austin powers now enjoy good looking male body as much as the next gay guy but what the hell is beefcake doing in ta flick aimed at heterosexual males of course what else should one expect in that does virtually nothing right tomb raider sets up elaborate action set pieces then renders them incomprehensible needless jump cut editing promising dual bungee cord battle is ruined excessive cuts it promises series of exotic locales then delivers cavernous sets and grimy matte paintings smoggy skies throw in some bargain basement computer graphics and you end up the ugliest movie come down the pike in many moons intended be rousing indiana jones style adventure tomb raider lacks any sense of tension the low point comes when lara is threatened statues of monkey warriors and giant multiarmed shiva figure that come life courtesy of cgi easily the lamest menaces have ever seen the creatures move like snails and fall apart single shot from gun if you ever have be chased monsters pray that you get the monkey warriors tomb raider tells story sort of once every years the planets align group of very bad men are out find two halves of an object that if reassembled just as the planets align will give them control over time itself laras goal is stop them and rescue her longmissing poppa jon voight jolies real life dad none of this matters though because stunning gaps in internal logic assure that the plot of lara croft tomb raider is as lame as ever other aspect of the except angelina jolies lips and breasts

when robert forster found himself famous again after appearing in jackie brown he immediately signed up for little called american perfekt this was almost two years ago waited patiently for the be released but it never was finally forgot about it the other day though while was perusing the selection of the local video store stumbled upon you guessed it american perfekt immediately rented it and certain amount of glee rushed home view it having now seen the understand why it never saw theatrical release american perfekt is jumbled mess the storyline is nonexistent it took me half the movie just figure out what was going on and at that point the only thing really knew for sure was that the movie was never going introduce plot of some sort it wants get on quirkyness and socalled charm alone and it just does not work robert forster plays psychiatrist who picks up amanda plummer and they head off on the road together along the way no discernable destination they run into all sorts of kooky and wacky characters suppose this freewheeling no plot style is supposed give the an element of danger and excitment but all it did was make me sleepy am all for trying new things within the realm of but not at the expense of coherence nothing in this movie makes sense the actions of the characters go unexplained even when they are truly bizarre will give you an example without giving too much away david thewlis has part as drifting conman at one point midway through the movie he runs forster and plummer off the road his car as he passes them we see that his face is covered in blood do you think we would get an explanation as what happened him you would think so would not you american perfekt is waste of time nothing is gained from watching this movie except maybe migraine and if you do rent it do not bother trying figure out what is going on in the hopes that everything will be resolved the end this does not happen and no explanation is given for the misspelling of perfect either

you would think that after awhile would stop trying make movies out of video games it has not worked so far street fighter super mario brothers wing commander mortal kombat not watchable in the bunch still held out some hope for tomb raider after all the games premise is heavily influenced the indiana jones trilogy and all the mummy movies so there are cinematic elements imbedded in the concept however despite the potential of the project tomb raider proves be yet another bomb the plot is convoluted accumulation of nonsense probably borrowed from dozen bad movies there is onceeveryears alignment of planets coming up and the illuminati have find both halves of an ancient triangle that controls time in order take over the world of course the ancient folks who divided the triangle buried the halves in tombs on opposite sides of the world our heroine lady lara croft angelina jolie finds the key that opens the tombs in relics that her dead father jon voight dug up she figures that if she gets the triangle she can bring her dad back from the dead of course no one was expecting much of plot from this movie anyway in both video games and action movies the plot is just an excuse for the action sequences however the action in tomb raider shows little style or originality there is lots of shooting and some kung fu fightin but none of it progresses beyond the level of cheap directtocable flick the other goofy archeologist flick of the summer the mummy returns was much better it had its flaws but its action was creative and largescale since winning her academy award for girl interrupted jolie has not taken any projects that would display her acting talents tomb raider seems be more interested in displaying her breasts so much attention is drawn them that it is shame there is no oscar for best performance wonderbra while we do not see much of her acting ability the exception of wonderful uppercrust british accent we do get hint of jolies less savory side considering the rumors of incest that hang over jolie and her supposed obsession death having lara be obsessed resurrecting her dead father and uninterested in any of the living males around her seems poor choice having jolies real life father jon voight play the dead dad makes it even creepier have not decided what make of director simon west yet his first feature was the starstudded disaster con air but my opinion of him improved the generals daughter was thick sultry atmosphere now this train wreck hope he improves again because his next project is the big screen version of the cult tv series the prisoner has already screwed up the avengers and the prisoner represents chance for redemption the way speaking of british tv red dwarf fans should look for chris rimmer barrie in his first major role

it is simply amazing how the green mile developed in its three hour running time based on the stephen king series of the same title the starts out painfully slow underdeveloped characters and idiotic dialogue however as the plot begins progress the turns into pure perfection outstanding performances and wonderful direction frank darabont who masterfully followed prisoners story in the shawshank redemption this time follows the perspective of prison guard paul edgecomb tom hanks through edgecombs experiences on cell block known as the green mile where death row prisoners wait and repent the audience sees good and evil on both sides of the law from an evil prison guard an evil prisoner the green mile is successful in creating sympathy for kindhearted hard working guards and hard thinking prisoners the plot follows edgecomb and four other guards as they meet variety of prisoners and after having strong relationships each eventually are forced execute them the performances veterans and new comers back up these original characters are superb the ensemble acting in the is perfect hanks david morse and barry pepper as guards are wonderful and are fitting for their roles they are the characters we most relate because of their calm less extreme roles they are given the positions make rational decisions at difficult times and they are the ones who fulfill the demands of the audience the more unique characters perfectly create friction on the green mile and make the story interesting and exciting some particularly note worthy roles of the unique characters include doug hutchinson sam rockwell and michael duncan hutchinson playing percy wetmore cowardly guard who hides his true feelings tormenting others gives the greatest performance of the movie every time he appears on the screen the attitude of others is very uncomfortable and the creepy expressions he is able create are effectively terrifying it would come as no surprise if hutchinson was nominated for an academy award as best supporting actor not only because he did wonderful job as wetmore but also because he stole every scene he was in away from veteran oscar winner tom hanks rockwell an independent veteran plays his role as wild bill wharton perfection as prisoner who taunts and harasses the guards at all hours he really gets under your skin and irritates you for having watch him torture others this irritation he creates makes his performance so believable the last noteworthy performance belongs duncan as the enormous convicted killer john coffey who happens hold the power of curing the ill duncan does wonderful job playing frightened childlike behemoth very similar lennie small in of mice and men his desire for love and the extinction of hate evokes the most compassion because it is very obvious that he is suffering for no just cause his pain creates pain for the viewer however it takes over an hour for duncan be introduced completely in the the opens ridiculous present day setting contains scene that jabs at the jerry springer show the scene containing one old man complaining about how all guests on the show are inbred and rednecks not only is this observation entirely pointless and out of place but it is also hackneyed beyond all belief as the flashes back graham greene is quickly executed without any introduction his death seems very rushed and without any knowledge of who he is the scene is neither sad nor convincing greene is not even given final word like some of the other characters and we do not even see him walk the infamous green mile however as the begins specifically introduce more characters such as coffey and eduard delacroix michael jeter as well as the five prison guards the becomes more interesting the speed in the green mile is perfect if time was matter of concern and the was edited the two hour mark it would have been unsatisfactory because we would not be able know the characters as they are or as they treat others the three hour running is perfect for plot development and the end of the great amount of love or hate is attached each character the green mile is so good following the rough beginning that when the pivotal moment at the very end finally comes it is almost impossible not feel some sort of sadness for every person in this scene fighting back tears was difficult task that barely succeeded in doing if you survive the first third of the green mile sit back and enjoy the remainder for some priceless entertainment

the jekyll and hyde story told from his maids point of view is in word dark you would not expect something bright and cheery based on robert louis stevensons novel but the is surprisingly dreary and
