flaws do we get rid of dreams as well niccols intelligent script handles all these questions extremely well and the result is an incredibly smart thriller set against dramatic story or vice versa the power of the actors brings lot of credibility flat characters while flat may sound like poor job on niccols part it actually enhances the meaning behind the story ethan hawke has developed into handsome adult actor giving his best performance of his lifetime so far his curiosity and motivation pushes his character past all the discouraging remarks from his parents and valid peers uma thurman is well uma thurman her character is slightly underdeveloped but the story is not about her however thurman gives lot of depth the flat character jude law gives the most complex performance of the the most disturbingly realistic character he provides several nice touches and his final scene is very touching and heartwrenching one loren dean gives nice performance in his welldeveloped character dean is also responsible for some of the most suspenseful scenes in the movie alan arkin portrays one of the detectives little less more excitement than his psychiatrist in grosse pointe blank still he does good job gore vidal and xander berkeley both provide some very good supporting roles and berkeley also gives heartfelt discussion towards the end of the gattaca is rated pg for brief violent images language some sexuality and nudity despite the somber and desolate mood of the entire was not exactly prepared for the ending left me feeling empty it turned me off slightly but then realized that everything turned out the way it should have if this had been typical it would have ended much differently however all the mindless science fiction films out there it is nice have does not talk down its audience especially like the ironic title and how it consists of the four letters make up the genetic coding t and instead it provides some much needed entertainment gives us science fiction fanatics just what we want science fiction morals behind it whatever happened giving the audience lesson while entertaining hopefully more writers and directors will learn from gattaca and hopefully audiences will too s personal note j gladnick how dare you call this the worst of the year cannot even begin image what you do like that frightens me beyond anything

it must be some sort of warped critical nightmare the best movie of the year would be summer vehicle jim carrey vehicle at that and so it is _the truman show_ is the most perplexing crazed paranoid and ribtickling morality play have seen since ido notknowwhen do not credit carrey it starts andrew niccol gattaca who created the script ten years ago the story replete sublte religious and philisophical undertones is about man who discovers that every day of his existence has been televised for mass audience ironically it was within these past ten years that realitybased television have become predominant fixture into our culture who knew oneupping niccol it was when unlikely candidatedirector peter weir took the helm that things fell into place weir had the nearly impossible task create the unimitible tone deftly mixing capra kafka throwing george bailey in universe inhabited rod serling it was weirs first stroke of genius create seahaven suburban paradiseprison that would make spielberg cower in shame for example bystanderextras would walk around the block incessantly flowers along the latest issue of _dog fancy_ the nicest touch are the plethora of subtle hints for truman _not_ leave the island credit weir for his second stroke the casting of carrey carrey seems be the type of character actor who would always turn on and act goofy whenever the camera is near not here his performance is so subverted you sometimes wonder if he is ever aware the camera is on and although carrey does not deserve an academy award nomination just as well the academy rarely honors goofy comedians excepting robin williams he stretches enough alter his hypersilly image considerably playing one who has the cameras constantly invading his most intimate moments turns be quite the role of jim carreys life no pun intended better in smaller more pivotal role is ed harris as christof who mixes the right amount of his apollo work the problem people character dustin hoffmans megaglomaniac producer in _wag the dog_ and then only slightly svengalian it is clear that he is torn between the nielson ratings and trumans well being yes in his own misguided way he loves truman as father son and has provided the best universe he could provide he thinks rounding out the cast is natascha mcelhone mrs dalloway as carreys true forbidden love sylvia very effective in another pivotal small role laura linney congo and noah emmerich copland have the unfortunate task of playing trumans wife and best friend their sitcomish dialogue allow little room for any authentic character development the exception is at the very beginning where they speak into the camera wholeheartedly believing that their participation is truly good for truman and for society in general there are other little problems the script are we assume that toddler truman had no recollection of hearing the construction of such gigantic dome during his formative years was there any reason as why in one scene it rained solely on truman even though it never had how is it they hire hundreds of extras and none of them could drive boat and yet truman fearful of water is helming sailboat effortlessly and could not christof have turned off the wind strand truman at sea these little contrivances however do not hold candle the overall effect of the work the audience gets the feeling that it is watching the actual show and we are drawn trumans mundane existence for no other reason than it is there the final result effortlessly combines the emotional happy ending of mainstream picture gnawing discomfort that hits you square in the gut upon leaving the theater was looking up in the sky wondering if it was nothing more than gigantic dome just checking

now lets first look into the history of shark films there was the unforgettable jaws the exciting jaws the rather flaky jaws and sometime in the late another of the same genre that cannot seem recall about the son of jaws returning wreak revenge or something like that now the magic of cgi one shark is simply not enough in deep blue sea there are big mean and really smart ones russell frankiln jackson visits aquatica seabound research center where research is being conducted on the extraction of hormone substance found uniquely within the shark brain that can cure and reverse the effects of alzheimers disease the substance is small in quantity and because of this lead researcher dr susan macalaester genetically alters the shark dna and grows them twice the size brains as big as humans naturally producing more of the much treasured hormones as sure as the sun sets in the west shark breaks lose and wreaks havoc within the facility during hormone extraction procedure the flexibility offered cgi the sharks get more fulllength screen time as their predecessors did in those remotecontrolled rubber suit days gone are the days of people getting pulled under the water the water turning red right after this time we get see the entire gobbling action floating limbs and all soso acting expected in most of your average action jackson fresh from his jedi master role in the phantom menace takes on the darkside force of different kind and fits well his wisecracking lines ll cool js cook role as preacher does for this what steven seagals cook could only dream achieve in his two under siege films deep blue sea does not offer any of the psychological thrills that jaws has offer it does however prove be refreshing followup within the genre full of visual thrills suspense and believe it or not humour its like jurassic park under water nothing too stressful pure entertainment renny harlin you are forgiven for making cutthroat island

this is the best british gangster since the long good friday jon bennet played andrew howard is an extremely good assassin as such he is probably an evil man but it does not worry him he has become an unquestioning weapon he is in the employ of kingpin david calder far more evil than he is but even assassins have innocent pasts he runs into an old from school days and he is married mutual girl friend from school complicating matters is that they live near where he had recent job and their young daughter may have seen him at the crime big piece of what makes this work is the depiction of the kingpin calder is familiar actor in britain though not frequently seen in the us he was seen in the world is not enough here he creates one of the best screen villains in recent years he is at once seductive and repellent like beautiful venomous snake his lair is underground apparently in sewer where he lives like the king of sewer rats it is the kingpin who pulls the strings that will control bennets life paul sarossy who directs spent most of his career as cinematographer and like the kingpins lair he has molded images of class and style out of the darkness using semidarkness and letting the colors of deep blue and black dominate every scene he makes the visually as ominous as anything in this nether world this is world that is cold and unfriendly sorossy creates world of violence much more what we hear than what we see this is great deal of physical violence occurring just out of reach we see very little but we hear great deal more and we imagine more than that the screenplay is peter waddington based on the novel neil cross but it is sarossys all the way it creates indelible images of evil rate it an on the scale and low on the scale do hope they do not use the tagline do not mess mr inbetween

produced robert lantos stephen roth directed douglas williams mpaa not rated though from language violence medicalgrossouts and sexual content would put it at pg though made in canada overdrawn at the memory bank traces its roots the bbc school of production using for the most part cheap computer and video special effects chyron text wildlife documentary footage and sets that are sometimes obviously faked up it nonetheless manages tell good enough science fiction story that the time you are twenty minutes into it you should be hooked raul julia plays aram fingal drone data processing worker for novicorp whose active imagination and predilection for hacking gets him into trouble authority caught watching casablanca on his desk monitor fingal is sentenced doppling rehabilitationhe is spend fortyeight hours in the body of baboon how exactly this is supposed rehabilitate him is anybodys guess as it happens thanks visiting schoolboys prank his body is temporarily misplaced and his mind has be shunted into the central computer keep him alive until they can find it as time ticks away before his memory cube selfdestructs the frantic search for his body is on while fingal first creates virtual reality fantasy world then finds there is no better way hack the system than from the inside during the chaos computer technician apollonia james linda griffiths maintains contact fingal through datalink manifesting several different times offer advice or warnings over the course of their interactions interest on both their parts grows into budding romance given that casablanca is fingals favorite and the basis for his fantasy world great deal of the movie is homage casablanca in fact the humphrey bogart and peter lorre characters make appearances played julia in dual role and louis negin respectively in bar called the place julias portrayal of bogart is passable and avoids becoming the schweethaat spouting parody seen in cartoons negins peter lorre is quite credible and easily the best peter lorre have ever seen who was not the real thing the two of them as characters created fingals imagination serve as aspects of his personality driving him on in his quest hack the computer system those are not the only casablanca characters put in appearances the sydney greenstreet character also happens be around as the fat man the alternate aspect of the films main villain the novicorp chairman donald moore while fingals body is lost the fat man tries stop him from hacking the system less than salutory results it is interesting note the futuristic slang words that are thrown about left and right during the in the best goldenage science fiction tradition words like dopple psychist computech cinema and reconst are apparently in common use and while people of today may well laugh at fourteen years pasts idea of futuristic data processing clerks some aspects of this are surprisingly perfectly in keeping the way we think of virtual reality today as cyberpunk films go this may not be staple of the genre but it is definitely recommended viewing the special effects are very primitive placing this production in the realm of lowtomediumbudget television the music is completely electronicsynthesized fits the low budget but is not really out of keeping the genre however the writing quite makes up for it there are some very funny moments and quite few little injokes that one needs have seen casablanca appreciate properly all in all give overdrawn at the memory bank

i remember hearing about this when it first appeared at cannes over year ago picking up the grand jury prize at the festival holocaust comedy receives standing ovation the headlines read intrigued this statement looked up information on the and found that sure enough life is beautiful is in fact comedy about the greatest atrocity of the last thousand years even though the movie was extremely wellreceived critics and public alike could not help but be disgusted at this notion human tragedy is not something feel should be celebrated only now do see the error of my ways after finally viewing the for myself after avoiding it for some time it became clear that it is not as the headlines proclaimed holocaust comedy on the contrary life is beautiful does not even really depict the graphic events that took place in nazi deathcamps rather it focuses on the relationship between father and his son who he is trying desperately shield from the horrors of their situation roberto benigni who also wrote and directed the movie stars as guido orefice chaplininspired clown and all round jolly guy who as the opens is vying for the affections of an attractive school teacher nicoletta braschi benigni real life spouse through the course of the first hour or so we see guido striving get the attention of this beautiful princess as he calls her employing the magic of laughter the italian comedian wins her heart and together they raise young boy named giosue child actor giorgio cantarini life treats them well until hitlers minions rise power and the family is whisked away german camp where guido becomes convinced that he must upholds his sons innocence no matter what the sacrifice granted it contains some uproariously funny moments both in and out of the concentration camp but it does not pull hogans heros and make light of the slaughtering of some six million innocent jews somehow it achieves hilarity without disrespecting it is gravely serious subject so we have established that life is beautiful is not holocaust comedy but there is another complete misrepresentation of this material that really disturbs me the despite critics declarations of it being triumph of the human spirit is no such thing not in my eyes anyway some have called the story an affirmation of the beauty of life but say it is very dark and bleak statement about mans capability of denial masquerading as an endearing comedy the films ending has been recognized as the most entirely uplifting moment of any released recently but found it be truly discerning and upsetting essentially life is beautiful is quite possibly the greatest hoax in the history of however am not denying the movies greatness believe me it is fantastic am just saying that think benigni did something different than what most people are interpreting it as but perhaps am reading more into the movie than is really there maybe the films brilliance relies on the idea that the viewer can interpret the meaning of it in any way they see fit in fact maybe roberto benigni has made that is the sole argument for the old saying that you get out of movie exactly what you put into it

most movies seem release third movie just so it can be called trilogy rocky iii seems kind of fit in that category but manages be slightly unique the rocky formula of rocky loses fightrocky trainsrocky wins fight is carried out the letter also the tradition of showing the last five minutes or so from the past rocky is used as well this movie begins series of clips showing how famous rocky sylvester stallone has become even showing brief appearance on sesame street then it moves on rocky being in fixed fight thunderlips hulk hogan mysterious badass known as clubber lang mr trashtalks rocky about his stupid decision retire from boxing and that he pities the fool for not coming out and fighting him outright rockys trainer burgess meredith tells rocky not fight but the italian stallion does not listen naturally he gets his ass kicked somewhere along the line after this several things happen rockys longtime trainer dies causing rocky train his former opponent apollo creed rockys wife complains her husband that he should fight the final fight ensues between clubber and rocky guess who wins the winners name rhymes smocky the movie is entertaning mainly because of clubber langs over the top performance the dramatic aspect has been toned down considerably since rocky ii and now action seems be the strong point of the is good if you like fighting scenes the last match is quite decent actually if you liked the previous films rent this one it is well worth seeing if you are fan of the series but if you cannot stand rocky shouting adrianne one more time see something else

review dog of flanders is the story of an adorable little boy named nello and his trials and tribulations in th century flanders living his grandfather jehan jack warden in poverty nello finds happiness in his life in spite of difficult times they are renting spare oneroom cottage and the greedy malevolent landlord who owns it threatens throw them out of the house if they do not pay the rent nello also has rather creative talent for drawing some of the most beautiful pictures that have ever seen in either movie or in real life his hero is peter paul rubens the great flemish painter of the th century not that these are the only things that make nellos life happy however he has dog of flanders whom he names patrasche who is heroic rintintin of the th century whom he rescues from his cruel unkind master in addition he even has best friend and future sweetheart in the lovely wealthy aloise whose father strongly disapproves of her hanging out lowerclass nello he thinks he is not good enough for her and he would hate the idea of the two kids marrying but then he was poor guy himself before he married as mentioned later on in the one day nello encounters mysterious yet kindhearted artist named michel la grande played wonderfully jon voight who tells the boy keep drawing from his heart and that perhaps one day he might land career in being an artist and every christmas there is contest on is the most beautiful painting of the year the winner getting lot of money eager save his home and his aging dying grandfather nello willingly decides become an artist asking aloise pose for him one night the two travel circus where they have their fortune told one of the films most delightful scenes that great happiness is destined for them she gives the kids ring whom nello places on aloises hand afterwards the two kids have rollickingly good time dancing around in front of circus performers unfortunately things are not all ladeedah in this tale aloises father finally becomes so angry nello that he forbids him ever see aloise again bad enough that they cannot see each other although we know nello and aloise do not we but that is only the start of nellos troubles aloises farm is burned down and nello is wrongfully accused the landord of his cottage for starting the fire in order take revenge on being forbidden see aloise this decreases nellos reputation around the town save aloise and her parents and kindly miller william who is very sweet nello every time he drops matters get much worse for nello when his grandfather dies and he has pay for his funeral but then things really get nasty when the landlord exiles nello from his own home for not paying his rental permanetly this means that nello and patrasche have starve and walk out in the cold freezing wind worst of all the painting that he has desperately been working on during all this time the portrait of the princess fails win the prize at the festival now nello and patrasche are really depressed and close freezing death will nello be able find any happiness in his life will patrasche save the day will nello make the fateful trip join his mother and grandfather in paradise dog of flanders is delightful heartwarming family that is sure entertain kids of all ages even older ones who consider themselves too sophisticated for kiddie fare will be surprised hear that this is for grownups too there have been other movies of this ilk boy and dog and while this one falls into that category it is mostly story about overcoming difficulties and finding good home for yourself move over or rather roll over old yeller this dog of flanders is heartwarming delight the cinematography courtesy of walther van den ende is beautiful and really adds the powerful drama of the it also gives feel of being in flanders the whole was respectably shot in flanders the music from richard friedman is also remarkable an evocative poignant score that recaptures music from the th century the opening song over the credits is very beautiful hope the soundtrack is available and there is brief excerpt of cheer up charlie from willy wonka and the chocolate factory sung aloise nello in another delightful scene the cast is firstrate jesse james and jeremy james kissner who play nello are some of the most endearing adorable young stars have ever seen in my whole life so are the girls who play aloise madyline sweeten as the younger and farren monet as the older not that they are the only good stars however jack warden is ideal as jehan eliciting just the right amount of humor and compassion required for the character the scenes involving him and nello are heartwarming touching ones also bruce mcgill is charming as the kindly miller william he is another one of my favorite characters in the but jon voight as mentioned before is the perfect choice for michel he brings mysterious yet gentle performance that makes us all feel good again when he reassures insecure nello that he can win the contest but what makes this fun watch is how welldefined the characters are and the pace of the story best of all it has happy ending though will not give it away sorry is strong and powerful enough for us identify the characters for the first time since the beginning of there comes does not rely on popular formula stuff such as bigbudget special effects commercial rock soundtracks or any of that stuff this one relies on telling fully characteroriented story just the right amount of heart humor and drama that me is what makes dog of flanders all the more delightful eleanor osullivan of the home news tribune noticed this and was kind and generous enough welcome it for want of better word glow surrounds dog of flanders its heart is in the right place and it engages you you can guess where the is going because this is welltraveled territory but pros like voight and appealing young performers like kissner an oftentold story is well worth revisit in addition there were couple of other enthusiasts such as chicagosun times and the washington post you should read their reviews they are really positive other critics however were not so kind stephen holden of the new york times had more than share of beatings lay upon dog of flanders via pen writing he found the be sea of sugary bromides and condemned mr voights character as hopelessly wooden adopts an accent even more indeterminate than the one he came up for anaconda in addition entertainment weekly slamdunked the condemning it as the worst family of the year there have been so many other bad reviews like this too my suggestion disregard the critics they just have big problem touching family films and one should never pay attention them this dog of flanders may only be little family movie it probably will not be big hit in the style of titanic but then again no other has been since then but that is not bad thing in and of itself this is story that is sure warm your heart and that is what really matters about dog of flanders it is also one of the better family films around this year none of the other films have seen this year though they were good have been so lowkey and touching if you are looking for familystyle entertainment look no further than this charming boyanddog yarn go see it while you still can for as mentioned it might not be big bowwow at the box office for long time see it while you can there is really no need compare multimillion dollar blockbuster such as star wars episode the phantom menace or tarzan or even the iron giant tender sweet little family movie

do critics have morals are there any unwritten laws an ethical movie critic would or should follow naturally we do not want go into any preconceived notions is pretty tough but something we all have accomplish secondly and along the same line we cannot prejudge because of it is stars director etc the difference well in the first one we would go into thinking it is going be dumb or it is going be good and that would affect our viewing that movie sounds and looks dumb so am not expecting much on the second hand we are simply assuming it will be bad or good because of personal grudge against the company it is made disney oh it is just merchandising ploy then the actors jim carreys in it it is gonna stink or the director who cannot be that good this is more of biased viewpoint as opposed first impression viewpoint make sense ok but what about comparing is not that kind of along the same lines when we compare certain actor or director or even composers credibility in one another they were involved in is that really fair sure in sequels you can expect and accept comparisons lot more but what about jackie brown for example is it fair for me take the review and turn it into comparison of pulp fiction just because quentin tarantino directed and wrote the screenplay for both think it is and will tell you why good critic should be able view the from the average joe or jane viewpoint while still taking into account the artistic integrity behind the sometimes that can be tough the acting was superb but was bored or loved it it was sooooo cheezy might be used describe these are contradictions and critic has weigh both sides and come suitable balanced critique but is more important and is better an extremely well shot and acted that is boring or really amateurish that you wanna go back again and again getting back the point my philosophy on comparing films being fair works because we are reflecting what the public wants know anyway every average person out there who is interested in this is likely ask how does it compare pulp fiction and so as critic am already responsible ask that same question jackie brown stars pam grier the blaxploitation heroine from the who is likely make big comeback thanks her role as the title character tarantinos pulp fiction is in big part responsible for john travoltas sudden revival in the movie industry and talks of an oscar nomination the same is likely happen for grier we have made it thru comparison jackie is yearold airline stewardess who brings in extra cash and probably her main revenue smuggling large sums of money into the united states for ordell robbie pulp fictions samuel jackson and comparison ordell is in the illegal firearms business and has enlisted the aid of louis gara robert de niro bank robber who just got out of prison after serving four years help him accomplish scheme worth half million dollars trouble arises when jackie is stopped atf agent ray nicolet michael keaton and taken into custody for possession of narcotics as well as having more money than is allowed in an airport without being claimed naturally this proves an obstacle ordells plans and not as friendly intended as we would hope he posts jackies bail after she is put behind bars the thing is ordell is in this for no one more than himself and as we learn from his previous actions he is willing kill anyone who stands in the way jackie finds herself in tight squeeze ordell will not think twice about taking her out if she fails help him as she is always done yet at the same time compromise the authorities would be in order if evidence against ordell was provided it comes down simple question would jackie rather face ordell or prison what ensues is rich and intriguing example of storytelling as we question who jackie is really out help the law ordell or maybe just herself coming into play is another veteran robert forster as jackies bail bondsmen max cherry maxs obvious fondness for jackie will become major benefactor in her fight beat both sides of the system and forster plays him subtle charm that adds depth unbrewed romance also involved is ordells surfer girl girlfriend melanie bridget fonda ditzy sun bleached babe who spends her time watching tv bong in hand fonda does the best she can an essentially thin role but there is nothing more her and therefore she becomes tossable addition an otherwise flourishing bouquet of characters de niro is also wasted in his role as quiet nobody crook out score few bucks for himself de niro is brilliant actor but character who hardly ever speaks does not need de niro play him compared pulp fiction comparison the characters in jackie brown and very thin and replaceable in pulp fiction even the small seemingly irrelevant characters were wonderful complete and lifelike whereas jackie brown has such common figures that it would not have suffered much lesser talented cast the exception being grier tarantino wrote this script grier specifically in mind so say that she is made for this role is reversed truth sadly grier too could have received bit more attention especially when the story is all about her newlyjarred perception of life jackson teams up tarantino again but the chemical reaction is not as awesome as the first time jules was the rambling biblequoting hitman in pulp fiction and jackson is the only person who could have pulled it off and although jackson is really really good in jackie brown do not think he is quite as irreplaceable in fact maybe new face would have been better jackson could have remained tarantinos jules and new guy could have become ordell forever remain so in our memories sadly these characters are too much the same except ordell just is not as impressive and putting this in the hands of jackson once again is only going deter from our fond recollections of jules another problem is that ordell is way too focused on in the beginning this is griers so why spend so long getting know man who will become more of supporting character as the progresses it not only makes the movie feel little too slanted but it makes for slow beginning because we have take longer getting the meat of the story it is likely that those pouring into the theater see this are going be those anxious partake of tarantinos quirky dialogue and eccentric directing style and not so much those interested in seeing silver screen adaption of elmore leonards novel rum punch for those moviegoers do not expect another pulp fiction and you will be satisfied for the script oozes the familiar brash qualities that has made tarantino an icon of making the directing has toned down bit however yet we are still reminded that this is tarantinos movie thanks odd splitscreen storytelling devices and scenes being replayed multiple times from different viewpoints so getting back the question that began this is not pulp fiction at all it is good but it is not anything that made pulp fiction such revolutionary effort in the first place this is more conservative tarantino but not one that will not satiate true fans if you can realize that this is not going knock your socks off then you will be happy at least let it massage your feet after all we all know how much tarantino loves that particular part of the human anatomy

synopsis retiring detective jerry black nicholson becomes involved in the case of murdered girl and promises her parents that he will find the killer he purchases gas station on route he believes the killer takes and there befriends lori wright penn and her young daughter as jerry and lori fall in love can he do what must be done fulfill his pledge review at first the pledge appears be just another standard if wellexecuted crime drama it is anything but in its final hour it turns the corner and becomes riveting terrifying study of its lead character jerry black penn pays attention all the trappings of the serial killer genre but they are just window dressing his interest here unequivocally is jerry man so haunted his pledge that it consumes the entirety of the his existence at first we see this only in small hints some of his habits change for instance and he suddenly takes up smoking in big way but then when jerry buys the gas station and befriends lori the true extent of his mania draws horrifyingly into focus nicholson is fantastic portraying black rare subtlety and animus jerrys gradual descent into obsession is like car wreck thing horrible look at but impossible turn away from penn coaxes good supporting performances from much of the rest of his cast too only eckhart disappoints as jerrys replacement stan he never seems entirely convincing too much tool of the plot penns direction is astounding each frame looking as though it is parched of water perhaps or of sanity it all builds up shattering devastating climax lingers uncomfortably in the mind long after the house lights have come up

one never quite knows what one is going get mamet his american buffalo is setbound piece that has very little plot sometimes he will tell story that really moves heist is mamet doing his most entertaining work unlike his the spanish prisoner there are no lapses in credibility heist is probably the best mamet thriller since house of games it is the kind of plot you are never sure who will doublecross whom and frequently it is mamet doublecrossing the viewer watching the films team getting around security the viewer is frequently asking himself either what the heck are they doing or why did not anybody think of that before appropriately enough heist opens very clever jewelry store job it is so clever that one wonders if mamet really thinks up all these ideas himself or if he has help from professional magician and con expert ricky jay now regular actor in mamet films this is robbery that works like welloiled machine there is just one problem and it is enough get joe moore played gene hackman filmed on security camera now joe has get out of the business it was coming time anyway joes team including bobby blane delroy lindo fran moor rebecca pidgeon and pinky pincus ricky jay is going split up and go separate ways but crime boss bergman danny devito is pulling the strings and he says that joe and his people have manage one more robbery and he has take along young kid the short fused jimmy silk sam rockwell immediately it is obvious that there is more going on than meets the eye much of what distinguishes heist is mamets dialog remarkably it serves double purpose the robbery team sounds at once very professional and at the same time it has mamets special feel for dialog hackman has lines like everybody needs money that is why they call it money mamets timing is perfect in the direction but terrible in the production the plot is coincidentally lot like the plot of the recent the score is in fact very similar story both are good films perhaps for some of the same reasons but at least on high level they are much the same story the other problem the timing of heist is that it involves airport security and clever ways get around them saw the at the toronto international festival on september that made the subject matter just little too timely my understanding is that the release will be delayed my biggest problem the is that rebecca pidgeons acting at times seems very poor it is some kind of mamet trademark do not understand have women talk without inflection as if they are just reading the words for the first time it is an irritation and distracts us from what is otherwise very good thriller it is one rate an on the scale and high on the scale

contact shows why jodie foster is one of our best actresses see contact your family it is movie for all ages review stuart cracraft contact starring jodie foster matthew mcconaughey john hurt director robert zemeckis star after predictable mit phillip morrison powersof zoomout start can be surprising those not familiar prof morrisons work contact picks up steam gradually building bytheend an irresistable juggernaut and very good movie that does not as is so often the case fall outofbalance in terms of too much pandering the technological geek side the end the audience is left what good science fiction is supposed do evoke sense of wonder about the universe and evoke questions in your mind about what is out there this movie does not let technology overshadow characterization and in this sense it is unusual amongst hightech movies however except for jodie foster elie arroway and john hurt r hadden who are both actors of exceptional caliber the supporting cast are not especially impressive hurt certainly has had better roles stephen ward in scandal this one as the multibillionare hadden does not do his acting skills justice this is clearly foster movie one of the great lights of our generation fosters radiance has never been more strong than in the scene where she finally meets the vegans on their terms early scenes take long long time build up this the movies pacing is very good and subtle the panoramas of the radio dishes at arecibo and ceti in new mexico and puerto rico are beautiful the politics of fosters character attempting obtain funding for research at these places are trite and predictable however one of the most entertaining but very short scenes is when foster is confronted rob lowe during cabinetlevel presidential meeting discuss the alien invitation there were real sparks in this scene between foster and lowe and it would behoove them consider other vehicles in this dynamism could be explored it is the only scene in the movie in there were tremendous dynamics between two characters everything else was very onesided g foster lowe can stand up foster and it showed in that scene at the cabinet table the core scene of the movie is set on surrealistic beach on faraway world in the starsystem of vega it feels lot like science fiction writer john varleys scenes in his book steel beach where the female protagonists encounters an immensely superior intelligence in one case computer manufactured mankind itself and in fosters case an illusion drawn from her memory in another sense this immensely moving scene evokes gene roddenberrys star trek pilot the cage later the menagerie when jeffrey hunter and susan oliver have their memories manipulated create new worlds in they live and encounter aliens the concept is not new any sense in the world of science fiction but the beach scene is the centerpiece of the as is the whole is driven foster freed from her needs direct director zemecki foster is able let it all hang out in the characterization and the lead she provides her supporting cast as the movie gains speed fosters acting intensifies and the audience really does experience it her it is certainly oscarcaliber acting unquestionably the supporting cast does well and zemeckis throws in some humor some president clinton cameos cleverly manipulated george stephanopolusstyle seem very forrest gump in fact zemeckis et al got in trouble for the usage of some of the footage seen in the movie vis vis clinton but the audience attended this movie just had some good chuckles at clintons walkons the muchdiscussed tension between science and religion in this movie is not particularly insightful those who have already gone through this course though it is helpful those in the audience who have not also the nearfinal scene in senate judiciary hearing room is disappointing contact is fitting memorial the memory of carl sagan science popularizer and sometime pedantic gadfly of the halls of academe perhaps now sagan can be said be his dragons of eden

like the wonderful drama awakenings starring robin williams and robert de niro at first sight directed irwin winkler is inspired true story documented physicfirst sight directed irwin winkler is inspired true story documented physician oliver sacks since awakenings was so very good and made my top ten list the year it was released at first sight is not quite as strong since it is not directed as sure hand as penny marshall but is still an intelligent and vibrantlyacted drama the begins as amy mira sorvino stressedout new york architect decides take some time off and travel upstate the country at the hotel she is staying at she makes massage appointment and after long soothing session ends her crying as release of emotions she strikes up conversation the handsome masseur virgil val kilmer only find out later that he is actually blind amy does not really care if he has handicap or not and begins spend time him more and more until they finally start fall in love once she has returned new york amy begins research on virgils certain type of retinal blindness he has had since three years of age and out of stroke of luck comes into contact doctor bruce davison who believes he can repair virgils sight even though there have only been thirty similar cases in history at first reluctant virgil finally travels amy nyc and agrees the surgery much the hesitance of his overbearing but loving older sister kelly mcgillis ultimately the surgery is success but problems arise since virgil cannot relate what he sees since he has never visually seen anything before only touched objects he moves into amys apartment and she is eager stand him but virgils maladjustment begins put strain on their relationship on the basis of the overall story at first sight is indeed that has been done many times before and owes great deal its predecessor awakenings what will happen throughout the can also be easily telegraphed in advance however what helps at first sight rise above this predictability is in the mature and intelligent relationship that develops between virgil and amy usually romantic pictures are of the shameless puppydog sort the recent tom hanksmeg ryanstarrer you have got mail immediately pops mind but this grew care more about the characters and their plight the starts off noticably well as amy travels up north and first meets virgil the massaging sequences were strangely erotic maybe even more so than the later actual love scenes and as their romantic involvement quickly developed the was both entertaining and sweet and there was clearly lot of chemistry between the two these joyous moments early on balanced out well the later scenes in their relationship is seriously tested due contrast in the life styles that they have always known virgil completely used being blind and having comforting peaceful life in the country amys eventful life in the big city the other major compliment that must be given the are the nearly flawless performances across the board val kilmer usually cast in the macho type of role was always believable as blind person and playing his character was probably little more tricky than it appears it was up kilmer not come off as someone pity but sympathize and he pulled it off mira sorvino who made spectacular debuting splash in hilarious woody allen comedy mighty aphrodite for she won welldeserved oscar as kindhearted but ditzy hooker is standout here although she has made some mediocre choices since then mimic the replacement killers she always has managed come out unscathed and it is at first sight that she finally has another juicy role play in truthful climactic scene set in amys apartment between she and virgil sorvino proves be one of the most gifted young actresses around today and has flare for both comedic and dramatic pieces kelly mcgillis who could have easily come off as the bad onedimensional sister instead is also given an unexpectedly multifaceted character play as woman who may be overly protective but simply cares for her brother finally nathan lane who is usually little too overthetop is appropriately restrained as vision therapist the one misstep of at first sight is in its treatment of the medical procedure done on virgil very little is ever said or discussed concerning it and when the surgery occurs it is so briefly glimpsed at that it is impossible see what is being done his eyes perhaps the reason this aspect of the was not more indepth was that the makers were afraid it would gross out audiences but would personally take realism even if it is graphic any day over simply giving the explanation of the surgery the cold shoulder in awakenings the patients and illness were far more satisfyingly portrayed because of how strong the screenplay written steve levitt is in the way it deals the main relationship and because of the fabulous performances from kilmer and sorvino the films few problems can be swept over the side the adult way that the romance is depicted director irwin winkler is no doubt in respect the reallife couple that the was inspired who are still together after many years even though the setting of the was changed new york since january is usually the time of year that is known as the dumping ground from bad movies at first sight comes as refreshing and sophisticated change of pace

in the company of men made splash at the sundance festival because in year plagued brothers mcmullenstyle earnestly shallow genx angst pictures it seemed be actually about something it angered people started arguments outside the theater riled things up it ignited spark of excitement in what otherwise has been disappointing year for independent having endured my share of the hype waited calmly for men reach the hinterlands wherein reside and then checked in see what all the fuss was about does men live up its press well yes it does and it may make you think twice before you consider dating anyone your office for the uninitiated newcomers aaron eckhart and matt malloy play chad and howard two corporate drones who are dispatched their nameless company remote branch office for six week assignment chad and howard are archetypes examples of you can no doubt find in your own place of business chad is the blond golden boy genetically engineered for success the natural charmer who seems glide effortlessly up the corporate ladder howard is chads boss but he is weaker of will the clumsy practitioner of office politics who has achieved his position through dogged persistence rather than raw talent we first meet them awaiting their flight in drab airport lounge there chad suggests scheme worthy of shakespearean villain he and howard will find vulnerable single woman at the branch office woo her simultaneously win her love and then dump her the reason both men have recently been dumped themselves and chad sees an easy route revenge against the fairer sex it will restore little dignity our lives he says howard helpless against the force of chads will agrees the plan they quickly spot their prey in the form of christine stacy edwards fragile deaf woman working as temp chad moves in for the kill flashing his golden boy smile plying christine lunch then flowers then dinner howard follows suit though his efforts are in contrast hamhanded and desperate flattered have the attention of two eligible men christine dates them both you can guess one she falls for soon tragic lovers triangle develops christine loves chad chad loves himself and howard loves christine on the grounds that since she is handicapped and shy she just might be wretched and lonely enough settle for him adult social interaction never really progresses beyond the level of junior high does it in chad writerdirector labute and actor eckhart have created one of the most chilling monsters ever committed filmhannibal lector may eat human flesh but chad is an eater of souls his evil is as subtle as vipers and as easy as his smile we watch in stunned disbelief as he backstabs coworkers humiliates his subordinates and works his deadly venom into christines heart his character would be joke if he was not so chillingly real all of us have worked chad and some of us may be him he is the guy who takes your job and then laughs at you for your weakness if one of his coworkers should happen go postal and walk into the office bag full of handguns he had best have his escape route clearly in mind politics is his game and the modern cubiclefilled office is his playground men wears the guise of black comedy but it functions best as allegory the most controversial moment in the happens when chad humiliates black temp asking him how badly he wants succeed in the company then forces him prove it in manner will not describe the scene is charged racism and fraught peril could it happen in the real world probably not taken as allegory however it is representative of the treatment of the meek the powerful in all facets of society maybe it is just the english major in me but chad in his motiveless cruelty towards christine and his careful manipulation of howard can be seen as symbol of unbridled capitalism of greed without conscience the entire is metaphor for social darwinism only the strong will survive the marvel of labutes multilayered script is that it can disturb each member of its audience in an entirely different way but does the work as entertainment its darned funny in spots particularly in the mens room scenes demonstrate the lengths guys will go hold conversation while engaged in the most basic of bodily functions it works less well as drama since necessity the characters in an allegory tend be flat ciphers stacy edwards gives measured dignity christine and succeeds in making us care for her but the end of the we still know nothing about her likewise chad and howard are simply the sum of their actions the end of the you will feel as if you have met genuine monster in chad perhaps we can also classify men as horror certainly those expecting conventional resolution the story will walk away disappointed but the picture is often mesmerizing and the script is work of fine craftsmanship makes it well worth your time like all good films it offers myriad of parallels the outside world while watching chad in his moment of triumph could not help but think that bill gates must have felt the same sort of cold merciless satisfaction when he finally stuck it steve jobs there may be little bit of chad in all of us but some of us have taken chadness the level of art

the booming introduction music finishes and the camera sweeps over red mountains we see two figures looking over barren and very red landscape they kiss then walk on one of the characters schwarzenegger slips and falls the glass on his mask cracks his face scruches up and his eyes begin pop then doug quaid played schwarzenegger wakes up it is all been dream he wakes up next his beautiful wife played stone and the begins total recall is typical scifi wrapped around an intresting if far fetched plot quaid who has never been mars keeps on having dreams of the planet has now been colanised one day while riding on train he is sees ad for company called rekall implants memories of holiday instead of you actually going there yourself quaid chooses the secret agent on mars memory and then the really hits the fan the implant goes wrong and quaid really thinks he is an agent on mars for about two minutes until he goes back normal and cannot remember thing however everyone he knows his workmates his wife turn against him saying how blabbed about mars and blew his cover on the mission strange man called richter played ironside wants kill him quaid now hopelessly confused follows the advice given him friend he gets his ass mars mars is ruled cohagen played cox who charges people for air against him are the rebels who are mainly mutants the rebels need quaid defeat cohagen because quaid knows but cannot remember yet about reactor that produces air eventually quaid kills cohagen turns on the reactor saves the planet and goes away beautiful girl just like the guy at rekall promised him throughout this plot there is huge explosions thousands of deaths and mean lot of death swearing sex and everything else that makes good verhoeven director of basic instinct and starship troopers movie naturally there is some pretty imaginative deaths arms getting ripped off someone getting drilled and heads exploding as you can tell it is violent stuff but it is done so stylishly and of course arnie tones it down one liner that is it excusable the acting is variable arnie of course is useless but he goes has some good lines and in the first twenty minutes he even acts like normal bloke not like some action hero stone of course is useless making pretty poor wife and pretty poor action hero but she does sex scenes alright ticoton most recently seen in con air again is ok doing some good action but getting her emotions all wrong one minute she hates quaid the next she loves him and she never gets this tranisition right so the good guys are awful but the bad guys are excellent cox is basically reprising robocop but he is still great in this and he delivers the best line in the whole near the end ironside is superbly evil an utterly emotionless face the such as subway station scene but the model work is not so good some of the model heads look appaling fake and quatto is major disappointment another irritating thing is the product placement there are lot of plugs and good mars today gag however the sets look great and the special effects at the end of the are not too bad either there is also good soundtrack running through jerry goldsmith the omen poltergeist star trek the motion picture overall then total recall is hugely violent yet hugely enjoyable action fest reasonable plot thrown in there too some great bad guys and some imaganitive death for schwarzenegger movie this is not bad at all in fact it is very good

jonathan demmes _beloved_ based on the book toni morrison is study in skillful literary adaptation on the one hand the manages recreate key moments from the novel evoking morrisons pragmatic narrative style without using her authorial voice on the other hand beloved omits the some of the finer details of the book favoring an ambiguously defined back story upon build the storys main events this choice is smartly made one for it creates an open space in the storys wide range of emotions can gestate and grow indeed the impact of the is so protracted that much of it cannot be felt until long after the end credits have rolled _beloved_ takes place in the second half of the th century during the socalled reconstruction era after the civil war for newlyfreed slaves it is time of confusion and turmoil oprah winfrey is sethe slave who escaped kentucky plantation and took her children an ohio farmhouse where she hoped the terror would end what she did not know was that it would follow her there and remain her long after the physical threat had vanished _beloved_ ultimately tells the story of sethe is search for forgiveness one longhampered an unforgettable sin the starts off on dreary day ten years after sethe is escape as violent unseen energy rocks her dilapidated farmhouse invisible hands terrorize her family flinging objects across rooms shaking tables rattling floorboards sethe is sons run away perhaps for good leaving sethe and her daughter denver fend for themselves demmes matteroffact handling of this supernatural element is just one of _beloved_s intriguing aspects all of the characters take for granted that ghosts are real when paul danny glover former slave who escaped kentucky along sethe arrives at the house eight years later and is confronted the ghosts hellish visions he does not run in terror instead he asks who the ghost is as in morrisons novel demme quickly establishes that the horror of the story will not come from the fact of the ghost itself but from the terrifying past in the ghost was created sethe is the one being haunted but the ghost in the house is the least of her fears in fact the ghost is one of the reasons she chooses stay the story takes an bizarre turn the appearance of beloved thandie newton young blackclad woman who appears on sethe is front lawn leaned christlike against tree stump sethe and denver immediately take the rasping woman and try nurse her health they know not who she is but that does not matter only paul is suspicious of the stranger little does the family know that beloved will bring about many changes and force sethe release guilt she has held onto so urgently for eighteen years winfrey is arguably beloveds greatest asset she inhabits the role of sethe so convincingly it is hard believe this is the same woman who shines brightly on tv talk show lisa gay hamilton does an impressive job in the emotionally demanding role as the younger sethe whose appalling actions make her the disturbed woman we see eighteen years later danny glover is affable as the sympathetic paul as is kimberly elise as denver sethe is wanderlusting daughter as sethe is sagelike motherinlaw old baby suggs beah richards authoritatively commands every scene in she appears the films least palatable choice of casting is unfortunately that of the role of beloved herself thandie newton plays the glassyeyed girl demented fervor is endearing at first but becomes offputting and unintentionally laughable the end departing from the honed aesthetic he used in such films as _the silence of the lambs_ and _melvin howard_ director demme has used bit of dramatic overstatement get across the vivid descriptions in morrisons novel totemic camera shots and colorsaturated scenery are decidedly uncommon in demmes films but the few he uses here work the films benefit _beloved_s most memorable scenes are those of baby suggs gatherings in forest clearing where the bright yellowgreens of nature entrance the viewer as much as suggs words do for the most part though demme maintains his trademark directorial neutrality this combined morrisons equally frugal method of storytelling may make _beloved_ somewhat of challenge watch even those familiar the book though the compliments the book extraordinarily well it falls short in allowing the sort of accessibility one usually expects from nothing is spoonfed the viewer morrisons novel is just as enigmatic but unlike movie book can be put down allow the various undercurrents and themes churn and absorb the movie begins like _poltergeist_ and ends like _the color purple_ shades of _the scarlet letter_ and _little women_ somewhere in the middle taken as whole beloved is disquieting oneofakind experience one be viewed guards down and spirits in abeyance

scream is not quite as clever as its predecessor but it fills the gap cutting wit death even gruesome bloody death can be funny if handled the right way some will be offended this statement but you need look no further than pulp fiction for an example and while there is plenty of horror go around in scream the latest slasher flick incarnation there are also few laughs be had scream is sliceanddice movie for those who do not take their horror too seriously the success of the original scream took everyone in the industry surprise the unexpected blockbuster whose gross soared over the million mark during its six month release window opened just about year ago and turned into one of the most profitable horror films of all time sequel was inevitable fortunately nearly the entire creative team has returned for scream including director wes craven screenwriter kevin williamson and actors neve campbell courtney cox david arquette jamie kennedy and liev schreiber as stipulated one of the rules of sequels uttered movie obsessed character in the the body count in scream is higher than that in the original paradoxically there is lot less gore there is blood of course but nothing excessive slashermovie standards and there are no depictions of spilled entrails craven has remembered that scares are more important that graphic displays of human insides and bodily fluids second strength of scream is that it features gallery of legitimate characters rather than group of cardboard cutout stereotypes lined up for slaughter after all we have known some of these people for two movies it is almost impossible not care about them at least little scream opens approximately two years after the original as in the first picture there is slick selfmocking prologue this time the victims are jada pinkett and omar epps whose characters are visiting local theater for preview screening of the movie stab is based on the true life events of scream some of the smartest dialogue comes during this sequence as pinkett bemoans the lack of african american participation in horror films it is surely no coincidence that in addition pinkett and epps scream features two black characters shortly thereafter she and her boyfriend have been gutted signaling the beginning of series of copycat murders craven lets loose burst of tongueincheek creativity for the movie within movie sequences they give him an opportunity openly parody scream an act that he accomplishes great panache stab features heather graham in the casey becker role played in the original drew barrymore and tori spelling as sidney prescott neve campbell sadly we only see couple of scenes from stab it would have been little more fun think had craven used joe dantes approach from matinee and shown lengthy excerpts from his satirical production following the prologue we are reintroduced sidney prescott who has left her sleepy hometown go windsor college her friend randy jamie kennedy is student there as well and he is just as knowledgeable about horror films as ever once the double murder at stab becomes big news the media converges on windsor looking interview the original victim at the head of the flock of vultures is gale weathers courtney cox who has little surprise for sidney she has brought cotton weary liev schreiber the man sidney falsely accused of murder her also arriving at the college is deputy dewey david arquette who is there act as big brother sidney during this latest round of tribulations in addition the survivors from the original scream the field of potential victims is wellpopulated there is blond coed named cece sarah michelle gellar who has now appeared in two of williamsons movies this one and know what you did last summer sidneys requisite boyfriend derek jerry oconnell local newswoman laurie metcalf gales new cameraman duane martin british drama teacher david warner and several sorority sisters and wouldbe sorority sisters portia de rossi rebecca gayheart elise neal marisol nichols ultimately there are lots of attractive corpses from the stab scenes lines like brothers do not last long in situations like this craven and williamson are clearly having lot of fun scream and the movie is enjoyable if little overlong the livelier first hour is better than the second their resolution the obligatory whodunit is less of letdown than it could be and knowingly offers wink and nod at past unmasking scenes nice twist quips the killer did not see it coming didya one senses however that the end of this picture the overall concept of hip selfreferential slasher has been played out supposedly there is going be scream but if the makers do not come up something radical we could end up classic case of sequel overkill

when year old beau hall jonathan tucker the virgin suicides gets in car accident after drinking his year old companion club owner darby reese josh lucas session his mom margaret tilda swinton the war zone pays reese visit convince him leave her son alone instead reese travels out their lake tahoe home and lures beau out the boat house where beau learns that his mother was right about reese the next morning margaret discovers darbys dead body on their beach and suspecting the worst weights it down in distant part of the lake but her troubles are just beginning as she soon learns the arrival of blackmailer alek spera goran visnjic practical magic in the deep end the incredibly pale redheaded scottish actress swinton immerses herself into the role of the reserved american supermom whose life revolves around serving the needs of her three children and livein fatherinlaw jack peter donat the game she shows great strength while allowing other emotions glimmer through discomfort at challenging reese in his gay disco named the deep end near panic at having dive down his body retrieve car keys or even wry humor when an attempt get help from jack becomes hopelessly miscommunicated gradually her loneliness becomes apparent her husbands naval officer usually away at sea when her attempts email him her concerns about beau are deleted and later when most unusual yet chaste romance turns tragic it is terrific performance the stendahl syndromelike script adapted from elisabeth sanxay holdings noir novel the blank wall directors scott mcgehee and david siegel would be unbelievable if not for swinton and her costar visnjic alek spera is wrong side of the tracks loser who arrives after reeses body has been discovered he shows margaret videotape of beau having sex reese and demands or he will turn the tape over the reno police subsequent visits will turn his mind set upside down and backwards though as he comes admire and even love the woman he set out blackmail there is yet another problem though his partner nagle raymond barry dead man walking is harder cored criminal who will not let up until his share of the money is delivered visnjics dark brooding turn has an interior shading it that makes us believe he is victim of circumstance and environment his turnaround is palpable as he witnesses margarets inherent decency and her workaday surroundings also outstanding is tucker as beau who has terrific character arc and pas de deux his mother initially beaus the typical sullen teen you are blowing this out of proportion he says of her concerns about reese not comprehending that his mom has enough insight have divined the true nature of the relationship as his mom gets in deeper and deeper trying cover up crime he did not commit beau becomes suspicious of her actions and apparent new companion turning tables his early black eye becomes her later split lip while the two can never be completely honest each other their love for each other comes through strongly the directors suture have firm grip on their material and cast the story builds perfectly bold strokes amidst myriad of subtler underpinnings water imagery is constant an early shot of weirdly rushing green is revealed be young boy cleaning out an aquarium giles nuttgens fire cinematography won the sundance festival award is crisp and startlingly clear the tahoe locations and production design kelly mcgehee and christopher tandon provide dual personality for the contrasting the calm well off existence of the lake against the gambling city of reno the deep end is complex story of domino deeds and shifting relationships take the plunge

leonardo decaprio what is eating gilbert grape and claire danes tvs my so called life star in director baz luhrmanns modernized version of william shakespeares classic romeo juliet surrounded superb supporting cast including paul sorvino goodfellas brian dennehy tommy boy pete poslethwaite the usual suspects and john leguizamo executive decision decaprio and danes shine throughout the the story starts off at gas station where the montague boys meet the capulet boys and square off one another symbolizing the swords of shakespeares day were their weapons like the rapiermm or the longsword shotgun instead of killing each other right away they shoot around just like in sword fights of old another great thing about the was the performance of harold perrineau as romeos best friend mercutio who in shakespeares novel was quite stud was portrayed as an africanamerican crossdresser whose violent nature was definite plus miriam margoyles virtually unknown actress was astounding as juliets nurse even though she was never given name she was the only one who could keep juliet out of her fantasy world verona was the home of the rival families in shakespeares version only slightly changed in luhrmanns now known as verona beach the capulet us led sorvino and montagues led dennehy are now rival corporate dynasties and their small family skirmishes were now huge gang wars one slight problem the was the difficulty comprehend the dialogue since it was spoken in old english subtitles could have helped in the beginning of the movie but toward the end it became easier understand this excellent movie poses another problem what genre is it romeo juliet contains so much drama yet enough comedy and action be placed in either of those categories the same awardwinning formula that was used quentin tarantino in reservoir dogs and pulp fiction romeo juliet is sure fire modern masterpiece

why do people hate the spice girls what exactly have they done wrong other than perhaps offend the fashion police so what if they are not great singersthey as not singing opera folks its pop music who exactly is great singer judging that opening paragraph it is obvious that like the spice girls they do what they dosing some catchy tunesand they do it pretty well they are able carry that into their first spice world spice world certainly is not great filmgoing experience what it is what the spice girls are all about fun songs and lot of girl power drawing from number of different films like the beatles hard days night spice world chronicles the week heading up the girls first concert at londons albert hall they get tool around london in big ol bus driven meat loaf and generally have fun in order through semblence of plot into the there is an evil tabloid publisher played barry humphries better known americans for about minutes as dame edna remember her he wants sabotage the girls concert so he can sell papers of course the point in movie like spice world is not plot the center of the is the spice girls themselves ginger the recently departed geri haliwell posh victoria adams sporty melanie chisolm scary melanie brown and baby emma bunton each one has their own personality and perhaps the best part of the look like they are having some honesttogoodness fun something that cannot be said for lot of people in films today along for the ride are richard grant as their manager clifford and various other characters making quick cameo appearances including teriffic british actors like richard briers and stephen fry and every once and while roger moore pops up as the chief spout odd koans added bonus he gets in the words of craig kilborn dance dance dance watching this was fun for the most part there are few slow segments but overly director bob spiers keeps things moving at quick pace plenty of hummable spice girls songs in the background his camerawork is fairly pedestrian though the final concert number is done quite well effective use of editing the look of the promotes the high fun the design of the spicebus being quite original and eyecatching add in walltowall spice girls music and this is lovable romp if you do not like the spice girls you will not change your mind this but if you find them at least tolerable get ready sit back and chill because the spice girls are here entertain you and do it quite well spice world directed bob spiers written kim fuller music the spice girls geri halliwell victoria adams melanie chisolm melanie brown emma bunton richard grant claire rushbrook roger moore distributed columbia pictures running time minutes rated pg available on home video june

more than forty years ago the sword and sandals genre of historical epic ruled the box office during the sought give audiences reason turn off their televisions and go out the movies offering the grand spectacle of the roman empire in cinemascope benhur cleopatra the robe sparticus the fall of the roman empire quo vadis sometimes brilliant sometimes campy the roman epic was the technicolor funeral pyre of classic since then epics have appeared infrequently the last emperor braveheart and some of the best have been smallscreen affairs produced in the roots shogun yet the phrase we who are about die salute you has been absent until now gladiator begins in germania in d roman general maximus russell crowe has conquered yet another group of barbarians for his emperor marcus aurelius richard harris and he is eager retire his plantation in spain where his wife and son are waiting however the emperor is worried that his decadent weakling son commodus joaquin phoenix will prove poor successor so he wants make maximus his heir as transition toward rome becoming republic again when commodus hears the plan he strangles his father and orders maximus and his family murdered maximus escapes from the executioners but he arrives home too late save his wife and son caravan of slavers pick up the wounded hero and carry him off north africa why the caravan happened be cruising maximus place is never explained an african named juba djimon hounsou treats maximus wounds proximo oliver reed gladiator who won his freedom purchases maximus and juba as fodder for the arena of course maximus proves as able gladiator as he was soldier and his fame spreads when commodus reopens the coliseum proximo brings his troupe of warriors rome compete our hero wins the hearts and minds of the cheering crowds and finds that he has an ally in commodus sister lucilla connie nielsen the similarities braveheart are obvious an evil king determined warrior seeking revenge for his murdered family the aid of lovestruck princess also like mel gibsons epic gladiator has primarily visceral appeal and is driven forward the heros anger it is simple tale of good versus evil maximus has all the manly virtues nobility of purpose courage in battle loyalty king and country physical stamina and devotion family commodus is his opposite in every way sniveling selfish coward who is intended disgust the audience the opening night crowd in my theater was about male and that seems appropriate gladiator is guy movie would the opposite of chick flick be dick flick there is much pumping of testosterone and chopping off of body parts in gruesome battle sequences those easily offended gore should stay away lucilla is the only female character and what sparks there are between her and maximus are dampened his devotion his dead wife joaquin phoenix gives an astounding performance in the scene where commodus kills his father phoenix shows the pain of son who has never had his fathers love or pride throughout the picture phoenix manages give depth character who is scripted as caricature of evil have been russell crowe fan since romper stomper this role does not offer him the complexities of his parts in a confidential and the insider essentially his job is grunt heroically but his voice has richard burton resonance textured clint eastwood rasp is perfect for the genre the late oliver reed gave us the best work of his career in his last role hope it will be rewarded an oscar my only major quibble gladiator is its stylized look several scenes are tinted we have seen lot of the tinted look lately particularly in payback and the matrix do not get the appeal of the style makes feature films look like tv ads in payback it was merely annoying but in gladiator it bleaches the color out of the grand spectacles that are the raison detre of the roman epic perhaps it is meant gloss over the imperfections of the computergenerated shots also the battle scenes are filmed in strange herky jerky style that seems be slo mo and fast forward simultaneously it reminds me of the way the flash runs in the comic books leaving halfblurred trail of images of himself behind more realistic look gladiator could be even more satisfying than braveheart because it has tighter script and more fulfilling conclusion bottom line rousing action enriched fine performances but tarnished stylistic choices

the andromeda strain is the greatest science fiction ever made know that is very sweeping statement so will qualify it adding that the andromeda strain is one of the few films made that genuinely deserve the label of science fiction stories in speculative science is at the core of the plot space odyssey is probably better but it really only qualifies as science fiction if you consider metaphysics be science most all other films we normally classify as science fiction or sf are really just fantasy action or horror stories set in futuristic setting the andromeda strain starts out two soldiers in hightech for van looking for crashed satellite in tiny new mexico town something bad happens them pictures from reconnaissance plane show shocking sight apparently everyone in the town is dead the authorities call wildfire alert summoning four scientists all but one of them somewhat reluctant supersecret underground germ warfare laboratory in nevada two of scientists stone and hall fly directly the town in space suits and find town where almost every single resident literally dropped in their tracks their blood turned powder in their veins some went insane before they died and two of them baby and an old wino are miraculously still alive they take the survivors and the satellite back the lab where stone pressures the white house call up directive an executive order cauterize the area around the town nuclear bomb what they find on the satellite when they get back the lab is andromeda an organism that defies all the normal rules of earthlike life and mutates as it grows their only hope cure it is find out what perfectly healthy baby boy has in common an old derelict what they find out is that organism feeds directly on energy and that detonating the abomb over the town would only spread it across the entire planet they barely call off the bombing in time but then the organism mutates into something that threatens eat through the labs defenses and break out this triggers the labs lastditch defense mechanism an atomic bomb those raised on the brainless action fare that pollutes movie theaters these days the andromeda strain will probably seem interminably slow much of the is lot of people standing around looking at video screens and computer readouts but what the characters see on those screens ratchets up the tension every turn of the screw the performances are universally fine the actors keeping things lowkey and restrained just like scientists me the real appeal of this is the fact that it shows scientists acting like scientists and makes it seem exciting we follow the logic of their deduction step methodical step puzzling like they do every time andromeda behaves in way we do not expect this is only available on wide screen on dvd and
