that is the way see it it was originally rated when first released but it now carries the pg rating mostly for very mild nudity and one scene in bodys wrist is slashed spilling its powdered blood

it is not good know too much about someone charlie charles warns his niece charlie margaret welsh devilish grin charlie is infatuated her namesake uncle her soul mate as she calls him since her mother gave her his name there is lot know about charles not the least of is that he strangled widows back east mark harmon who looks like anything but killer but specializes in playing them plays charles the merry widow murderer in the hallmark hall of fame remake of the hitchcock shadow of doubt and avoid any questions about his guilt we see charles in action in the opening scene his last victim the story takes place in the early in the small town of petaluma california where charles heads avoid the police john gays script uses most of the original screenplay sally benson alma reville and thornton wilder karen arthurs direction is certainly no match for the great master but on an absolute scale the movie maintains high level of suspense when supercilious and deceitful charles comes pay visit of indeterminate length his sister and her family in petaluma they do not know about his nefarious activities he showers them elaborate gifts buy the love they had already given him anyway two mysterious and exceedingly cleancut writers for magazine show up take pictures of the family for spread on the average american family but their interest is focused on uncle charles especially on taking his picture and learning about his background charlie who first welcomed her uncles visit begins feel more and more uncomfortable him and suspicious of the disingenuous magazine reporters the picture advances delicate power using small details such as the newspaper article that the uncle tries secretly remove and that charlie discovers the beauty of the story is the pas de deux between uncle and niece as they try out psych each other she wants him leave and he does not want go what local rich widow as prospective victim will charles kill charlie first or will she get him out of town harmon is wonderfully creepy and smug and welsh is tough but trapped deft touch the director sets up each scene several thunderstorms and tom neuwirths sepiatoned cinematography makes the movie feel as if it were filmed in the my only quibble is the directors awkward staging of the final scene on the train is hitchcocks version better of course is this one worth watching as well actually yes shadow of doubt runs it is not rated but would be pg for adult themes and would be fine for kids around nine and up

do you want know the truth about cats and dogs do you well as this movie shows us they make good companions but pale in comparison the joy and fulfillment romantic relationships can bring unfortunately there is giant roadblock set up in our culture that only certain people can get through while the rest of us mill around outside feeling sorry for ourselves checkpoint beautiful kind of thing and janeane garafolos character abby relates it well like certain oversized teenage movie critic she is intelligent and has great sense of humor but strikes out the opposite sex because she sees herself as physically unattractive and the men seem be backing her up on that meanwhile her gorgeous neighbor nora uma thurman uma being the only womans name worse than nora attracts men like flies as abby tells her you burp and they think it is cute you barf and they line up hold your hair back but noras down on herself for being too shallow and superficial we all have our prwhen man calls in veterinarian abbys talk radio show wanting know how get the roller skates off his basset hound oh come on any idiot knows how handle that problem he likes her personality and professional demeanor and asks meet her in person abby though knows her body does not match her personality and that she probably will not have chance him once he sees her so she gives him noras body description and stands him up nora happens be in the studio the next day when the dog man comes and abby asks her for big favor she goes along the masquerade and the three of them head out for night of fun abby assuming the role of goat cheese farmer named donna the dog man finds out even though this girl is beautiful she is not quite as intellectual or confident about herself in person but he does not suspect anything realizing he is not living in threes company episode the charade continues abby furthering the relationship over the phone including decidedly unnecessary phone sexmasturbation sequence and nora furthering it in person while eventually finding herself attracted the dog man like sleepless in seattle this comedyromance is predictable all the way through but we care enough about the characters that we root them on and will the romance blossom the truth about cats and dogs is not quite as entertaining as was expecting it be but it handles well theme could identify the thing is find janeane garafolo rather attractive she is no uma but am sure in real life she would have no problems attracting men on the other hand could not attract man save my life and am rather proud of that fact

alien is the only alien have seen in theaters saw it when was years old and must admit that did not like it of course was expecting aliens again and believe this was my fault in order appreciate alien you need see aliens but you also have wipe away all the expectations from its predecessor james camerons aliens was an action and many people consider it the best in the series am among that group but alien is an extremely entertaining critics have bashed for its originality many thought the final chase scene went on for too long and many others thought that the was too much dialogue and not enough action both are untrue because the has quite bit of action and the dialogue was essential and wellwritten as for the chase sequence it was long but not overly long creating quite bit of suspense from confusion perhaps watching alien on video helped on the big screen was overwhelmed something normally did not see it was very dark and the language was extremely harsh had always figured the alien series rely on smart dialogue instead of moronic profanities do not get me wrongi am not saying films should eliminate swearing but when substitutes dialogue these profane remarks it gets rather distracting however since seeing it again realize that the swearing is mainly just an aspect of the restrained hatred in the characters as result alien only flaw albeit major one is the underdeveloped characters we never really care about any of them and get the feeling that many scenes were cut in order shorten the length of the movie there were only two characters liked and of course one was lt ripley sigourney weaver although we have gotten know her through two other films the other character was dr clemens charles dance but because we like him the inevitable occurs alien begins exactly where aliens left off the prologue of alien is pure cinematic achievement director david fincher who had only directed music videos before his chance this alien entry without using single line of dialogue unless you count computer warnings fincher sets up the entire an impressive aspect of this is that fincher only shows few seconds of before cutting title card we see lt ripley and the little girl in their cryogenic compartments title shot of an alien egg title alien legs stretch up into the air title and so on and so on during these first ten minutes learned everything had in order for alien proceed it is quite remarkable opening and one will remain in my mind for long time because of this facehugger has been hatched aboard the vessel from aliens the hypersleep containers are sent into an escape pod and sent down the nearest planet fiorina fury an ore refinery has been turned into maximum security prison however the facehugger managed attach itself one of the cryotubes and is sent down the escape pod unfortunately during the landing all but one of the survivors from aliens is killed ripley is discovered some of the inmates and taken back the refinery of course you need carrier for this facehugger and it attachs itself the dog came the team of inmates ripley is revived and asks see the ship after seeing mysterious acideaten section ripley asks see the dead bodies and then have them cremated this cremation scene is one of the most powerful and impressive of all the alien films featuring monologue from dillon charles dutton prisoner who has found god the movie cuts back and forth from the ceremony the dogs demise it is one of the most memorable moments as the speech reflects exactly what is going on the dog and this is where alien succeeds fincher normally injects lot of symbolism into his films and can easily see him becoming the next stanley kubrick or alfred hitchcock in fact he is the mixture of both fincher knows exactly what and how it and figure that he will be one of the few directors complete control over his films alien is riddled symbolic speeches and metaphorical images doing so fincher creates some of the best scenes in the entire alien franchise many people have criticized finchers filming of the death scene of ripley reveal nothing saying this as looking too fake but enjoy and relish in the portrayal showing ripley fall in slow motion is nice touch but actually not showing her hit the vat of iron great deal of symbolism is derived feel that it would have spoiled the mood of the entire if they had actually shown her splash into the molten iron however most people seem want witness ripley die creates paradox as she is the character did not want see die why she is killed is one of the surprises of the and do not plan on spoiling that in this review from every alien comes several memorable moments seem stick you forever in alien it was of course the moment the alien burst out of kanes stomach in aliens it was the showdown between alien and ripley in machine alien has several but most memorable is the terrific shot involving the alien and ripley ripley is pushed up against wall and the alien stands inches away from her why it does not kill her is shocker later leads surprise ending fincher apparently loves use closeups of actors faces michael douglas and the clown faceoff in the game in the same style and shaving off the actors hair the only thing we have look at is their faces many critics did not like all the actors being bald but it makes complete sense when taken in context of the plot most of alien works when you take it in context of the story but when you try compare it its predecessors finchers turn seems bit gloomy and dark though that is not always bad thing the plot is pretty much rehash of the first two films some major twists again we are setup several different characters and one one they are picked off however while the first two had tons of arsenal especially camerons alien takes place on planet devoid of human life except for this rundown prison as result no weapons are be found this creates lot of tension although must admit that fincher could have added lot more suspense as an alien alien is the worst of the series but itself it is an extremely wellmade motion picture lot more merits than not the unfortunate thing surrounding this second sequel is the onedimensional characters never was really emotionally involved on screen because most of the characters are hardcore criminals whom really could care less about despite this ripley was the central figure and that is what is important we care for her even though she began act just like one of the guys again the technical side of this is remarkable and better than the two previous versions while camerons version was pumped up action massive artillary fincher uses brilliant camera angles terrific lighting and moody sets the cinematography alex thomson is very well done terrific chase sequence towards the end of the movie the confusion of the ending draws the viewer in as we are just as confused as the actors who are being chased around the yellows reds and oranges of the lights create dark mood and themselves create lot of suspense shadows dance on the walls and yet those shadows could easily be the alien the alien is different from its predecessors this time around and the swiftness of this alien is quite intense the camera likes take up the perspective of the alien racing after the characters the sets are quite incredible are reminiscient of the nostromo from alien the narrow corridors and labrynthine hallways is well constructed the sets appear be in the future but not too far in the future one of the set pieces even aids in the destruction of the alien nothing surprising there sigourney weaver turns out yet another good performance equaling her portrayal of ripley in aliens she was snubbed at the oscars for this one mainly because the was critical bomb her reactions are far more realistic in this her crying over the loss of the little child she risked her life saving in her previous encounter it is quite touching really charles dutton is very strong in his performance as one of the inmates and was on the brink of actually caring for him charles dance turns in nice lowkey performance and as result cared for him immediately lance henriksen makes brief appearance as bishop ii but he was more entertaining in aliens the rest of the cast is pretty stale though pete postlethwaite sticks out due his recent turns in the usual suspects and the lost world alien is rated for strong violence and language and sex although it has its flaws alien is highly entertaining rich symbolism this reminds you how much fun it is spot metaphorical images throughout movie while kubrick may have moral message throughout his films fincher relies on cinematic devices bring his meanings out it is like finchers reminds us that it is okay for sacrifice quality for quantity the final scene in fact it tells us that we as society have become too critical of things may happen look little fake whenever something looks fake on screen we immediately point it out as mistake but perhaps it is not mistake

ultra low budget but extremely inventive horror about group of friends vacationing in cabin who accidentally awaken an evil force in the woods via the necronomicon the book of the dead bruce campbell stars as ash who eventually becomes the sole survivor and has battle both the demons from the woods and his friends who have become demons including his own girlfriend the results shown on screen are amazing considering the films tiny budget constant location changes and filming schedule that was sporadic over two years followed two sequels evil dead ii and army of darkness the dvd release of this from elite entertainment contains the in it is original aspect ratio of the disc contains two versions of the films audio stereo track and newly remastered dolby digital included are two separate running commentary tracks the first features writerdirector sam raimi and producer rob tapert and the second track features the films star bruce campbell campbells commentary is informative and extremely witty as he has story tell for virtually every scene in the such informative tidbits include the original title of the was going be book of the dead and in fact when the premiered in that was it is title and when they were asked change the title the evil dead everyone thought it was the worst title they had ever heard also there is scene early on in the where the group sits around and listens tape recorder they have found that is explaining about the demonic forces in the woods for that scene it was written for the characters be smoking marijuana so being the wacky kids that they were at the time they decided actually smoke marijuana for the scene almost all of that footage became unusable because many of the actors had never smoked before and as result they became confused and were unable perform the scene wish the entertainment factor was as high for the sam raimirob tapert audio track the two people you would think would be more enthusiastic in talking about this instead barely have much say at all do not get me wrong here when they do speak it is entertaining hear but there are many instances where both are silent for long periods of time sometimes after one of those long silences rob will ask have anything say sam me that is not good sign also it seems like sam raimi does not remember much about the and it is production well compared rob and bruce anyway also included on the disc is photo gallery includes pictures from the films gala premiere and about twenty minutes of raw footage from the this raw footage really shows you how much can be improved upon using simple audio techniques overall the evil dead is good low budget horror superior many films in it is genre and the collectors edition dvd release is well worth your time if you are either fan of the or just fan of the filmmaking process all special edition dvds should be this thorough and entertaining

elmore leonard has quickly become one of hollywoods favorite authors out of four adaptations in as many years the witty and inventive out of sight gives get shorty run for its money as the best leonard adaptation around george clooney stars as jack foley nice bank robber you know the type he uses his charm and his wits rather than gun but even charming guys end up unlucky and jack ends up in jail but not for long he plots an escape the help of his best friend and fellow robber buddy bragg ving rhames and their slowwitted pothead associate glenn michaels steve zahn but jack did not count on s marshal karen sisco jennifer lopez appearing at the right place at the wrong time karen gets involved in foleys escape attempt and the subsequent manhunt bring him in however karen develops rapport jack foley and finds that she begrudgingly likes the guy but can love prosper on opposite sides of the law or can karen straighten out jack before he goes too far in pursuit of just one last crime clooney who has had string of solid but never stellar roles delivers his best performance date he blends into his role here perfectly as the risk taking jack foley who is willing gamble everything on the chance that karen sisco might be his true love jennifer lopez does an excellent job as well she actually has trickier role than clooney as woman who has balance her emotions her sense of duty she and clooney develop good chemistry together the boasts superb ensemble steve zahn gives hilarious performance and steals nearly every scene he is in don cheadle is appropriately sinister as violent excon who may or may not be teaming up foley albert brooks is enjoyable as white collar criminal who talks too much for his own good out of the cast only dennis farina seems underused as karens exlawman father steven soderbergh gives the sharp and stylistic direction an affectation for freeze frames he delivers unique take on the films action and love scenes that places out of sight notch above routine crime films recurring series of flashbacks makes the seem more complex than it actually is devoid of its bells and whistles out of sight is actually fairly straightforward crime story however there are only few spots in the that seem bare and they pass quickly smart dialogue good characters and an excellent cast out of sight easily smoothes over the rough spots in the plot and delivers on both the action and romantic fronts

bob the happy bastards quickie review the matrix what is worse than yk how about fully digital future where nothing is real that is what computer programmer neo keanu reeves slowly learns as he enters the dangerous world that is the matrix movie directed the wachowski brothers the guys behind the hip thriller bound before you groan at the presence of reeves in the lead role hold on there is actually story depth here it seems that group of hackers is out stop the system that is the matrix led the bald but brilliant laurence fishburne and assisted carrie ann moss who looks quite cool in leather must say neo reeves is pretty much key player in this fight although he really does not look it at first could this amateur be the one as fisburne thinks he is credit the wachowskis for putting together great story that allows suspense build something that few special effectsladen films seem do these days there is plenty of effects go around of course but at least there is backbone build them on as well reeves is surprisingly good in his role as neo particularly in fight scene fishburne that comes across as goofy yet great wish the villains were not quite so generic leftover gmen from looking for sweet scifi actioner plenty of stopmotion swooping camera angles and of course motherlode of helicopter explosion now the wachowskis are headed into horror films their next project bring it on

martin scorseses kundun chronicles roughly the first twenty years of the life of the currently exiled dalai lama has been criticized for its lack of narrative structure personally do not think it needs one it works perfectly well as study of tibetan buddhist culture and how communist china scorsese views the dalai lama the way many tibetans probably do as largerthanlife symbol of buddhist spirituality and political leadership the only glimpses into his head come from several interesting yet oblique dream sequences but his portrayal is appropriate for that concentrates on the political and spiritual rather than the personal the set design and cinematography are outstanding and while scorsese occasionally seems get carried away the spectacle it helps augment the cultural contrast when the dalai lama travels china meet chairman mao political art sometimes succumbs the temptation start shouting slogans kundun does not it succeeds in delivering its message in an artistically interesting way and without being overly manipulative

synopsis upper middle class suburban family man lester kevin spacey realizes that he is just going through the motions he is unable feel passion he is soulless cynical and no longer able feel the edge between success and failure everyone else around him has similar symptoms lesters unassertive daughter jane thora birch is too lethargic change her world yet all too ready whine and complain his wife carolyn annette bening is reduced keeping up appearances and reciting commercialist slogans and these are people big house and decent standard of living the only person who seems able appreciate beauty and freedom and life is the person most deprived of it dopedealing teen from across the street who is practically imprisoned domineering bullying father when lester embarks on mad scramble feel the edge again the fact that he has quit his job feel what it is like and his newfound interest in exercise impress teenage girl ruffle lot of feathers in the family will lester regain his ability appreciate life opinion people say it all the time you never appreciate good health until it is gone likewise people raised in fabulously pampered prosperity can become unhappy and spiteful over the dumbest most inconsequential problems simply because they have no clue how good they have it sometimes it takes near fall accidentally or through deliberate fasting move out of apathy and reclaim your ability challenge the world the deprivationappreciation cycle is major theme of american beauty american beauty is nonformula intelligent and articulate movie that offers fantastic performances everyone in the cast especially kevin spacey who is simply gosh darn amazing this movie the thing like about american beauty is that there is no sentimental music no hospital scene nor any overly dramatic hokum the movie entertains and offers brilliant performances just as is if you are in the mood for thoughtful nonformula flick highly recommend american beauty

though it is fine piece of filmmaking there is something about elizabeth that left me bit cold and think it is something that bugs me quite often in films particularly these days just did not care about the characters me the first and foremost job of filmmaker is create characters be they imagined or historical as the case may be that the audience gives hoot about and though elizabeth works well on many levels it falls short of excellence because of that very reason elizabeth takes place in england in as queen mary half sister of elizabeth and monarch on the side of catholicism is dying before she dies though she cannot bear sign document would condemn her half sister death because of her heretical protestant beliefs as result amidst much anger within the council elizabeth becomes the queen of england the chronicles her rise power as she fights for unified church of england and tries bring order her personal and political life much of the deals elizabeths love for lord robert mysterious man who thrusts his lordship onto many woman as he continues proclaim his love for the queen there is much ado about her lack of husband and political pressures from spain and france enter into the equation the problem the lies this as its centerpiece as love interests are such character driven element did not much care about the characters perhaps aside for elizabeth who is played quite well blanchett and so did not have much interest in who would join her in her nuptials the cast is rounded out well the marvelous rush who plays the queens most loyal advisor sir francis and attenborough as wellmeaning but oldfashioned lead council why then you must be asking do recommend elizabeth simply because it is the result of perfect pairing of director and cinematographer kapur and his cinematographer remi adefarasin neither of whom have heard create beautifully realized piece of filmmkaing from the technical side the light streams through each frame as in any painting from the period and beautifully captures the realistic light sources that would have been found in churches cellars and castles in th century europe each frame is rich color contrasted blackness or blownout white light from windows the costumes alexandra byrne deserve mention as they are such an inportant aspect of each shot indeed elizabeth is one of the most visually beautiful films of the decade ranking kundun and braveheart watch also for the incredibly godfatheresque mass murder scene it made me think in retrospect of the similarities between the two films

carolco pictures and dutch director paul verhoeven robocop came together create the mega hit that is total recall the is masterpiece of sets action and special effects action and science fiction just do not get any better than this the story involves construction worker named douglas quaid arnold schwarzenegger who lives on earth his beautiful wife lori sharon stone quaid is obsessed mars and decides go the second best choice brain implant fake memory of two week vacation on mars while being implanted memory cap is triggered and the doctors realize that quaids memory has previously been erased now the people who did it are after him quaid must find out who he really is and why these people want him dead the plot unfolds at rapid pace explaining itself through great action special effects and twist after mindboggling twist it grabs you and never lets go this is winner from beginning end the plot is superb combining the best elements of science fiction and psychological mystery create riproaring saga schwarzenegger gives his best performance ever and the supporting cast is good too the action and stunts are terrific the sets are huge and elaborate lot of attention payed detail the music and sound effects are perfect for the and really add certain level of impact the action the makeup effects rob bottin the howling the thing and robocop are top notch not mention extremely outlandish the visual effects dream quest the abyss and industrial light and magic star wars trilogy jurassic park and terminator are phenomenal the visuals had such state of the art slickness that they won an oscar of course the is not always realistic it is more fiction than science for example it is true that body will not explode in the vacuum of space but in total recall they do who cares it is movie movies are supposed entertain and in my opinion this achieves an entertainment level in that is so terrific it may be impossible beat

the abundance of trite recycled movies in the late there is tremendous demand movie lovers never mind movie critics for movies that present the wide audience something truly original perhaps audaciously perhaps purely thematically for the former you need look no further than director tom tykwers incredible german thriller run lola run movie that may make some viewers need cooling off period afterwards lola contemporary gothgirl blazing red hair receives desperate phone call from her boyfriend manni one day it seems that because she was late delivering something he lost bag containing hundred thousand marks and if he does not deliver hundred thousand marks within the next twenty minutes he will be killed this gives lola twenty minutes come up marks or her boyfriend dies so she runs not just jogs sprints in hopes that somehow someway she will be able obtain the money and save life from there as critic steve rhodes described it run lola run plays bit like sliding doors on steroids nonstop techno soundtrack wierd camerawork all kinds of insane zooms and truly breakneck pace anyone that is bored run lola run has be smoking something indeed the movie is often outrageously exciting as well as bitterly ironic and subtly serious very much like titanic run lola run is an achievement filmmaking much more than it is an achievement in the way the movie is made for pure visual style tykwers movie is breathtaking literally sometimes thematically it does leave something be desired it toys around some intriguing ideas but does occasionally seem as if there is little substance behind all of the flash while you are watching this will not matter running breezy minutes this is one movie wished was longer because it was so damn good while it lasted it is the equivalent of rollercoaster in the amount of thrills and fun that it offers eugene novikov

i was anxious see this for long time friend of mine recommended this me because he has crush on neve campbell and he wanted prove that she is as hot as he thinks he is he proved it for me all right but the reasons enjoy this go way beyond that scream treads on familar ground horror movie as star neve campbell puts it some stupid killer stalking some big breasted girl who cannot act who is always running up the stairs when she should be running out the front door it is very familar your typical horror so why you may ask after watching it does it seem so new and original because it treats itself as if it has not been done before and thus the viewer is disilusioned into believing that it is not old familar tired stuff this raises another question how does it do this simple the characters they are not your typical stupid horror victims who do not know what the hell do when being chased guy in ski mask and machette they are horror fans they know how stuff happens in horror movie they know what do and what not do and that makes it scary and even funny at certain times you can tell this just watching the opening scene where casey becker drew barrymore is making popcorn getting ready watch video and some guy who sounds like killer calls her up play game her that involves horror movie triva that if she gets it wrong will get her and her boyfriend killed she knows what answer when he asks her horror questions she just cannot answer his final question what door am at and that gets her killed that scene works because in normal horror half the things that happen in that scene would never happen the plot is typical horror stuff sidney prescott an impressive neve campbell an attractive young high school student who is mother was killed year ago tommorrow is being stalked killer who is previously murdered one of her classmates casey naturally and everybody in this small california town is suspect including sidneys boyfriend billy loomis but as said before these people know how horror movies work and that is what makes it so appealing that and the references horror movies like when casey says the first nightmare on elm street was scary but the rest sucked is obviously director wes craven who does good job of poking fun of the genre that made him legend patting himself on the back as he directed the first nightmare movie and none of the others and when tatum sidneys friend mentions the director wes carpenter is obviously an homage writer kevin williamson not only craven but also director john carpenter the cast is well chosen neve campbell pulls off good heroine and unlike most horror heroines she can act drew barrymore does good janet leigh impression for what little time she has in the and david arquette is impressive also good and funny in his role is henry winkler the fonz as the school principal took half point off for the unnecessary albeit limited appearance friends courteney cox as reporter gail edwards sidneys rival because she covered her mothers disappearance hate that show hate those actors they are untalented overexposed and overpaid imho and would think wes craven is smart enough know those actors are overexposed enough but suppose he is not

paraphrase song title from an earlier disney movie mulan is whole new world the mouse factorys latest feature is treasure featuring magnificent animation strong story and finely drawn characters mulan is the story of fiesty headstrong young woman who unlike other disney heroines is not seeking her prince charming mulans motivations are simple save her father serve her country and find place for herself in world in females have no say the story of mulan takes place in ancient china at time when the huns have invaded the nation the emperor has called for conscription one man from each family join the army and defend the nation mulans crippled father is called but mulan sneaks off steals his armor and takes his place mulan is saga of courage and selfdiscovery yet despite the grim backdrop of war it is lively tale of selfreliance and brainoverbrawn that even the smallest child can appreciate and enjoy the movie utilizes strong corps of asianamerican talent as the voices for the main characters including the wonderful mingna wen the joy luck club as mulan d wong as shang mulans commanding officer and later love interest pat morita as the emperor and the veteran soontek oh as mulans proud but loving father also adding the proceedings is eddie murphy as mushu the dragon sent mulans ancestors watch over and help the young woman his fast wisecracking hiptalking mushu may seem out of place but it is crowd pleasing performance especially for the youngsters the movie features only couple of songs fewer than most previous disney animated flicks but mulans are winners the music matthew wilder and lyrics david zippel fit nicely into the plot the overall score jerry goldsmith also is plus mulan is treat more powerful than hercules more heart than the hunchback of notre dame at about minutes mulan moves rapidly and will hold the attention of youngsters from beginning the end mulan will set new standard future animated efforts disney and other studios will have work hard attain also it is hoped that the success of mulan and there is no doubt that it will prove be popular vehicle will spur an interest for more movies oriential or asianamerican themes so as provide more substantial roles for the talented performers who gave their voices for this production it would be nice see them on screen as well as hear them committed lifelong learning through effective communication

as revolutionary war hero in the patriot mel gibson provides another macho man performance for audiences you know the type his shirt is always shredded his face always scarred he has soft spot for his loved ones and kill list for his enemies oscarhungry directorexecutive producer roland emmerich did not intend but he made the stereotypical action hero for the th century as gibson delivers lines like before this war is over am going kill you schwarzenegger in commando or stallone in cobra immediately come mind oddly enough the patriot is as much an epic threehourtearfest like gladiator as it is ninetyminute guilty pleasure at times absorbing at others enjoyably insipid this is good bloody summer fun probably would have despised this had it not been released over the july th weekend some of the images are so zealously americanized the flag is used as lifesaving weapon for example that independence day seems the only appropriate time of year wholeheartedly accept it like emmerichs id this is obvious propaganda where the americans are the hapless underdogs motivated freedom for all sure it is predictable and melodramatic but for moment after leaving the theater was dumbfounded patriotism and is not that the point of the patriot gibson plays benjamin martin the lionized french and indian war veteran who at the beginning of the is emotionally suffering after his loving wife passed away he is left father seven children at his south carolina estate along black servants not slaves as the revolutionary war rumbles miles away martin swears keep his family close and away from the battlefields but when the oldest son enlists anyway and another is murdered wicked redcoat colonel jason isaacs martin quickly decides save the day or save the fate of america as presented emmerich forming band of aggressive farmers and using guerilla tactics considered unfair in the art of war martin becomes the number one target of the british army the best parts of the patriot are the scenes in martin and his rugged militia men outsmart the british armies left and right every time the farmers attacked the unsuspecting enemy see the disbelief on british general cornwallis tom wilkinson face was priceless entertainment and as the tension gradually formulates the running time final battle is inevitable as for the numerous battle scenes they are expertly done clearer and more realistic than those of gladiator the gruesome images are what give this an rating you really get sense of how warfare was performed during that time period everything is performed in an orderly but still quite gory fashion one side shoots then the other side then the remaining soldiers charge it is organized strategic and according martin ineffective there is very interesting contrast between the traditional battle style and martins takenoprisoners method what drives martin these supposedly unfair actions are the originally brutal tactics of colonel tavington played wonderfully jason isaacs tavington is the type who loves glare down from his horse at civilians who nervously avoid eye contact this character is viciously evil he kills women and children and then laughs about it on the way home even his eyes are evil his portrayal has sparked some controversy in britain some claim that he falsely represents his countrymen as cowardly and sadistic disagree this accusation tavington does not represent his country his unnecessary executions shock his own colleagues and even anger his general besides tavington the redcoats remain stick figures that are neither glorified nor patronized and stick figures make the easiest enemies in these kinds of movies why give the audience reason love the bad guys heck why not spend the entire glossing up the good guys the patriot is three hours of fictional fireworks an action hero seeking revenge and comic book villain ready take him down it is lethal weapon for the colonial times god bless america and god bless the patriot

if there is beast in men it meets its match in women too starring sarah patterson angela lansbury tusse silberg david warner directed neil jordan written jordan and angela carter from story carter cinematography bryan loftus in recent years there has been trend in the field of fantasy writers have been revisiting the fertile world of myth and fairy tale and reclaiming that world investing it new life and energy in modern times fairy tales have become disneyfied and debased they have become trite adventures involving leering witches friendly dwarves and cuddly talking animals but in their original forms fairy tales have dark wicked edge crows tear out the eyes of cinderellas sisters gorier fate then they receive in the animated version hansel and gretel relish cooking the witch in her own oven writers have become fascinated the bloodier morally ambivalent aspects of fairy tales and are now modernizing the old stories while simultaneously going back their roots before this trend was in vogue angela carterwhose stories always have dark wicked subversive edgehad been reinventing fairy tales for years in the company of wolves she and neil jordan retell the story of red riding hood enlivening it werewolves rolls royces and visit from satan the story is structured as dream occurring in the mind of rosaleen sarah patterson an adolescent girl about whose real life we learn very little within the dream there are number of inset stories most told dreamrosaleens grandmother angela lansbury and these tales gloss the central story in intriguing suggestive ways the result is surprisingly successful example of sinister contemporary fairy tale say surprisingly because there are so many ways this could have gone wrong and there are ways in it does the performances are mediocre except for lansburysshe finds the right note for the prim applecheeked granny the wise and stern teller of cautionary tales the soundtrack synthheavy reminded me of bad horror movies as did the special effects in the shapechanging scenes probably stateoftheart at the time they are now laughable but jordan succeeds at what consider the trickiest aspect of the he transcends the poor actingmusiceffects and conveys sense of the fantastic of otherness one of the problems in adapting fullblown fantasies is that fantasy is often best left the imagination of the reader rather than being subjected the realism of the screen part of me would love see an adaptation of the lord of the rings but on the other hand know that any filmmakers recreation of ents hobbits and balrogs is inevitably going be really lame compared what picture in my mind this makes jordans accomplishment here seem mighty impressive me he imbues the company of wolves genuine sense of magic and mystery the somewhat ruritanian dreamworld becomes kind of urreality the sunshine is exceptionally warm and abundant the nights are quiet and misty and eerie and ghostly the peasant village is rustic and cozy the woods old and hoary this archetypal realm is the setting for smart subtle literate script script is as good as you would expect from jordan himself an accomplished fiction writer and carter for carter the cauldron of story is witches brew bubbling over primal ingredients mistshrouded forests ancient graveyards virginal girls and wise women wolves glowing eyes she adeptly blends them all together there is symbolic richness the everything is permeated sense of significance the point of it all think is represent girls ritesofpassage on an unconscious primordial level nightjourney through the forest from the village the grandmothers home is the crux of the company of wolves do not stray from the path rosaleen is told again and again and the path is both literal and figurative the path through the forest and the path of life staying on the path is the conventional approach suggested rosaleens elders carter and jordan never conventional explore what goes on when you leave the path those who stray will supposedly meet dark fate this fate is literalized in the dream as werewolves but the werewolves connote many things death sex knowledge if straying from the path leads death then it is not good ideabut if that is what you have risk get sex and knowledge and therefore power then maybe it is worth the risk when you leave the path the world becomes dangerous ambiguous place but it is full of potential and it is certainly more interesting than the disney version

contrary the title the boxer is not another rocky story only this time spliced some cold hard politics it is actually three movies in one political boxing and love story all of these work in their own respects and have some pretty decent balancing betwixt the three elements of the story but somehow it seems kind of cliched and unoriginal we have seen it all before and we are just not blown away it like we should be oh well it is still an excellent irish story the boxer of the title is danny flynn jim sheridan staple daniel daylewis an exira member who gets out of belfast prison after years and finds out that his troubles are far from over first off the ira is having small civil war between its leader joe hamill brian cox and one of its subleaders harry gerard mcsorley both having opposing views on getting many of their members out of jail while this is going on danny and his old drunkard buddie ike ken stott who played the chief inspector in danny boyles shallow grave reopen an old gym allows the two opposing religios sects protestant and catholics work together danny not only begins teaching kids how box but has stayed in great shape whilst in prison and is ready start boxing real people again and danny runs into his exlove maggie breaking the waves emily watson who has not seen him since he went in they do not easily start up their romance again because she is the wife of prisoner whom she married during dannys tenure in prison and also has son liam ciaran fitzgerald from him whom liam is hoping will get out soon but the two are slowly redrawn eachother again and this begins complicate things the political story is nothing really special but works in itself we have seen it many time before but it is at least interesting sometimes emotional and even riveting at times there is big riot towards the middle of the is frightening in its brutality and honesty the boxing story is very minor the story but does represent people coming together fight eachother fairly and even good sportsmanship there are only few boxing scenes but they are never like raging bull let usstripdownthesporttoitsbones brilliant they are more realistic and instead of bone crunching we hear the sound of the gloves hitting eachother is slightly unerving at times and did not know daniel daylewis was in such good shape but the backbone of the story is the love one because these characters are given such horrible circumstances and since the two leads have such great chemistry together we really feel for their plight as the goes on and circumstances get worse and worse the characters have make real human decisions and we can sympathize them as humans not characters this is how you write love story take note these elements are pretty much equally balanced each of the parts of the stories working handinhand eachother loved how each of the different parts of the plot mattered and sometimes spilled over into the next it made sure that we did not just care for one of them am not saying they are all equally great because the love story really carries the but at least they all work out respectively the acting is amazing daylewis and watson giving excellent performances and showing great chemistry am not sure if they are oscarnominee bound but they are very good in the supporting roles billy cox is greatly sympathetic as the ira leader losing control of his daughter and his workers but the is stolen acting wise ken stott as ike who is just great scene stealer the direction and cowriting jim sheridan the other cowriting credit going terry george is excellent rounding out the characters well but not pacing everything greatly noticed that the first half was very leisurely yet fascinating but the second half whirls at quick pace and ends much too quickly more time could have been spent thinking up the ending since it does seem quite sloppy though the boxer is good it never achieves the greatness that it should sure it is masterpiece compared most of the drivel we usually get but on it is own it just could have been better but it still works out gives us great love story combined political and boxing drama and features great acting even if it could have been better thisll do

you do not want be like mike mike has been doing badly embarrassingly bad he broke up sixyear relationship six months ago move from y a and he is still not over her as result his jokes fall flat when he tries impress and he is comedian well an unemployed comedian one of hollywoods little fish and it has gotten so bad he is asked for an application at starbucks actually the starbucks thing gets even worse and worse you will not fail like mike however played endearingly jon favreau swingers revolves around mikes halfhearted and awkward efforts get back in the social swing of things this end he is enthusiastically assisted his equally underachieving twentysomething actor friends such as trent vince vaughn the films most animated performance who has the gift of gab bordering on the disturbing side of motivational speaking guntoting sue patrick van horn and rob ron livingston who once played hamlet but now longs work as goofy in disneyland but does not succeed because of his lack of theme park experience together they talk about women how make eye contact involves avoiding it and when call so as never appear desperate two days being industry standard after talking the talk they walk the walk strutting like the cool swingers they aspire be always laughable effect get mike out of his funk his friends persistently convince him get outside whether it be quickie night trip seedy vegas casino or cutthroat party the beautiful people or s swing lounge everywhere they encourage mike look for replacement honey and then keep vigil over his progress or lack of it like dotty doting parents mike never leaves their company without being the recipient of their confidence cheerleading you are money mike and the honeys know it or equipped their eccentric dating philosophies such as an analogy of flirting the bear and the bunny the unwavering support of friends like these maybe mikes not doing too badly after all favreau also doubled as the films screenwriter and he proves he has the gift for creating engaging characters and witty banter that goes beyond todays bon mot there is reassuring honesty the friendships even when it hits its low points and the friends commiserate when mike gets the gumption look for love you will join his cheerleading section as well swingers is light unassuming fare sweet candy you will want bust your gut laughing again and again

america has finally gotten what it is needed for years compassionate sincere president impressive ethics and charisma regretfully it is only movie president james marshall harrison ford is fed up terrorist activities teaming up the russian government he orders strike force capture of alexander radek reactionary general ready reunite the soviet union under his fascist reign during celebration dinner marshall announces the world that he will send troops fight oppression wherever it exists it is your turn be afraid he declares returning home on air force one he gets the chance demonstrate his words personally ultranationalist militants loyal radek and lead ivan korshunov gary oldman hijack the plane threatening kill hostage every half hour until the general is released marshall has chance escape in jettisoned capsule clinton says does not exist in real life but refuses preferring stay and fight director wolfgang peterson das boot in the line of fire outbreak takes the overused die hard theme and gives us something new in that combines brilliant acting holdyourbreath intensity if you can take your eyes off the screen steal look at the audience everyone is totally engrossed the two actors do what they do best and they are probably the best there are at it oldman has become typecast as psychotic sadist and no wonder he does it so well when he engages the teenage first daughter in sensitive conversation about his family and the next minute threatens blow hole in her forehead you know that he is over the edge in the manner that people cause can become you are convinced that young alice could end up terminated at any time when korshonov executes passengers there is frightening reality it the guns in this are deadly weapons not cartoons harrison ford has done one role for several years his mastery of the man in the suit propelled into desperate action is in top form here marshall is medal of honor recipient who now has desk job realistically he is man afraid but not afraid act ford is one of the few actors that could make us believe that the president of the united states could be an action hero indiana jones in the oval office he and oldmans archetypes match up perfectly the other roles also go accomplished actors glenn close as the determined but unsure vicepresident is the picture of an executive forced into position that she is not quite ready for dean stockwell as defense secretary eager for the authority am in charge here is her political nemesis and turns in good alexander haig performance of course the politics are all wrong cowboy president even down his name big guns shoots his way through problems much like the american collective memory of jfks camelot the image is wondrous if you do not look too deep the pulls on the patriotic heartstrings would be too much in any other but they work here no matter what political spin you put on the story the movie is an outstanding one left the theater feeling that there is hope for the countrys future not common belief nowadays now if we only can get ford run for president just because one actor did not work out as chief executive does not mean that different one could not michael redman has lost count of how many years he is been writing this column years years while watching the sunflowers outside his window swaying in the cool breezes

susan grangers review of songcatcher in the midst of this summers fare of dinos revisited and romantic fiascoes there are few thoughtful movies and this appalachian period drama is one oscar nominee janet mcteer tumbleweeds stars as dr lily penleric an accomplished musicologist who back in that prefeminist era was refused full professorship at her university determined prove her worth she ventures deep into the rugged mountains of north carolina where her younger sister elna jane adams runs school there in bear creek she discovers treasuretrove of traditional scotsirish and english folk ballads given unique interpretation the insular locals excited she sends for recording equipment and persuades vinie butler pat carroll and other selfsustaining mountain folk share their musical heritage on her edison phonograph cylinders their music as she puts it is as much part of life here as the air you breathe that is the main thrust of writerdirector maggie greenwalds occasionally uneven cultureclash story is loosely based on olive dame campbells foray through the blue ridge mountains in but there is also some melodramatic romantic spice ornery bearded banjopicking aidan quinn falls for the statuesque passionate songcatcher while elna secretly engages in lesbian relationship colleague katherine kerr am ready buy the soulful soundtrack vocalists like emmylou harris iris dement taj mahal and young opera star emmy rossum who plays pivotal role as mcteers wideeyed prot rated pg there is an intense scene of primitive childbirth on the granger movie gauge of songcatcher is an intelligent extraordinary transported the transcendent power of song

elizabeth is potent historical drama set in england in the mids it is time when stately royal ceremonies are as commonplace as public burnings internally the catholics wage war against the protestants meanwhile spain scotland and france strategize their next moves in the struggle for power little does england know that young woman named elizabeth cate blanchett will be their greatest hope for survival the charts elizabeths tumultuous struggle gain true power over her kingdom as protestant she is the last person any of the catholic royalty would want be queen but her halfsister queen mary kathy burke deathly ill and unable conceive child pleas elizabeth take over the throne mary gives her her blessing on only one condition that elizabeth renounce her faith and uphold the teachings of catholicism across the land once declared queen elizabeth immediately finds herself under assault both her own subjects including the duke of norfolk played steelyeyed grace christopher eccleston and forces abroad slowly but surely the neophyte ruler takes england its reigns and forges new path for her kingdom elizabeth is surrounded keenly drawn cadre of subjects and advisers her closest ally is the mysterious sir francis walsingham geoffrey rush in perfectly subtle performance also on her side is sir william cecil sir richard attenborough her wellmeaning but misguided chief adviser few people she can trust elizabeth must prove her selfworth any way she can even if it means being the ironfisted ruler she secretly despises blanchett deserves an oscar for her performance as elizabeth she portrays the young queen just the right balance of gawky selfconsciousness and shrewd charisma though not classical beauty blanchett is able entrance the viewer just coy smile or an impish smirk she is at home her characters playful tendencies particularly in one scene where elizabeth dances unabashedly childhood friend and lover lord robert dudley joseph fiennes whether fending off unctuous suitors or playing the houses in court blanchetts elizabeth radiates confidence impossible dislike almost as interesting as the character of elizabeth are shekhar kapurs visual delights he and cinematographer remi adefarasin have crafted rich color palette that is feast for the eyes rolling green hills extravagant ceremonial galas dark and foreboding corridors all are depicted real sense of artistic appreciation the castles and cathedrals of europe have rarely been doted on so lovingly as they are here though writer michael hirsts script gets little murky at times and his injections of humor get little overplayed elizabeth pulses the right amount of dramatic and cinematic verve make it just deserving of theatrical viewing as whole the story survives because elizabeths struggle is one deserves attention the time she makes her shocking but very sensible final declaration we are ready bow elizabeth as our own queen

making his directorial debut actor jon favreau brings along his swingers costar vince vaughn for this tale of two mugs on career trajectory nowheresville favreau who also wrote the script is bobby vaughn is ricky day they are construction workers they also are wannabe contenders but neither has had much success their last bout pitted them against each other and was draw leaving bobbys record at these two a notsowise guys also work for max peter falk midlevel mobster who is patient and understanding bobby but who hates rickys guts max has an easy job for bobby fly new york and make simple delivery gangster named ruiz smooth and silky sean combs bobby because of his lifelong friendship ricky pleads max give his pal another chance and let him tag along the big apple against his better judgment max agrees of course ricky motormouth who inserts both feet everytime he speaks nearly screws up everything while bobby tries stay calm and professional ricky begins swaggering and throwing money around as if he was john gotti or tony soprano the constrast in styles and the chemistry between favreau and vaughn is what makes made so enjoyable watch favreau his hounddog face and slowburn personality could be modernday oliver hardy only much wiser vaughn is like someone vaccinated phonograph needle he just keeps yakking and yakking unaware of the havoc he creates yet despite bobbys constant aggravation and agitation his partner bond of affection and loyalty binds them the contrast between the two friends is interesting watch bobby is buttondowned tightlywound always waiting for the next shoe courtesy of ricky drop ricky is mostly oblivious the problems he creates and is genuinely surprised when he comes under attack for his faux paus in new york the two lackeys are like fish out of water stumbling from one situation another trying keep alive combs is elegant cool and lowkey menacing as the gangsta they are sent meet falk is amusing in his small role while famke janssen nearly breaks your heart as bobbys lowlife girlfriend more than anything made is movie heart it is loud obnoxious and very talkative but the cameraderie between bobby and ricky holds the key its interest favreau does commendable job in his directorial debut he is player be watched as he can only improve experience

set in the wild west this carry on centres around the arrival of the rumpo kid sidney james and his cronies in stodge city his dodgy dealings and summary shootings aggravate judge burke kenneth williams so much that he asks sheriff albert earp jon pertwee drive rumpo out of town instead the rumpo kid shoots the sheriff dead therefore judge burke sends for law marshall come in and clean up the city due misunderstanding an english sanitary engineer called marshall knutt jim dale is assigned without knowing it as the law marshall for stodge city he arrives at the same time as annie oakley angela douglas who is seeking revenge for her father the sheriffs murder when marshall arrives at stodge city he soon becomes aware of the misunderstanding and due his rather limited intellect he is manipulated the rumpo kid and always ends up getting things wrong in the end there is headtohead between rumpo and marshall the rumpos past experience it would seem that marshall is out of his depth but using his sanitary skills and learning the ways of the west from annie oakley he at least stands some chance sid james an american accent is perfect as the rumpo kid part suits him down the ground jim dale provides one of his best carry on performances as the stupid sanitary engineer and angela douglas is very effective in her role as the revengeful daughter other regulars that appear in this movie include charles hawtrey and bernard bresslaw in his debut as big heap and little heap respectively big heap is the local indian leader and the crazy casting of hawtrey for this part is very amusing as is his performance he steals every scene he is in even though he does not enter the until thirty minutes past joan sims provides useful and amusing support as belle the local bar owner who takes fancy the rumpo kid however the part of doc played peter butterworth and sheriff albert earp played jon pertwee are not really necessary and pertwees performance is rather poor kenneth williams uses new voice but struggles the weak part of the judge even so this carry on was sid james and kenneth williams favourite very different carry on in that it is played more seriously the actors and possesses more realism than any other carry on the death count is the highest of any carry on sets costumes and action sequences are all very commendable the songs that are included in the movie the title song and annies song are very impressive strange but therefore very interesting carry on not the best of its kind but it is certainly the most distinctive of the series

for example in happy gilmore sandler plays rookie golfer trying beat selfconfident jerk of pro if the star were any other comic that would be enough motivation drive the movie but sandler the rookie also wants win the prize money help his grandma keep her house that extra motive does not make happy gilmore funnier movie it does not really add any genuine emotional depth either in fact the motive is almost totally irrelevant the movie but sandlers philosophy seems be if it is token gesture why not make it nice gesture that is endlessly refreshing in the wedding singer sandler is right on track the fact that he is wedding singer is only superficially relevant the story what kind of wedding singer he is is even less important david spade could have filled the role cynicism and sarcasm he could make fun of the fat ugly or embarrassing people he meets at weddings and the story would be intact but sandler instead brings mature goodness the character he seems really enjoy the people at weddings and treats them as though they were his own family robbie hart sandler does not just sing at weddings he also gets the loners join in and have fun and he smooths it over when someone does something embarrassing he is exactly the man you would want at your wedding the day comes when robbie has his own wedding and he is stood up his heavymetal bride the movie is set in robbie takes it hard he does not sleep he does not eat and he gets punched out at work when he sings love stinks at wedding julia drew barrymore who waitresses all the weddings in town gives him shoulder cry on and an ear talk eventually robbie starts rebounding toward julia he really likes her but she is engaged her fianc is selfconfident jerk do see trend nope just formula who does not deserve her but robbie is too depressed fight for her hand julia seems like robbie too but she cannot leave her seemingly safe and stable fianc for the offchance that robbie might be serious about her you know the story you have seen it million times before there is always new way tell it new lovers new chemistry and new details but it is the same story and sometimes it works the wedding singer works first of all the chemistry between sandler and barrymore is effective actually it is not so much the chemistry between the two as it is each ones own romantic tension sandler captures the forlorn sleepwalking look of jilted man struck an unattainable love barrymore is charming as the girl next door looking for someone serious settle down sparks do not fly when they kiss but they both seem right for each other second their love is mature they are not driven passionate sexual attraction they are cute couple but neither sandler nor barrymore is centerfold material instead they are both looking for someone meaningful someone settle down someone grow old at wedding robbie comforts kid throwing up in dumpster while julia sits the repulsing situation is taken in stride as if the two were already parents caring for their sick child the soundtrack and references play big part in this movie other critics liked this movie in part because of the soundtrack liked it in spite of the soundtrack often the music and references felt forced for example robbie tells his exfianc get out of my van halen tshirt before you jinx the band and they break up ha ha ha get it david lee roth did leave van halen or how about when sammy allen covert robbies chauffeur friend shows up at party wearing michael jackson jacket and get this single silver glove that is exactly what mj used wear all the time unfortunately making fun of generalizations about past era is too easy be rewarding that is not say the movie is not funny screenwriter tim herlihy has written for sandler before billy madison and happy gilmore and the two make good combination herlihy knows what sort of jokes sandler is good at and has tailored the script his straightfaced smartaleck style let us hope herlihy and sandler stick together for few more projects because this movie really won me over barrymores charm and sandlers heart it was hard go wrong

when it is cold molecules are not moving everything is clean these are the essential words of mikey carver elijah wood young teenage boy living in new canaan connecticut in the ice storm when mikey delivers these words bored science class it is unlikely that anyone realizes how much they parallel mikeys life and the lives that surround him his father jim jamey sheridan is rarely seen and his mother janey sigourney weaver is having an affair married neighbor ben hood kevin kline bens wife elena joan allen suspects the affair but does not say anything meanwhile bens yearold daughter wendy christina ricci continuously lures mikey and his younger brother sandy adam hannbyrd into sexual explorations tobey maguire plays paul hood the yearold narrator of the story who also happens be the least prevalent character we start the an interesting outlook on family from paul he compares family the fantastic four comic book and even goes so far as say that family is everybodys own antimatter something everybody will return eventually and the farther you go the deeper you will return the ice storm is character piece that explores dismal time both in america and in the individual lives portrayed in the movie everything parallels everything else the young teenagers trying discover who they are thru drugs sex and alcohol is really almost identical the parents trying figure out the purpose in their own lives using the same methods when it is cold outside the molecules are not moving everything is clean everything is clean because nobody will admit what is going on even the president is on tv denying his wrongdoings how can you expect anything more out of couple of suburban families riding the coattails of sexual revolution all the sex and drugs is so obviously empty and think that is the point of the at first viewing the entire movie might seem empty but then why should not it parallel itself you do not get know the characters very deeply but think that is because nobody in the movie knows each other either we sadly watch two families go about their lives nearly oblivious one another at first glance you might think emotion is lost in the ending scenes because you have not gotten know the characters well enough sympathize then you realize that just might be the point and then you do feel the pain the acting all is quite good but particularly liked elijah wood he does not seem be receiving as much recognition as the others but still found him possess quite real sense of being christina ricci is being acclaimed for her part as the misguided teenage temptress who looks for something more her life in the pants of every available boy still say hats off remain wood joan allens subtle but believable performance as lonely unappreciated wife and the always excellent kevin kline tobey maguire did fine job but his character perhaps was the most intact sensible person in the story seemed little lost he was needed but perhaps he should have been used more the ice storm is being hailed many as one of the best films of the year hate say that do not agree but do not in fact can think of many other films that would rank higher than this one even so it is very good it takes lot of retrospect fully appreciate it is art but when you finally start seeing things in it that you did not before you start grow even fonder of the characters and the story perhaps this is one see ponder and then watch again different eyes

the end of the affair is dark and moody romantic period piece that neil jordan exquisitely writes and directs although it is slow and sometimes confusing follow it still manages give audiences moving experience based on graham greenes novel of the same name the mainly follows characters there is maurice bendrix ralph fiennes who has an affair henry miles stephen rea wife sarah julianne moore sarah finds henry be bore because well he is just normal guy it is all work and no play him while maurice on the other hand falls madly in love sarah and would do anything for her unfortunately the two break up this is all witnessed in serious of flashbacks so that leads us the present it is few years later and they both still think of each other so maurice hires private detective ian hart see what sarah is up too while this may sound straight forward it is not it is deep dark tale of the jealousy that lies in the two men unhappiness and the ever lasting love all this may sound like drag but it really captures your interest great performances ralph fiennes doing another english patient type of only this movie is better and julianna moore who definitely deserves an oscar because out of all films she did in believe this was the role she had the most passion for and you can see why the story was also well written thanks neil jordan even though did not read the book there is no doubt in mind that it was just as moving and descriptive what is so moving about it you ask the tragedy of it all it is not the typical romance in guy finds girl they fall in love and all is well this is more complicated and depressing it really shows the complexity of relationship because nothing is ever perfect everyone feels different way and that is what tears us pieces back neil jordans script it was not only red roses there were times when felt it too be little slow but most romances are it also tended be bit confusing especially at the start it keep jumping around from past present so it obviously took awhile get grasp of things also notable was the superb direction neil jordan would have say this is his finest achievement date because quite frankly have never really found his work be up par it just never did anything for me until now when it ends it leaves viewers little saddened but provoked nonetheless this is definitely one of the best films of and had some of the best acting most notably moore not for all movie goers but for those who are buffs and want something of value

titanic is without doubt the best movie have seen all year and believe me am not an easy critic impress the english patient was too long men in black was overhyped and several of the big summer releases were dead in the water thank god this got delayed until december it is my christmas present titanic is in the tradition of the old epics of yearsgoneby and it is truly stunning while watching this picture you are completely mesmerized never taking your eyes off the screen nor checking your watch see how much longer it is gonna last despite its hour plus running time as friend of mine who is true titanicbuff said if someone does not like this it is because they did not want truer words are hard come of course it does not hurt that this comes from one of my favorite directors james cameron who is unarguably the greatest action director of all time if you wish argue that point me look at his list of credits the terminator aliens the abyss terminator true lies etc still care disagree not only has cameron helmed the directorial duties of this he also wrote produced and edited it and show his true faith for the project he renenged all directing fees and percentage points ease the budget costs it is obvious he truly loves titanic the opens footage both real and fake of an underwater excursion special submarines the bottom of the atlantic where team of explorers lead bill paxton are searcing for diamond called the heart of the ocean according bill paxtons character would be worth more than the hope diamond today their search turns up dissapointly no diamond but instead drawing of young woman wearing the diamond this picture is broadcast on cnn and is seen year old woman named rose who claims be the girl in the picture she is flown out sea meet bill paxton and tell them about the diamond almost all of the rest of the movie is her narration of the past roses narration shows us how she was an unhappy young girl engaged rich man named cal hockley billy zane that she did not want marry her mother is pushy and obnoxious and cal hockley is arrogant they are boarding the titanic is sailing america and this is where she is marry cal meanwhile young man named jack dawson leonardo dicaprio and his italian friend danny nucci win two rd class tickets aboard the titanic in poker game they are overjoyed and rush aboard just as the boat is leaving for them this is their ticket america better life for rose she is sailing her doom the first hour and half or so of titanic tells the story of how rose dewitt kate winslet and jack dawson fall in love it is the classic wrongsideofthetracks story and does sometimes resort few cliches but as said above the love portion is not sappy and does not weigh the down as some critics have said it is sweet and it did not make me restless at all despite the fact that usually hate love stories of course it might help that cameron introduces some pretty interesting characters help keep our eyes glued the screen most of these people actually were passengers on the titanic back in including the enigmatic molly brown played the talented kathy bates the captain of titanic bernard hill and so on all of these characters add an extra depth the and make it that easier watch of course things really start get going after the hour and half mark where the titanic strikes the iceberg and begins slow sink the bottom the sinking is depicted realisticly and the effects are truly amazing it is not told in heroic fashion sense either as people are portrayed as panicking pushing others aside get on the limited lifeboats and drowning and dying horrible deaths the best part of the movie in my opinion comes at the very end when we flash back the future the crew who at first had been skeptical of roses story now are totally aborbed her rose goes out onto the ships ledge and we then learn secret about her that catches us off guard we then see dream of roses in she returns the titanic and is dancing jack dawson most people talked after the movie saw this as only dream however think it symbolized more think it meant that rose had died and is going sort of heaven would be the happiest part of her life her and her one true love jack if anyone has seen the movie and would like voice an opinion about this email me at venomhotmail com

sometimes you just have tip your hat sometimes you just have jump on the bandwagon and enjoy the ride saw the truman show an audience full of teenagers most of whom were no doubt drawn ace ventura himself and hoping see his latest take on fart jokes surprised they may have been when they realized that this picture actually had something say but the attentiveness of the crowd would say they were won over as was i cannot tell yet if truman really is that good or if it only seems that good in comparison the awful mountain of crap spewed forth from the bowls of so far this year time alone will make that call but the end of the we were all on truman burbanks side we were concerned for his wellbeing and wanted him win that we felt as we did is tribute both the and jim carrey who has achieved legitimacy at last the truman show is best viewed cold as little foreknowledge as possible about the plot unless you are under media blackout however you probably know the basics carrey stars as truman burbank capraesque everyman insurance agent living his beautiful wife meryl laura linney in the south florida island town of seahaven looks like michael eisners idea of the perfect american small town truman would seem live the perfect middle class lifestyle complete working wife best bud friendly neighbors and interesting coworkers there is tragedy in his past his father drowned in horrible boating accident leaving truman dreadful fear of water and of travel in general but overall life is good but then one day as truman leaves his house for work klieg light falls magically from the sky this curious event may lead truman discover what the rest of the world already knows that he is prisoner on the worlds biggest soundstage that his wife friends and relatives are all actors paid interact him and that his life has for over days been broadcast as the worlds most popular television program what makes the first hour of truman so enjoyable watch is the magical verisimilitude
