the first thing you notice about this movie is that it is cold placed in minnesota and north dakota during the winter many of the scenes take place outside long scenes of snowcovered ground against background of white just what we need as bloomington struggles out of the endless long cold night as most coen brothers films this features outlandish characters in nefarious schemes each of works out in the oddest way possible car salesman hires couple of hoods kidnap his wife so that he can collect the ransom from her father along the way everything that can possibly go wrong does in brief scenes of vicious violence people get shot through the head in the back face chest and various other areas of the anatomy there is also one of the most unpleasant body disposal scenes yet seen on the screen remarkably enough most of the movie is played for laughs even more remarkably it works the only likable person in the is the very pregnant sheriff frances mcdormand who hunts down the killers while eating at every possible opportunity every good the audience gains new knowledge here you learn _two_ things everyone in minnesota speaks in an annoying whining accent that would drive you crazy and do not do violent illegal business lowlife amoral degenerate scumsucking losers oh yeah if you get shot in the face using brightly decorated napkin stop the bleeding just makes you look goofy

plot odin is great high school basketball player he is dating hot girl and the coach loves his ass in fact the coach even admits having fatherly feelings towards him unfortunately the coachs real son hugo is not too pleased hear that in fact he does not like hearing about any of odins triumphs as they generally supersede his own so what does he set out do well let us just say that he starts mess peoples heads and one thing leads another thing leads well you will see critique very powerful thoroughly depressing wellacted nonteen movie starring bunch of teens credit director tim blake nelson for creating modern day version of this shakespearian classic set in realistic high school environment the basketball championships as the backdrop and an impending sense of doom as it core you also have give it up all of the actors in this who turn over some very convincing performances taking you through all of their characters ups and downs hartnett especially should be applauded for taking on such despicable character dude who you just want grab the throat and beat the shit out of sign of good actor if you ask me phifer also comes play in this movie nice blend of charisma fear love and anger spread over his character was always on this guys side and definitely felt sorry for him as things moved along julia stiles was also good but her character was not much different from others that she is played recently was however very surprised martin sheens showing since had not taken him too seriously as an actor over the past few years his character is definitely overthetop in this but appreciated his fervor his rage his ultimate and blind desire win above all great example of workaholic man who cannot see the trees from the forest did have few reservations about the movie though first of all what was all of the gangsta hiphop music used in pretty much every other scene transition it was cute at first but became little too obvious and annoying after few times the was also edited pretty choppily like some scenes were cut out and no one cleaned it up afterwards also did not like the fact that hartnetts character the man behind much of the nastiness that goes down in this was infallible in other words pretty much everything he says or asks of someone happens automatically and without any goofups mean know the guy is smart and all but would have appreciated little more realism under some of the circumstances but overall the movie will devastate you it is not fun date movie it is not movie about the high school basketball team and how its black star falls for the white girl from the other side of the tracks it is about jealousy love envy fury passion revenge and pretty much any other negative thought that is ever passed through your head is it worth seeing oh most definitely pun intended it is moving picture great performances no shakespearian speak thank you god and an outstanding directorial job nelson the final scene alone is enough send massive chill down your spine and was especially impressed the directors choice of music near the end in fact the whole sequence was quite reminiscent of the final showdown scene from taxi driver and guess that is saying something right there where is joblo coming from things hate about you election hamlet loves labors lost natural born killers save the last dance shakespeare in love

defending your life is an imaginative vision of the afterlife from the twisted mind of writerdirector albert brooks who also stars in the comedy after dying in car crash on his birthday of all days brooks wakes up in judgement city satirical rendition of purgatory where higher beings evaluate the lives of newly deceased earthlings brooks has five days convince two judges that he is worthy of passing on higher plains of existence enter rip torn as the slick lawyer who defends brooks in court against prosecutor lee grant during his trial brooks must view episodes of his life on movie screen and these scenes are both hysterically funny and painfully poignant it is impossible resist chuckling and cringing at brooks as he and torn try explain away his cowardly behavior on earth torn in particular is in vintage comic form and he walks away the picture the movie also features meryl streep appealing as the loveinterest and shirley maclaine who pops up in hilarious cameo while the is uneven many of its gags are price less take for example the food in judgement city it is always the most delicious you have ever tasted and it is also caloriefreeso chow down

jake kasdan son of one of the best screenwriters around breaks into filmmaking writing and directing this hardtocategorize detective story part mystery part comedy part character study and part romance for the most part kasdan manages combine the genres successfully and create captivating daryl zero bill pullman is modern day sherlock holmes the parallel is present down his love of music though zero plays the guitar rather than the violin and his addiction drugs amphetamines rather than morphine he even titles his cases such sherlockian epigrams as the case of the mismatched shoelaces the case about the man who lied about his age or the case of the hired gun who made way way too many mistakes however zeros observance of the fine art of detachment though it makes him brilliant private investigator makes him somewhat of selfimposed outcast in society he could do nothing without the legwork of his trusty assistant dr watson mean steve arlo ben stiller arlo is not happy his job he is thrilled be around zeros brilliance but his bizarre behavior and strange requests are frustrating the former lawyer and they are even more so his girlfriend jess angela featherstone who is fed up that her boyfriends boss means more arlo than her this is the situation when new case comes knocking gregory stark ryan oneill hires zero find his lost keys it seems that he kept safety deposit box key on the ring and the box apparently contains some incriminating evidence now stark is being blackmailed and needs reclaim his key before the nightmare can end solve this case zero reluctantly crawls out of his shell however this is when he is vulnerable and this time he falls for charms of wily paramedic gloria sullivan kim dickens who may be involved in the blackmail scheme for the first time zero has question his own objectivity as he finds his client less and less sympathetic zero effect is weakest in its obviously wacky scenes depicting daryl zeros odd behavior such scenes might be appropriate in an outandout satire making zero an ace venturaish character however there is much meatier movie in here it just takes while get out that is not say that there is not place for humor in this in fact some of the best scenes are ben stillers wonderfully underplayed comic moments of absolute disgust and frustration his employer however the overthetop scenes never quite gel the rest of the and they are not funny enough stand on their own once the investigation is underway however zeros brilliance really begins shine his lightning quick inferences are as fascinating as many of sherlocks own as the mystery begins unfold zeros deductions lead the plot in interesting directions but never lose the viewer zero effect works well during its romantic scenes as well zeros relationship gloria is lowkey but it hits all the right notes however we are always kept distant from glorias character she is given plenty of development but we never understand what she is thinking perhaps that may be intentional place the audience in zeros zone of detachment but on the whole it is frustrating bill pullman when he is not spacing out creates vibrant character in daryl zero there is one moment when zero briefly connects the world he has managed detach from for many years and it is shockingly moving expressing seriousness that heretofore was unassociated the character but one fits in well and although it is sometimes hard take detective called zero seriously it is at this moment that the viewer understands the meaning behind the name although zero effect is bit awkward in places it is strong debut for kasdan and shows great promise

well will be damned what most excellent surprise not be confused the campy and far inferior remake starring exporn star traci lords this more recent attempt at remaking the drivein schlockfest not of this earth is real gem and was quite possibly the best scifi flick of once again bmovie king roger corman is behind this effort he directed the original but this time he appears only in the role of executive producer the rest of the crew and cast are relative unknowns it seems criminal that the was released direct video in most countries because it is an absolute mustsee for scifi fans and treat for anyone who enjoys decently acted and written thrillers kooky bent the plot in brief paul johnson michael york is an alien posing as an eccentric millionaire who though needing kill people live is visiting earth for far from selfish reasons his race is dying of mysterious blood disease and he desperately is trying find cure the key of lies in the blood of humans he visits and soon puts under his spell the respected blood physician dr rochelle whom he hypnotises into doing secret research on his behalf he also has the doctor convince smart and sexy nurse amanda elizabeth barondes move in johnson as his private nurse so as give him the blood transfusions he constantly requires but before long amanda and johnsons sleazy chauffeur release that johnson is lot more than just eccentric must admit my first glimpse of the video cover for not of this earth was not encouraging british actor michael york has appeared in some real stinkers in past few decades far cry from the quality fare of his younger days such as caberat but his performance here as an alien in human disguise is nothing short of outstanding the weird twitches and bizarre modes of speech the dapper clothes and cool spectacles the unexpected pathos he invests in his character york is turns hilarious menacing and tragic this is tourdeforce and quite simply the best performance have seen from him and while obviously made on modest budget the boasts enormous strengths the casting is spot on the acting is terrific and the script is intelligent witty and consistently engaging cleverly updating the original the balance of horror and humour is just about perfect marked contrast the earlier remake from the does not drag for second of its minute running time thanks tight editing and the sure hand of littleknown director terrance winkless and it does not matter one bit that the special effects are cheesy this is schlock after all even if it is high class schlock in fact my only criticism of the is that things get tad weak towards the end tighter direction could have given the climax more urgency and few of the characters act rather illogically given their lifethreatening situation but these are minor complaints just see it not of this earth is one of the biggest scifi surprises in years and michael york in one cool swoop you have made yourself bmovie legend dude

in director brett ratner and his stars jackie chan and chris tucker breathed new life into the buddyaction genre the crosscultural rush hour the tune of about million you do not mess success so the team is back again and better in rush hour the combo of the terrific physical talents of chan and the nonstop motor mouth of tucker made for an ethnically unusual duet in rush hour that played well audiences around the world the formula worked so well in fact that the sequel was inevitable am never thrilled the idea of followup successful original since they rarely meet the previously set expectations surprisingly rush hour wastes no time getting down business and turns out be better than the flick that spawned it the script jeff nathanson utilizing the characters developed ross lamanna in the first wastes no time getting the point right from the start terrorists have bombed the us embassy in hong kong killing two american translators and chief inspector lee jackie chan is handed the job of solving the crime concurrently his friend james carter chris tucker arrives on the island for some much needed rr and expects his friend spend some time and show him the sights instead lee drags carter into the case and the duo get involved in stopping conspiracy counterfeit hundreds of million of us dollars the makers of rush hour are working at distinct advantage over the original we the viewer are familiar the two lead characters and the alreadyexisting chemistry that chan and tucker developed so well the first time around that chemistry was high point and probably the saving point before and now the pair wears their friendship like comfortable suit little time is wasted in getting know the key players so the screenplay capitalizes on those things we liked best in rush hour first and foremost me in rh is the immense pleasure in watching jackie chans artistry in fight choreography the year old martial arts master has renowned reputation for doing all of his own stunt work and here he does not disappoint chans use of props when battling bad guys continues as he pulverizes his opponents whatever item comes hand such as trash bucket his moves look every bit as good as they ever did as he fights four or five nemesis at once on bamboo scaffolding on the tail end of yacht in hong kong massage parlor and for the finale in las vegas casino like harold lloyd or buster keaton chan takes pride in putting his physical self on the line in pursuit of his artistry and is joy watch chris tucker reprises his role as the motor mouthed la cop carter who teams again lee put down the bad guys when he is unceremoniously pulled from his vacation help his colleague and friend the big case he still looks have some fun when lee goes into karaoke bar the lair of chief bad guy ricky tan john lone and his hoods carter takes the spotlight on stage credible michael jackson riff the comedian made the move from the improv stage the big screen and jackie chan has franchise hang his coat on pay the bills the combo of chans flying feet and fists tuckers fast mouth make duet more endearing than riggs and murtaugh in the lethal weapon films the supporting cast is here move things along efficiently john lone as ricky tan is suave villain who is the real power behind the throne of american bigwig steven reign alan king in walk through performance lone does not chew scenery or make pronouncements get lee and carter but gives the chief bad guy elegance zhang ziyi crouching tiger hidden dragon continues display her martial arts skills as rickys taciturn henchlady hu li who carries on an ongoing battle carter carter has problem through most of the hitting woman but this falls aside their eventual oneonone melee at the conclusion roselyn sanchez is knockdown gorgeous and resembles sandra bullock as undercover agent isabella molina she does not add much the equation but is terrific watch director ratner and the original rush hour production team have assembled crew of skilled craftsmen work behind the camera cinematographer matthew leonetti has had long career of shooting action flicks and gives rh the fluid camera movement the genre needs production design terrence marsh spans continents and gives the right look whether it is in hong kong karaoke bar or high stakes las vegas casino the rest of the techs are of the same high quality am surprised even say that rush hour is the most entertaining of the summer blockbuster movies it takes the best of the first and kicks jurassic dino butt in its fun frolic and fast pace and is the best mainstream thing out so far this summer give it b

shakespeare you hardly understood it in high school why would you want more of it now that your english grade does not count on it if this is your attitude then will say right off the bat that kenneth branaghs hamlet is probably not for you and you might as well stop reading right now if however you are lover of the bard or at the very least are openminded about challenging script read on for there is something rotten in the state of denmark namely the king has died and his widow the queen has wed the kings brother claudius but prince hamlet suspects foul play his suspicions are confirmed when the ghost of his father appears and relates the story of his murder at his own brothers hands hamlet enlisting the help of his friend horatio conspires capture the conscience of the new king expose his treachery and the game is afoot the first things you notice about this production are the sets and costumes external scenes filmed at blemheim palace in england also the one of the sites for the recent the avengers the grandiose quality of the setting is immediately established interior scenes are similarly graced intricate and flamboyant rooms and chambers the hamlet castles grand throne room is an impressive piece of work incorporating high ceilings mirrorpanel doors and bridges connect opposite sides of secondstory loft costuming is equally grand drawing upon both history and imagination not quite the denmark of the the characters attire is something of cross between that era and turn of the century russia very effectively giving the more of timeless feel it is not surprising that tim harvey and alexandra byrne were nominated for best art direction and best costume design oscars respectively in addition directing kenneth branagh also plays the title character as the revengedriven royal heir branagh provides riveting performance of emotional highs and lows from the anticipation of seeing his fathers ghost the melancholy of finding the burial site of his childhood jester his eventual wrath branagh delivers in spades every scene truly revolves around hamlet as much tribute branaghs acting and directing as shakespeares manuscript hamlet seems be who is who of shakespeareantrained actors so watching them perform the craft for they have much love is delight in itself julie christie as hamlet us mother gertrude and derek jacobi as his murderous uncle claudius both fill the classic roles superbly as do many of the supporting players kate winslet as hamlet us lover ophelia does an outstanding job demonstrating the characters plummet the depths of dispair and madness richard briers as ophelias father polonius and michael moloney as her brother laertes are equally convincing nicholas farrell as hamlet us trusted friend horatio and timothy spall and reece dinsdale as the twotiming rosencrantz and guildenstern round out the excellent core cast hamlet also seems be in someone tried stuff as many well known actors as possible in some cases this made for interesting scenes billy crystal is surprisingly good as the gravedigger who unearths the skull of yorick whom hamlet knew quite well crystal proves himself able deliver the lines both the timing of classic actor and the verbal countenance of comedian and the result is very funny scene however charleton heston whom many might think would butcher shakespeare is the biggest surprise of all as the player king the leader of troupe of traveling actors he is absolutely breathtaking when narrating the story of priam and hecuba part of his monologue is overlaid visual enactment of the story sir john gielgud and judi dench but this is most unfortunate for it robs heston of some of the attention he deserves at this time his offcamera speaking while gripping sort of downplays the scene narration done any other wellvoiced actor wish branagh had chosen allow us envision in our own minds the scene heston lays out and let the venerable actor have the attention unfortunately there were some casting choices led poor distractions jack lemmon an excellent actor just cannot do shakespeare as marcellus the guard who sees the elder hamlet us ghost lemmon sadly underperforms and is shown up left and right those around him gerard depardieu another talented actor is wasted when given little more than the utterances of yes my lord and no my lord in the role of reynaldo richard attenborough has literally walkon role showing up at the eleventh hour as the english ambassador think he had two lines then there is rufus sewell as fortinbras of norway when went see dangerous beauty earlier this year two ladies behind me kept commenting about how handsome he was if bulging eyes are your idea of handsome well guess comic actor marty feldman was some kind of sex symbol you hamlet is complicated tale of treachery and revenge in triumph and defeat become one branagh attempts help us out some of the intricacies visually representing some of the more elusive stretches of dialogue presenting them as flashbacktype images this only works about half the time and wonder if it would have been just as well do without them you do not have be some kind of genius appreciate shakespeare but it is quite difficult understand unless you have the time read or hear it carefully and repeatedly the alternate method of comprehension is that most of us are familiar the high school english course in it you are hopefully fortunate enough have an educator willing help you the plot points and nuances essential understanding play written in the rigmarole known as the kings english or suppose you could just read the cliff notes

the year is and the military is conducting nuclear testings involved in these tests is hank marshall jones an army colonel who is critical of the aboveground tests that are being done he urges belowground tests no one will consider at the time until it is learned that the soviets have conducted underground tests of their own marshall is also troubled turbulent marriage carly lange who is topless on the bases beach in full view of the entire personnel hanks reaction is one of amusement he is been here before and he deals it in the only way he knows how the problem is carly is manicdepressive and when she is not flirting any man who happens be near her she is fantasizing about fictious world where she would rather be typical of the mental illness she also is promiscuous and foultempered the mood swings are quick and violent and the torment she puts her husband and their two daughters is considerable from hanks reports state his opposition the armys methods of testing he is transferred from hawaii alabama carly patterns herself after movie stars and tries become marilyn monroe bleachblond and all the new home in alabama is pretty rundown and depressing and sets carly off on violent tantrum after meeting his new commanding officer booth hank sees an all too familiar pattern begin repeat carly openly flirts the co hank tries deal the situation but his only resort is carry her off and throw her into nearby pool arguments ensue the family becomes even more alienated the co is very interested in pursuing an encounter carly and sends hank off observe an underground test causes the irradiation of two local ranchers much the vocal objections of hank who spots them but is unable cancel the detonation of the bomb back at home the two girls try hold things together but they wonder why their father cannot deal their mothers problems one daughter says he is blind and she is crazy the other answers they are perfect for each other it reaches the breaking point when the older girl locane and boy the cos son odonnell see her mother and the co making love in an abandoned shed she forces her mother tell hank and get it all out into the open hank returns home and finds his wife in the middle of musical put on the military wives including the cos wife snodgress he confronts the o but not about carly he is upset over the coverup surrounding the accident during the testing fight breaks out between the two when the co accuses hank of not being able satisfy his wife hank is arrested what follows is manipulation and revenge on the part of the co he convinces carly commit hank hospital for observation instead they fill him so many drugs that he can barely cope he foams at the mouth and cannot even finish sewing leather wallet as presents for his daughters carly is determined free her husband from the clutches of the army and succeeds in doing so only being the strong one in the family for the first time the has an upbeat ending hope that the family has found way deal its problems the performances are solid throughout jones is sympathetic and loving and is most effective in those quiet moments when he tries deal his wifes rage he comforts her and offers protection lange gives strong and spirited portrayal of woman on the edge who draws up the courage try and put things right for her family amy locane is very good as she fights keep her family together while struggling her own doubts as whether she even should blue sky is based on the story of the stagner family the screenplay was written rama laurie stagner arlene sarner and jerry leichtling the marks the final work of tony richardson who died shortly after its completion in he had made such classics as look back in anger and tom jones orion pictures underwent bankruptcy and caused the sit on shelf for three years the joins an alread promising fall lineup of films and is well worth catching for the performances alone
